This keyboard and mouse combo is a killer deal for the price.  I bought this as a temporary keyboard and mouse as I'm doing a gaming PC/music production/game development work horse.  I was extremely surprised and impressed with the mouse especially.  I play CSGO mainly (as it is all I can run on this laptop) and I usually don't fair all that well, I'm usually 1:1 on my K/D ratio and within the first 3 games I went well over 2:1 and a significant jump in overall kills using this mouse and keyboard combo.  Point being I haven't changed anything about my game play and so from a scientific perspective, this mouse and keyboard setup made all the difference in the world.  The mouse fits well in the palm of your hand and has a nice texture for solid gripping during long game sessions.The accuracy of this mouse is incredible for the price, actually not just for the price, it's just that this is an incredible value for the money.  This may end up being a permanent keyboard and mouse for my gaming PC after all.

This keyboard is amazing.  I was hesitant to buy another backlit keyboard after receiving one from a different company last year that was subpar. The lettering wore off quickly and rendered it useless. I was drawn to the design of this one and decided I would give it another try and I am so glad that I did. The colors are vibrant, the patterns and solids give you a wide variety to choose from. I spilled coffee into the number pad, but after a quick dry out it was still fully functional and as reliable as the first day I bought it. I'm happy with this one and when/if it wears out, I would be happy to purchase another just the same. It has nice key spacing and a satisfying clickity-clack when you type.

Ok, well this being my first somewhat gaming Keyboard, I LOVE THE FRAKIN thing.  It is a elegant design with smooth yet coarse design I love using this keyboard in the dark with the "breathe" effect as I game.  There are a few things that should be added to increase its level of awesome.  First of all, the mouse is a 5 level mouse and not a 5 color mouse.  The mouse itself is well designed and smooth to the move, however, I would have liked the option to change the color to the key board.  Second, I would suggest that up increase the length of the risers on the keyboard.  For me they are a little short.Once again, it is a smooth keyboard that reacts very quickly and is well designed.

This product was purchase on 11/24/19 for a back up, it comes from a fairly good manufacturer, don't let that fool you,  this is no gaming mouse or keyboard, starting using mouse 1 week ago, it stopped working light on bottom no longer works.  I expect little more from the keyboard. My fault for not returning it after I open box and saw how cheap it looked, but as I said I have other products from this maker all good.  first thing the mouse started to fail cause you to click multiple time to make it work.  so in less then 4 months I had garbage.  Save your money, or spend a little more, this is just to poor to even consider for a backup.

The keyboard is totally flawless, responsive, good color, love it. The mouse I have one small issue with. The majority of the time it's fine, but every once in a while if you're not holding down the RMB just right, it won't register. This is a problem in fast paced FPS games where ADS is game changing. There's been a handful of times I was on target, only for my mouse to force me out of ADS, and I have to hit it again, not always a big deal, just be aware. Overall, well worth the price.

I find this keyboard as nice as any I've ever had. Keys are right where my fingers expect, easy to push, quick response (I type ~70 wpm), which a quiet but noticeable click - which is ideal for me. Keyboard had a nice weight and deep footprint (front to back), so it feels stable on my lap. The RGB lighting makes it very easy to use, even in subdued lighting, and it's pretty as well of course. I figured I'd just switch to single-light constantly on, but instead I find I really like the rainbow pulse effect. Even the strain relief seems solid - which is where some kbds have failed in the past.

For the price it's worth it. The keyboard and mouse are so far holding up well and mouse works fine without installing the driver's. The only bad thing I come across is that sometimes when I press keys to rapidly the keyboard can't keep up and doesn't register it.Update:

Every now and then i try a different keyboard to spice things up, and I am always disappointed in every keyboard that is not this one. I have tried all the fancy loud clickers, flashy lights, and boojie name brands and this bad boy red dragon still is the champ. There is no competition.... The only thing about it is you sometimes have to get physical with removing key caps for cleaning, but it just shows you the good build quality.No need to fear, the mouse is also amazing quality. Similar to the keyboard this thing seems like it should be 75 shamackaroos. After 2 years of working from home and gaming she is still good as new mechanically. A very small amount of the red paint has worn off from some sweaty gaming sessions but it adds character. Be warned, the only thing is the braided cord for the mouse may get tangled, but that comes with any braided corded mouse so no hate here.

I wanted to get a cool backlit and somewhat clicky keyboard but didn't want to drop 100s of dollars on it since I am not a gamer. I saw this keyboard and it fit the bill. Its got backlit and raised/clicky keys and it was on special price so I thought why not? After using it for a few days now, I have to say I am completely satisfied. Key are clicky but not loud enough like mechanical keys to bother people in the next room. Key color tints can be changed easily and look very nice in a dim lit room. I haven't used the mouse yet since I already use vertical mouse. But overall build quality and experience is completely satisfactory. Recommended for sure.
LOVE this keyboard/ mouse set!!!!!It comes with a little pamphlet!  So make sure you read it!!!!
My purchase was the keyboard and mouse bundle, but each can be bought separately.+  The keyboard is great.  No issues with the keys or feel.  Lots of color options changeable with just keys.

So I bought one of these months ago to use at work and I love everything about it. Then last week I'm told to work from home so I bought another for my new "home office".... not even thinking about the fact that I have an iMac at home. Many features don't work with Mac and you have to reprogram keys from your System Preferences but the basic functions work that way. That's just a simple warning for Mac users if you're a dummy like me, but this really is a great keyboard and mouse that I enjoy using, which is why I ordered a second one in the first place!

Mouse works fine and feels really good in the hands. Programmable buttons are always a plus. They keyboard, however, is a different story. Like many have already said, the general quality feels extremely cheap and even after 5 days of use, a few of the most commonly used keys are sticking or becoming unresponsive. Fortunately, the the mouse alone costs $30, the same price as with the keyboard combo, so it was basically included for free. But, as the price should tell you, don't expect anything of quality from it. It's basically the keyboard equivalent of a McDonald's kids toy. But like I said, it's technically free with purchase of the mouse so if you're just looking for a good quality gaming mouse at a low price point, this is a pretty solid option. If you're looking to kill two birds with one stone and actually keep the keyboard permanently, you're going to be disappointed.

I like the keyboard, I like the lights. There were just a few things that made me rate a 4 instead of a five. I personally like a higher tilt on my keyboard and even with the tilt legs out it just sat too low, i ended up purchasing an item to hopefully replace the notpad i have under it now to give it tilt. The second thing was is the keyboard is slightly more compact than a regular board. However the keays are smooth and I love the feel when you push them. It was very easy to adapt to typing and using this keyboard.The mouse...I LOVE! I love the texture and scroll , just wish it was purple instead of red :p

Nice and comfy keyboard and mouse set. I like the slightly pastel glow and color settings the keyboard comes with, and the mouse has a button built in to increase its DPI if it's moving too fast/slow on the current computer. The only issue with the keyboard and mouse is it does not remember your previous lighting or DPI settings - so it'll reset every time you turn it back on (for the keyboard, that means flashing colors). The mouse also seems a little janky on certain surfaces, but is generally not too bad (I have a different mouse I use normally so this is not a major issue for me).Overall, I found it worth getting this and paying slightly more than a previous cheaper colorful keyboard/mouse set which had problems galore.

Previously for my workplace I used a thick Dell keyboard which worked wonderfully. However, after moving my cubical I got stuck with a really nasty slim dell keyboard. Last coworker must have ate over it. So naturally I wanted to upgrade to something nicer.The material over all is really solid and sturdy. Lightweight like my old Dell but doesn’t feel cheap.

This keyboard works amazing. The keys on this guy are very comfortable. The back lighting features are a great touch. I leave it on rainbow with the blue led over my wsad which works great for me. The lighting isn't distracting. Except for the moving one and the breathing one, those are pretty terrible. All keys worked out of the box. Very smooth feeling and comfortable to use as well.The mouse.... I ended up buying a Logitech cordless G602 that I use instead. When I did use the mouse that came in the bundle it was ok. Felt pretty cheap, very light, decent response. All the buttons worked it just felt like it was gonna break in my hand. It seems like they had a really nice keyboard and they threw in a cheap 4 dollar mouse to make it a bundle. Also the mouse only has red Led breathing lights.
Keyboard looks amazing and works perfectly with my xbox one.

Has plenty of light options on the keyboard. And the mouse has easy to change DPI setting with the push of one button. The only con to this combo would be the Redragon software for the mouse button configuration. You have to look it up on their website and download it, it doesn't have that great of a UI but that doesn't matter much to me. The functionality of both the keyboard and mouse is great!

This keyboard is actually pretty nice, despite it being so cheap. The backlight is programmed VERY intuitively, which I appreciated. You can see all the shortcuts for changing motions and colors on the keyboard with the function button + another key. This isn't a clickety-clack keyboard, so it actually makes for really soft typing, which works great for a more quiet environment. To be honest, it actually has more shortcut keys than my HyperX Alloy Core RGB keyboard. My HyperX keyboard doesn't have a sleep shortcut key on it, but this keyboard has lots of shortcut keys on it, such as: power, brightness, sleep, volume control, search, etc. I gave this keyboard to my wife when I got my HyperX keyboard and I have to say that even she likes it. It's absolutely worth the price and I never had any issues with it. Give it a try if you want a decently nice keyboard for a good price.

Great keyboard, only problem is you guys sent it out in the original box so there was nothing protecting the keyboard. The bottom right corner has a piece missing so, there is damage. I wouldn't have a problem with damage if it was delivered in a protected box, a bit careless. But, other than that everything works perfectly and is a great keyboard, lights up beautifully. I'm amazed at the quality for how cheap it all is. 7/10 (would've been 10/10 if you just sent it in an actual mailing box, seriously everyone could see what the product was on our front step, careless).

Purchased for a PS4 to play Modern Warfare, this keyboard and mouse combo is fantastic for the price.The keyboards button have a soft to the touch feel and require shorter press distance than your standard keyboard. The keyboard is very quiet and has multiple lighting modes with brightness adjustment and you can adjust the speed at which some lighting settings pulse.

I didn't rate it for gaming, as I haven't used it for that, but I love this keyboard.  The feel of the keys and the click are really nice.  My daughter likes it so much that she now uses my computer just for the keyboard!  The mouse is great too, although it took me a minute to figure out all the different buttons on it.  I mainly do school work, so I needed a much more ergonomically designed keyboard than my computer came with.  This one more than fits my needs.  My son is extremely jealous, even though he got a different gaming keyboard for Christmas.

As a writer, I'm at a keyboard most of the day. I'd read an article about gamer gear being the best for ergonomics, so I started looking at keyboards and mice. Then I happened upon this set. My friends are jealous and I find myself turning it on just to stare at the keyboard (I use a laptop, so it's hooked up to a USB extender). The keyboard currently at an odd angle, but I find that this angle seems to work best for my long ago injured wrist. The mouse is just comfortable. I can't say enough good things about this set.

UPDATE: The seller replaced the keyboard for me. The process took a little while. But the result is a MUCH better keyboard. All the keys now work as they should. I would like to thank the seller for taking the time to make this right. If this were the first keyboard I received, I would give this a 5-star rating.I love the look of the keyboard. The lights are dazzling and look great. However, many of the keyboard keys DO NOT work. I have so frustrated, that I have had to remove the keyboard and start using the one I had prior to this purchase. A shame, too. I really liked the keyboard. ;-(

Good entry level gaming gear. Both the keyboard and the mouse have fast responses (no lag time or missed keys/clicks in my experience and are comfortable to use. That being said, they have the minimum of hotkeys/buttons/shortcuts/etc. that a gaming setup would cost. If you're just getting into PC gaming it's a good starter set to see if more complicated sets would be right for you.For the lighting-up, the keyboard is as advertised but the instructions are terrible. You'll have to play with it until you figure it out. There's lots of different options and many of them have different speeds, or you can turn it solid on or solid off. The mouse is only red, only on. I'd prefer it if they both were the same options, but you can set the keyboard to match the mouse.

Product came quickly and functions well so far but I’m giving this 2 stars for 2 reasons. First issue was this item was a Christmas gift for my son and arrived on my door step in just the product box. Not only did my son see it the box was beat up and looked like trash but thankfully the productwas not harmed. My second issue is the description. I’ll take part of the fall on this because on one part of the description it does say the mouse is just red lit. The upper part of the description where I stopped reading says this is an RGB mouse when it clearly isn’t.

This product started to experience issues in less than 3 months of purchase. when contacting the seller about it they proposed a replacement that would have put me 2 weeks without a keyboard. (ship it to them and wait for them to process) As anyone who has to work from home knows, you cannot go 2 weeks without the ability to use a keyboard. I determined I needed to order a new keyboard and requested a refund. Due to the sellers policies they were unwilling to work out a reasonable refund request since it was outside of their 30 day window. Highly unsatisfied and would not recommend this product.

I am a gamer type, but I honestly bought this because I wanted a separate keyboard and mouse for my work from home setup, but something other than a 20 dollar logitech setup / combo.  I have been using this combo for my home office for several months now and I've found they are both very comfortable for my business use.  Are they as fancy as my Razor gaming setup?  No, of course not, but neither do they need to be, and again I really like the feel, particularly of the mouse which as sort of a "power coat" type finish to the top.  I'm weird about my cleanliness, and I hate the feeling of sweat or oil on my hands as I work the keyboard / mouse, the mouse being made of the material it does; does great works to combat my personal oddities.  As far as gaming goes, I haven't really tried them out, but I see no reason not to use them for that purpose especially if you are minding a personal or household budget.  Great buy!

While the keyboard and mouse are fine as a dumb keyboard an mouse this product gets no support from Redragon. There are no drivers so you are not getting anything but a keyboard and mouse which you can get cheaper elsewhere. This product should be pulled or at the very least have a notice at the top that states it is EOL, has no drivers, and is no longer supported by the manufacturer.

I spent days looking and comparing this product with other similar ones. I have never purchased Redragon products prior so I was a little skeptical.  I ended up going forward with it given the amount of positive reviews.The S101 is well worth the investment and it doesn't break the bank.  I actually like it so much that I bought a second set even thought I didn't need to replace our second computer's KB+M just yet.

I've gone through numerous keyboards lately, and the touch of the keys just hasn't felt right.  I like keys that aren't too light as I'm always accidentally hitting a key I didn't mean too.  Or keys that are too short and hard to feel.  This keyboard has a nice semi firm feel to it, not to soft, not to firm and the clicking sound is just right also.  I don't like loud keyboards, but I do like to hear it and this is perfect.The colors look cool at night and I like the adjust ability of the light levels, patterns etc.  Had my concerns about such an affordable keyboard, but I'm super happy now.

I like the keyboard, except like others have said, there are no drivers and the back lighting is interesting, but without any software to control what it does, it's annoying after a while. You can slow down the speed and adjust the brightness with the FN key + the arrow keys, but that's about it. The mouse is another kind of beast. It kept freezing my entire system every once in a while making gaming really annoying. Maybe it's a defective mouse, but I don't care because it kept freezing my system and I went back to my Logitech mouse. This is what I get for not staying with my brand. I'll probably use the keyboard for about a year, go back to Logitech and use this as a back up. I'm never buying anything from Reddragon again.
4 stars because it's a ~30$ bundle, and you're not getting 5star mouse AND keyboard for 30that being said I actually rather like the mouse quite a bit

Ordered this keyboard and mouse combo because my old HP keyboard from 2002 finally perished due to a Diet Dr Pepper spill (RIP). Was surprised they shipped the keyboard with the label directly on the product box and not with a proper Amazon style box but oh well e____e I can't say much on the mouse that came with the set (I think it has adjustable dpi up to 3200 and has a few programmable buttons but doesn't have a finger rest so I avoided it) or instructions (hint: there were none lmao) HOWEVER, this is the best keyboard I've ever purchased at such a low pricepoint. The keys aren't loose and have a solid feel when you depress them and the rgb colours are vibrant and illuminate well. There are many different colours you can set the backlights to which is neat. The whole board is light but feels solid and not cheap by any means. If you're looking for an inexpensive replacement keyboard with anti-ghosting for casual use or even average gaming then this is it. Look no further. You have found a hidden gem without hype marketing overpricing it. :)

Overall, quite satisfied.  Great tactile feel (I'm using it to write this review!), many light settings to please you, and niceWarning: I deducted 1 star, because for the life of me (a) it was hard as heck to find the Windows 10 drivers for this guy, so I could program the buttons for power, dimming brightness on the screen, etc., (b) the hibernate / power button will sleep/shut down my PC, but won't wake/turn on the PC.  (c) When I purchased it, the description said it had macro buttons that I could program to work with my game--no such buttons on this guy (buy it's big brother for $20 more if you want that).

(When I get everything in the studio finished and sett up I will make a Video review)Like the Title says, this is a awesome and cheap combo packaged. it types really nicely and and has good ergonomics, this feels like a $200 keyboard and not a $30 combo kit. the mouse is also good, it has two minor annoyances, one being the sensitivity, it's either not a lot or A LOT. the other is that you cant change the color on it, it always glows red. keyboard has plenty of RGB functions.  I'm not to bothered by this seeing RGB is not my main thing. I just wanted a really nice but cheap keyboard and mouse combo.

Great feel for gaming, LED's are colorful and helpful when doing any task. I do not know much on how to program it outside of the default macros. I keep mine on the solid rainbow color and it looks great. Keyboard feels like there is a slightly deep click, for gaming if you need to click faster, it may feel a bit off, but I got used to it fairly quick and now the clicks feel smooth. Been using it for about 3 months and all works well. I am unsure if the mouse has programable dpi, but the middle button under the scroll wheel allows for a dpi adjustment. Overall great product!

I like the way the keyboard feels. I like how my wrist can rest against it nicely. It was a gift and he does enjoy it very much. I got it cause it's made specifically for gaming. He's starting to game on the PC and he loves it. The mouse works perfectly as well. I recommend it! Especially If you're just starting to game on the PC, or if you're just wanting a great quality keyboard. Came undamaged and functions properly. Though, there's a rating for sound quality.... mind doesn't make noise. Maybe I haven't figured that one out yet though. I've also been using for a little over a month with no pieces falling off. Just thought I'd mention that.

For the price, you cannot beat this keyboard and mouse. I use this for my teleworking business computer and appreciate the ability to set a static back-light on the keyboard (in multiple colors). My kids like the different rainbow displays. My only recommendations for improvement are that the palm rest area be extended out far enough to allow the user to rest their palms and that the keyboard was a little bit wider with a little more spacing between the keys (feels condensed a bit). Believe both of these would help with the ergonomics of the keyboard.
It's OKAY. It is VERY well made, but there are a lot of things I didn't like. Lets talk about the pros.Pros:

Right after plugging the keyboard in I took it for a test spin on a fast-paced FPS & it performed perfectly. The highlight under the standard gamer keys (qwertasdfgzxcvbm) is actually a huge help for those of us who never learned actual typing & have to play in the dark since our spouse is all about "GO TO BED!"My only gripe and loss of one star was this vendor's shipping method. They simply put a shipping sticker on the keyboard box. No shipping box or $0.99 bubble envelope. I arrived home to find a Dragon keyboard box laying on my front porch that may as well had a sign that said STEAL ME! And since it wasn't packed in anything protective, the box took quite a bit of a beating in shipping. I'm only lucky the keyboard & mouse survived to my porch.

Very happy with this keyboard and mouse set, which I purchased for my 11 year old son to use with his new desktop PC. He loves it and raves about the cool LED colors on the keyboard. The keyboard and mouse were pretty much plug and play with no compatibility issues whatsoever. The "feel" of the keys is really great; better than most standard OEM keyboards that come with new computers. What's nice is that not only is the key "bed" backlit with changing LED colors, the keys themselves are backlit and easy to see at night. The mouse "dragon" also lights up red, which my son likes. Both the keyboard and mouse seem to be very durable and high quality. My son has been using it for a few weeks, so time will tell as to how well it holds up. But for now, he's very happy with it, and so am I!

Great keyboard, the texture of it feels nice and cleaner than my last one that originally came with my ibuypower pc. I am moving into the gaming and editing industry and this keyboard and mouse helps me move significantly faster and more accurate than my last setup. The commands to change the colors are easily memorable so you don't have to have the manual nearby. My only dislikes is that the left shift key feels a little tough to push down with your pinky when you are gaming but granted I am not an avid gamer and it is a minor issue and another dislike is that the mouse does not change colors and it is only set to radiate the color red which kinda of puts the idea of my ideal setup. Hopefully this will change in the future but other than that it is a great buy and I am very pleased with my purchase. No regrets here.

I purchased this since I am now working from home and do a lot of computer work. I wanted something to break up my day and have fun with, but still needed something functional. The key strokes on the keyboard are so soft and smooth, it is quieter than my regular ergonomic keyboard. The lighting to it is very nice and there are so many ways to have it. It does take a while to learn which key functions to use to get it to where you may want it, but it is a very easy instruction manual. Since I am not using this for gaming I will say I am really glad that I did read the reviews and purchase this. I did have an issue with one of the keys sticking, but when I contacted the seller they responded immediately and were ever so happy without question to replace it. I contacted Amazon and after scanning my return had my replacement keyboard sent out the same day and received it the following day. I will definitely recommend this to anyone that is looking for a great keyboard and will see what other items they may have to assist with my new home office.

Solid keyboard and mouse combo for the money. Super easy to adjust the lighting for the keyboard and I even like the key binding in the manual to adjust the volume etc. I was a little disappointed you can’t change the color of the mouse from red, so it doesn’t match the rest of my set up but it’s such a small thing and can be replaced! The mouse itself is great, easy to adjust the sensitivity and with side buttons for gamers- though I’m sure you could bind them for other projects too?Comfortable, nice. Maybe could do without the logo printed twice, top and bottom, but otherwise I’m super happy with this purchase. Definitely recommend!

The Redragon S101 keyboard was nice, but it failed 3 months after I bought it.  It's no longer recognized by any USB port, either directly on the motherboard or on a hub.  I get a "USB device has malfunctioned" error when it's plugged in.It started having problems after a PC power cycle, when plugged into my USB2/USB3 hub with power supply.  I moved it to a motherboard port, and it worked for another few weeks; now it won't work on any port, and won't light up.  I've replaced it with a wired Logitech keyboard, which is fine.

This is a standard keyboard. Apart from the lights, it is no different than the standard cramped Alienware keyboard. The lights are bright, but there is no way of having it fix to a pattern or color I like. And there is an issue with the mouse that it freezes for 2-3 seconds when clicked and moved. Pretty, but not really good for FPS games and the like. It'll do for now, but I won't be purchasing Red Dragon again.Edit: I did give up on the mouse after all. I read online to uninstall and reinstall whenever it starts to lag, and after the 4th time, I've had enough with it. Also, I thought it was a stylistic choice, but the period key is a solid black square. That's how it came. Definitely would not recommend.

This is a good combo especially for the price. The only thing I don't like about it is that the lights on the keyboard and mouse don't turn off when the computer is put to sleep. Keys aren't as loud when typing as my other similar key style board. Construction isn't razer quality but it is still good enough where I would buy again and we already have another Redragon keyboard which works well. All in all if your not too picky then I would recommend it.

Purchased a Laptop and needed a keyboard and mouse and bought this combo because of the price. I regret it now because I have honestly used the keyboard a handful of times and the space button gets stuck now. The feel/quality of it also feels really cheap. The lights are cool and work flawlessly and so does the mouse. I have no issues with the mouse, it's actually really nice and use it every time I use the laptop which is maybe once a week and with the feel of this mouse, I think it will last a fairly good amount of time. It has weights that you can customize to your liking, change the speed of the mouse with a button, and two buttons on the left side of the mouse.My honest opinion is it might be a good entry set for new gamers or someone needing a cheap set but with hopes of upgrading in the near future. I wouldn't count on the quality of the keyboard.

Looks and feels great. Unfortunately, the number pad gave out after a month of practically little usage. I now have to use the numbers above the letters on the keyboard now which has greatly slowed down my work flow. :( Every key lights up, just no response when pressing on the number pad. I’m using it on a Windows 10 desktop.*UPDATE: Amazon quickly sent me another replacement but it also had the same issue. I searched online and found the solution. For some reason, in combination with this keyboard, Windows OS changed a keyboard setting to control the mouse with a keypad. After turning of this setting, both Number pads on both keyboards worked. You’ll find this mouse setting under ”Ease of Access” in your Windows OS. I hope this helps someone.
I wanted to love it, this was the first rgb gaming keyboard and mouse I ever purchased. Although I'm not much of a gamer I always wanted one.Pros:

While in terms of raw features it checks the box for an inexpensive RGB keyboard for my 8-year old, certain keys stopped functioning after about a month of couple-hours-a-day usage. For me, it was the 'c' and '3' keys, which are aligned vertically. The manufacturer seemed interested to help solve the problem, but if their initial QC or testing is that bad or non-existent, I'm afraid that getting a new one would probably not fix the problem. The unit wasn't DOA, and we figured out the problem outside of Amazon's normal return window. I went to a slightly more expensive, but mechanical (outemu blue, I think) switch based keyboard. Son like the clicky clicky, I hope that they prove more reliable long-term.

If you can spare two USB ports, this set is a fantastic bargain.  Maybe there's more customization on more expensive gaming keyboards - this is my first step into the field.  However, everything works great and I honestly have no complaints.  It exceeded my expectations so far (A month or two of use so far).2020 Update:

I received this keyboard the first time and the v, b and number pad were not working.  The seller was great and quickly set up the return and sent a new keyboard but there was no mouse...or I thought.  I did end up finding the mouse stuck under cardboard that was crammed in the bottom of the box.  I love the keyboard and mouse so far, but please be aware of your packaging.  It damaged the first keyboard and I only found the mouse when my I went to repack to return the second keyboard as it was stuck in cardboard that was wadded and crammed in the box.

The problem with this keyboard is the lack of software.  The mouse has SW that you can customize the keys.  They keyboard has none.  There are ways to program macros with a function key but  you dont know if it started recording or if it will work the next time you power down.  The colors do not save so when you reboot you get the breathing rainbow that you need to change every time.  EVERY TIME.  Its cheap, it works, it seems pretty solid after 3 weeks.  Ill keep it but its meh for me.

Colors are not as bright and vibrant as pictured. Mouse is red ONLY. There is no software for the keyboard, only the mouse. Keyboard has 6 setting set with key combinations. I have to reset this everytime I restart my computer. You can not lower brightness of the keyboard but thankfully it's not very bright. Mouse is VERY bright. Keyboard feels great. Mouse has multiple dpi settings and you can set I think 6 profiles once you find and download the software. Very disappointed it is only red. Mouse has a thread cord as well. Overall its a great cheaper version of a gaming set.

I'm not a gamer. But being a night-owl, I do tend to work in the dark.  This is the keyboard I'd always wanted but never knew I NEEDED!  Only beef is that there are a few hidden shortcut keys that sometimes foul up simple office work. I also wish I could turn off the "breathing" mode on the mouse. (Instruction manual says you can, but the software is not provided, nor evident.)I love the solid green and solid red features the best, as they are the most compatible with both colorblind-issues and night-time use.
Really cool set, very high quality and a wonderful value for the price.Mouse is super fast and precise, perfect for gaming, no issues at all :)

This is exactly what I was looking for, and I'm not even a gamer (besides WOW occasionally). I wanted a nice desktop keybaord that had both back-lit keys, and quiet operation. I was expecting to spend $60 or & $70 for a quality keybaord. This one has not disappointed at all. It's very quiet and the back-lit key are easily set to a solid color, or moving patterns if that's your bag. Conclusion: it's both quiet and the back-lit keys make it easy to see at night.

I was looking for a nice and affordable keyboard and mouse because I have a tendency to spill things on mine and ruin them. This keyboard and mouse works perfectly fine. I haven't tested them with gaming yet, but I much prefer an MMO mouse for gaming. The rainbow color settings are very pretty, and the multiple light levels are nice.

First unit would randomly turn itself on then on.  Sent it back, second one came in - the shift keys do not work on all keys - right shift does not shift #1 and #2 key, left shift key does not work with Z.  Both keyboards would not let my PC go to sleep - manually or automatically.  PC would go to sleep, then wake up within 3 seconds.  Unplugged keyboard as this started happening right after I got it, PC went to sleep perfectly.  Plugged in another keyboard - no issues.  Not recommended.

First, I have to say I'm in love with this keyboard. I was sleek and I adore the look and feel of the keys. The color combinations are fun too.However, I am hugely disappointed in the quality of this item and with the company itself. After only using two times, I now have a total of 9 keys that refuse to work. I have tried making sure my windows updates are up to date so that my drivers are current. I restarted the computer several times after switching USB ports. I popped off a couple of the non-functioning keys just to see if there was something gunking up the keys (which I doubted because they worked smoothing to the touch). None of these things worked.

I bought this keyboard and mouse set for my first computer build. I use it for office use and gaming. Overall, it's not a bad set. I do a lot of typing, and the keys are quite smooth and feel like a decent quality. I like how the keyboard has pads on the bottom to keep it from sliding around when I'm working (this is something that my last keyboard was lacking). I also like how you can easily adjust the weight of the mouse. I only have two critiques that are rather petty but still brought it down a star.First, the mouse does NOT change color. This is 100% my fault for not noticing before purchase, but it's rather annoying because my computer follows a green theme, and I have a red mouse that clashes with my color scheme. Also, any time the keyboard or mouse is unplugged or if I shut down or restart my computer, the keyboard and mouse completely reset. This includes anything from the lighting settings on the keyboard to the DPI speed of the mouse. For me, it's a rather minor and petty inconvenience that takes all of ten seconds to fix, but it's still a little annoying, and I don't give five stars that easily.

All functions seem to work. Mouse ergonomics is weird. The scroll wheel area is really wide and it causes you to use an uncomfortable position in use. The keys on the keyboard have a cheaper feel than my microsoft keyboard.But what bothers me most is that the keyboard lighting default setting can't be changed. So everytime I start the computer I have to change the setting on the lights, away from the pulsating rainbow default.

There was no software install or any unnecessary driver download required. The colors of the keyboard and mouse provide a relaxing and cool experience, especially at night when you're gaming or just fiddling around on the PC. The letters are etched within the buttons themselves, so they will never ghost on you, and the keyboard is very soft and silent so you won't be causing loud clickety-clacks in the middle of the night waking up your roomates or your significant other.The mouse will feel a little hard to move at first, just tap the middle button a few times until you achieve the sensitivity that's comfortable for you.

The keyboard is cool, and if not for the really weird tactile feel of the keys, I would really like it.  Feels like a worn out $9.99 keyboard.  It takes a minute for the computer to recognize either the mouse or the keyboard when it starts up which is super annoying, not able to figure out what's up with that but it is specific to this keyboard/mouse.  The mouse is nothing to brag about either, I wasn't able to turn off the 'breathing" (pulsing) red lights on the mouse. I won't return it, but will get something else from Best Buy where I can see and feel what I am getting

Keyboard and mouse have a well built quality feel and work as well as my high end gaming laptop keyboard and track mouse. I needed a temporary keyboard and mouse while my laptop keyboard and track mouse was broken, so I purchased this replacement as a temporary solution, but the quality of the keyboard and mouse exceeded my expectation and I'm now using them every day. I highly recommend this product for anyone in need of something a little nicer than OEM equipment and not wanting to spend a fortune.

Bought this as a backup keyboard/mouse for a computer that's not used a lot (maybe 10 hours a week), because I was tired of replacing batteries in the wireless keyboard/mouse I had previously. Unfortunately within a few months of one of the feet on the keyboard broke, and the scroll wheel on the mouse started flaking out a few months after that; now the scroll wheel has become unusable.Unfortunately I left it sitting in the box for 6 months before I got around to replacing the wireless ones, so there's pretty much no chance of it being in warranty still. It's not the worst purchase I've ever made, but I'll definitely avoid this brand when looking for my next replacements.

Seems the company who made this Mouse and Keyboard, are very quick to discontinue support for your products, and so to be weary of what you buy from them. Instead of using one program for all their Products that can detect, effect, and install drivers needed for any and all of them, they have a specific program for each item that in a few months they stop supporting and will no longer sell the item on their site, nor have the program for that product, or even the Drivers anymore.So unless you can track down someone who still has the install from the Programs or Drivers, and trust that person and the Installer they give you, most of the 'Features' for the Mouse and Keyboard can never be used. At most, for the Keyboard you can change between Built In Preset light colors, using the FN key on it, and for the mouse it has 4 built in mouse speeds you can switch between with the button on it. But without the program and drivers, you can't Customize them in any way, and the programs for the other products won't work, as they detect and specifically work for those products.

I got 2 of these for my sister and I but we've only been using them for a few days. We both game (not heavily) and thought the colors would be cool. It's a nice keyboard, nothing outstanding but worth the price. Connecting was super easy, plug and play. Instructions for changing the colors was easy. The mouse doesn't change colors which kind of sucks but for the money it's a decent mouse. If you're on a budget then it's a good option. I'll update on the durability after we've had them a while.

Update 11/29/2016:It's been over a year. The keyboard is dusty, but all my keys still work, the LEDs are still great. The mouse scroll button has started to slip a little bit the past month or so, but still functional. Great keyboard still. With the key cap remover, it wouldn't be hard to clean it up.

Amazing back lit keyboard with edgy features and color customization. Mouse clicks have nice matte/velvet-like, gritty finish which I found very cool. Cord length is good. Only drawback is that I wish the backlit would be brighter. Also every time I turn on my laptop the color scheme defaults to rainbow which I change by pressing FN + Home to arrive at my favorite color (green seems to be the brightest). These points aside,  amazing keyboard and no regrets.

If you frequently plug-in and unplug (due to travel, for instance ), the mouse cord weakens and fails at where it joins the usb plug. Annoying waste.I also wish a compact, led ;lit keyboard, with spill=proofing, as this has, were avalanche, with only the characters  lit, again, as this one, but no grid light leaks, as is dumb, dominate market design., currently.

I would have paid the full price of the bundle for the keyboard alone, it is by far the best keyboard I have ever owned. There are lots of different light options, the only complaint is that there is not different brightness modes. The keys are all very responsive and feel good to press. Very nice for typing and long gaming sessions because of the palm rest at the base of the keyboardThe mouse is not the best, you can't change the color of the mouse so it doesn't match anything unless your other lights are all red. The mouse itself is good build quality other than the scroller which feels a little loose to me. The customize-able weight is also nice. Also to make full use of the mouse (including the lighting and DPI settings) you have to go and download the software for it off Red Dragon's website. The wires on both the keyboard and mouse are very high quality. Will not wear out anytime soon. -1 star for mouse not being as nice as the keyboard.

So I like this keyboard, I do, however the mouse is a different story. While the keyboard is flawless, the mouse is unresponsive at times, and honestly the constantly changing of colors on tbe mouse is annoying, but that's more a preference issuse.

Bought this keyboard/mouse setup for my little brother's birthday. He's always been wanting a gaming keyboard/mouse like mine, and I put some scrap parts in a case and got him a little PC setup going. He love's the keyboard and mouse, only complaint is the brightness could be a little brighter, but hey you can't win it all with this kinda price. Can't beat it, I would recommend for any beginners, or you just simply don't wanna pay $200 for a keyboard lol.

My son wanted a gaming keyboard.  While this one is not a mechanical keyboard/mouse, it performs and it looks nice doing it.  LED’s are important for kids and this has them.  I believe the mouse is only red lights, though the keyboard has many rainbow settings.  All good and he’s deadly in fortnight as a result versus his wireless keyboard that would lose connectivity from time to time.  Wired is king for gaming.

The keys are stiff and needs some force to press.  I play a lot and my fingers get tired of pushing the keys.  Wish there was some way I could adjust key pressure.  The game I play uses 1,2,3 and E.  Unfortunately there is no way that I know of to modify the keyboard to make these keys easier to use.  Navigation keys don't work for the game I play.  Even though the picture portrays the product accurately, I was hoping that I could make some keyboard modifications to make it easier to play my game.  I gave it a 3 because my fingers get so tired of pressing the keys.  Maybe someone with stronger fingers won't have the same problem.

I actually like this keyboard, wish it had a few more color option's, but it's an older keyboard. It feel good, has good weight to it, not sliding around. It's well made, been using it 6 month's now about. Heavy usage everyday about, and nothing's worn off. I like the mouse as well, only not the red light you can't change to match the keyboard, I just shut it off. The mouse is also well built, though the top buttons' fellt a bit flimsy and cheap, they are not, meaning they haven't broken after hundred's of hrs of gaming. The adjustable weights' in it are a nice touch. It fit's my hand very very well and I don't suffer wrist pain's trying to use it like other cheap mice, nor with the keyboard actually. It's a good older solid product overall. I'm sure the newer model's are better and improved upon, but go Red Dragon!!

Built a gaming PC for my sons first computer. It was his 10th birthday. This may not be the best option for gaming, but he has been very happy with t. Of course because it lights up, but he also like the fact that he can change the mouse dpi setting with just the click of a button on the mouse. He was also impressed with the removable weights in the bottom of the mouse. Overall it’s a pretty good keyboard and are very happy with it.

I tried 4 different keyboards in this price range before finding this one. The first two felt incredibly cheap. They felt like they'd break after a month of use. The third was incredibly loud. This one feels sturdy, it's quiet, and the lights and extra function buttons are a nice touch. I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a high-quality product in this price range. The mouse seems a little cheaper but not terrible. I gave it to my son and so far he likes it.

This review is for the Vajra (the cheapest option) with the mouse. I was in need of a keyboard, any decent keyboard and came across this. Bonus it comes with a mouse! Almost a year later I have not been let down. If you are looking at this, chances are you are on a budget and want a good looking decent keyboard with mouse. You have found it! I really couldn't tell you the difference in what makes this one a great gaming keyboard as I've never owned one before but for the price you will not be let down. Easy set up and even after my kid spilled nail polish on it, it still works. Within the year I've owned it I have played MMOs frequently, daily internet usage, typed papers for classes and in the last 4 months very frequently played games on Steam. If you want to save money and aren't concerned​ with customization, fancy bells and whistles this does the job nicely.

I had one of the red dragon mice as a quick replacement for a while and it quickly became my main gaming mouse. Thought it didn't last but maybe 2 years of gaming before the right mouse button broke, but being as I liked it enough I wen't ahead and got the combo. I like the keyboard a lot as well and the feeling of the buttons is pretty nice, so if you are on a budget or just looking for a good but cheap gaming set up, I'd go with this.

The Keyboard and mouse are a nice set.  The keyboard seems to be well made and sturdy.  The only issue I have is the key push (the distance the key travels when typing) seems to be longer than most keyboards I am used to, I am still trying to get used to that.  I have not used the 2nd set of WADS keys (Set on the lower right of the keyboard) as most games I play require the use of the 1-5 keys, F keys, and Q,E,R, SHIFT, and CTRL keys.The mouse also seems to be well built and is relatively comfortable, even for extended use.  The 8g weights inside add a little bit of weight to the mouse, which doesn't seem like much but I like the little bit heavier mouse.  The 2 thumb buttons are nice, although I like the one closer to the back of the mouse as it is located to all I have to do is quickly tap it with my thumb to use it.  The thumb button in front of that one take a little adjustment of the hand to use which takes a little getting used to, especially when playing a faster paced FPS game.

Pros: The keyboard has a great feel for typing.  I did not get this board for gaming.The glowing feature works very well and perfect for evening when I work on projects. The choice of colors is nice, except that it does not include yellow.

The keyboard and mouse combo is great for the price. the key feedback and bounce back are great and durable. i've been enjoying the colour changing keys and how you can program it. the mouse only has the one colour option, just blinking red - you don't notice it when you're using the mouse but the mouse itself is great - no hiccups or skips, and the speed changing is wonderful so switch easily when you're playing different games with different play styles.Sometimes the mouse stays on even when the computer is shut down. they keyboard key lights turn off and sometimes the mouse does too. other times the mouse stays on though so at night it can get annoying.

Bought this keyboard and mouse when my son was 10. He wanted to be a “famous YouTube gamer”, so I decided to invest in his dream. 😫 2 years later, he is now more of a Fortnite/GTA/Roblox junkie than a YouTuber - but the keyboard and mouse are going strong!! And he is SUPER rough with his electronics, so this speaks VOLUMES about the quality of this product. (I can’t tell you how many headsets we have run through over the past 2 years.) Both devices still light up, and there have been no issues with functionality. All the keys on the keyboard are still in tact, no sticking, even the characters on the keys are still fully visible. My son complains about the keys being too loud during gameplay, but not much else. The mouse has full functionality as well - the scroll wheel still tracks, all buttons still work. I wish the mouse color could be changed, but that is just a personal preference. Excellent purchase!!!

I needed a keyboard and mouse that I could see in the dark as I am awake at night occasionally. The keys as well as the mouse have such a light touch to them. The wrist guard/handguard  is a wonderful plus. And the colors, oh the colors; the main reason I picked this set. I can see them so clearly that I don't have to turn on all the lights in the room to use my computer now. No lights means my roommate (who sleeps with the door open) will not be disturbed in the night. Also the keys are so quiet; another plus. I am so glad I purchased this model!

Really happy with this keyboard. Super soft touch and quiet when typing. Really cool design and color changing to how you want. Mouse has almost a light grain of sandpaper feel for extra grip and prevent slimy ness from hands being possibly clamy. Definitely recommend as a starter keyboard mouse set or even for work preferences

Note: It may be amazon’s delivery since all they did was throw the frikkin thing from their truck. It had some dents on the actual box and covered in dirt.The keyboard on most keys worked. The whole thing powered and lit up properly. I couldn’t find the issue online but when I did find the direct problem online and tested it, it was true but wouldn’t change from dents, shakes and such.

We've only had this for one day.  I bought it for my grandson.  He absolutely LOVES it!!  I even like it.  The mouse is very nice and fits his hand well, but it would probably fit most hands just fine.  The lights are really pretty, but not too bright so it wouldn't disturb anyone else in the room.  It's perfect so far!!  I can't believe we got this for such a reasonable price.  I hope it holds up well and my Grandson gets a few years of use out of it.  I would buy it again in a heartbeat!

I have not even had this thing for 24 hrs hooked up to my Xbox one 2 of the keys I use don’t work when I first got it it worked fine but last night I noticed 1 key not working and just now a second key stopped working this keyboard looks good but don’t work for very long

I liked this keyboard to start. Good brightness behind the keys, good feel and style. But within a few weeks, when I hit certain key sequences while holding shift, it would not 'shift' all of the keys. So "shift so.." should produce "SO" but it would always produce "So". It's hard to think that is a physical defect since the rest of the word would typically be in caps as well. Ultimately it ended up being enough of a hassle that I had to replace it.

After looking at RGB keyboards from reputable brands, I noticed the REDRAGON combination set to be one of the more purchased sets on the lower budget spectrum. I liked the weight, style and design of both keyboard and mouse; however, when I received my set, I'm questioning if I should have payed the extra money to get set from a more reputable brand.KEYS - half of the keys on my keyboard function perfectly. I have no problems with any of the smaller keys, such as the "q", "w", "e", "r", "t" ect. or other keys that are of this size, but any of the larger keys, such as the 0, Enter, and + keys on the number pad , the "shift" keys, backspace and backslash all have different resistances or don't function properly. They are difficult to press, or do not register when pressed. Half of the time, when the backspace character is pressed the "=" sign is entered because of a poor manufacture molding. - Poor quality control, should not have left the factory. Refer to the picture about the fused keys.

I recently built my computer, and needed a decent keyboard and mouse to accomodate the performance for the games i run on my computer.  The mouse seems to be very crisp, and adjustable by removing weights (i removed about 3 of them).  It has a very comfortable feel to it, and the buttons are positioned in easily accessible areas.  I have never been much of a fan of the wireless mouses for gaming, and that is why I am very content with this wired model.  The keyboard has relatively quiet keys, that don't seem to have to bad of a "clicking" breakin point when depressed.  The surface of the keys have a nice matte feel to the touch, not slippery feeling.  The lights are great touch, and not overpowering.  It truly was plug and play with no issues.  My only complaint is the return key is vertically narrow instead of having the horizontal length, or the reverse "L" design and I often miss the key when going to hit return.  This isn't a deal breaker though, as I can often just reach a little further and catch it.

Reddragon keyboard and mouse could not be any better for what I need.I tend to stay up pretty late for gaming or for school. In either case, I may need to be using the keyboard and mouse.  Going lights out has never been easier since all of this lights up. There are different modes which is fun to play around in, but I stuck with solid red, matches my PC anyways. Of course there are brighter colors for better visuals of the keys. The mouse "breaths" red, as if the Dragon were asleep and ready to breathe. All of this is quiet. Every button to click and it is not loud and obnoxious, perfect.

I’ve loved this keyboard so far. It seems to be made from some great material on the keys. My last keyboard, the space bar would not press down well. This one presses great. The keys by far are the best part. There’s some soft leathery suede maybe? Like definitely not hard plastic (maybe it is) but I love the fee of the keys.In terms of function I’m super basic so I don’t even use or hook up all the bells and whistles.

Got this keyboard and mouse combo after having not one, not two, but *three* wireless keyboards in the span of a couple months that all had various issues with lag and missed typing. I resigned myself to a wired KB and mouse and figured that would be it, and I picked this one based on positive reviews and price.What a pleasant surprise then to find this keyboard has very comfortable keys and quieter keystrokes than any of the wireless models I bought. I like the lighting (plus options to change it) purely as a means of seeing it better when typing in the dark. And the mouse is a solid addition as well.

I’m about to throw away this keyboard set I bought last year and replace it with an upgraded corsair k95. The mouse was really starting to annoy me and I had to bang it on the desk a few times to get it to work because it kept lagging. It did hold up fine for awhile and the lights still work, I’m just disappointed I could not reprogram the colors to where I want it. My first impressions were good, but eventually; down the road, this is a cheap poorly made keyboard and I am not satisfied with it. Buy corsair and logitech instead.

The keyboard itself is fine, and there are multiple light settings. The thing we wish we had known was that the keyboard resets to the default setting every time you turn your computer off and on, which for us is several times a day. I contacted customer service, and they confirmed this was the case. There is no software for the keyboard.Regarding the mouse, just know it is huge. We are used to a much smaller, more ergonomic mouse, so we're not sure if we're going to continue using it or not. Also, the default setting is a crazy slow dpi, so every time you turn your computer on you have change it. There is supposedly software for it, but it is extremely difficult to find, is not in the box, is not listed anywhere on their website for this model, and I had to contact customer service for them to send me a link to it. I haven't tried it yet, but maybe that will fix the inability to save settings other than the default. Again, no software exists for the keyboard. This is only for the (giant) mouse.

Not only did this product not come with the software or any links to any software, their website has the wrong software listed for the keyboard. The mouse software does not allow changing the two side keys to keypresses except via the use of a clunky macro system that can't replicate the effect of a keyboard key on the mouse. The keyboard also does not have proper rollover - I've found many examples but the most striking one is that you cannot use LCtrl+LShift+Esc to open Task Manager on Windows! I've already requested a refund from Amazon.If those issues don't bother you, however, the keyboard looks very nice and the mouse is adequate. I haven't had nearly enough time to test its durability, but I wouldn't expect much from Redragon at this point, considering the last items I purchased from them each had non-critical failures within two years of purchase.

For the price, this keyboard mouse combo is decent and works as intended. Keys and clicking are louder than expected but that doesn't bother me as much since I wear headsets. I don't like the keyboard LED lights are always moving, never still. You can only change the frequency of how fast they move. The middle enter key gets stuck once in while, which is unacceptable. Another annoying issue, once you turn off the computer, the mouse DPI resets to the slowest option. It would be nice to have the last preference saved. Not a bad keyboard mouse set, but didn't expect such issues. Decided to keep the item regardless. Next time I will invest in a better keyboard mouse set.

Bought this for my 9 year old daughter as she is exploring the keyboard/mouse gaming, she is a Xbox one Nintendo switch gamer now...she loves it...she plays fortnite, Minecraft, overwatch and is getting used to not using a controller...it has worked well for her, but she isn’t at the competitive level yet, so I can’t speak to how well it works when you get to to that level of play, but so far it has worked well, no complaints from her...good, inexpensive option and the colors make it even better...

The main reason I bought this package was for the keyboard. The mouse was a bonus, but it is so disappointing that it really isn't even a bonus. The keyboard lights up with great RGB lighting, but it does not feel like a gaming keyboard. The keys are too close together and my hands instantly cramp up. Typing on it is a nightmare, except the backspace key is actually the proper size compared to the one I use now.It is NOT like the mechanical keyboards most people expect, and it was a complete waste of money. All of it. I hate myself for buying it.

Love this keyboard, I got it and tested the keys they all worked as a keyboard should so that was a relief based on what I seen on other reviews. It looks nice and I love it a lot. The mouse is actually pretty good too normally they are crap in combos!Well I use to love this keyboard but as of late, The lights have been going out and it has stopped responding. Makes me sad I really do love this keyboard but it is acting up pretty bad now.

I am disappointed with this purchase. The feel of the mouse and keyboard are alright, but feel light and cheap. My biggest issues is that it is very difficult to program. I got the mouse good to go, but I could not get the keyboard to program. When they say "7 different RGB Lighting modes & effects, 4 backlight brightness levels, adjustable breathing speed. " You can only do the 7 different RGB Lighting modes & effects, because the other are programmable through software that I can't get.

I have been a consumer of Redragon products for almost a year now, and this was a pretty decent purchase. This keyboard is pretty great overall, it gets the job done most of the time. I tend to use this keyboard for both gaming purposes and homework purposes and they work fine with a few exceptions. Here are some of the pros and cons I found in this keyboard with the mouse.Pros:

I looove the rainbows and the different colors, they're so much fun and not distracting. The mouse is okay, looks very cool, but the wire seems pretty stiff to me, which makes it difficult to navigate. Also, it may just be me, but the random flickering lights the mouse gives off is distracting to someone who is very easily distracted. The keyboard is awesome and my only complaint is that sometimes a key will stick. I get the feeling it's the function of the keyboard rather than a physical sticky key because it's not any one specific key, but any one I might use. It'll stick and carry on, such as fffffffffffffffff or kkkkkkkkkkkkk. If I click another button it'll stop and I can delete it, but that's a bit annoying. Other than that, it's a very cool keyboard. I like rainbows.

Very torn on this product ill just talk about the keyboard the mouse is absolute crap like many said in other reviews the mouse is kind of just a throw in and the quality represents it. The keyboard however isnt that much different its very light and cheap feeling and to me wasnt very comfortable. The media keys don't work, and to change the rgb is a fn+6 button mess it also doesnt save your settings. Im not the type of person who usually knocks stuff like this and says hey just save up and buy something better but just save up and buy something better. This product is really not worth your time unless you are on a extreme budget.

The keyboard and mouse in the product I ordered were of above average quality for this price point.The mouse has a nice counter weight feature which you can "tune" to your individual liking via adding or removing weights.

Directions in English please. I'm not trying to be mean, but it should be clarified in the product information that there is no English directions which is pretty important when you're trying to figure out the led light functions. And also that all the keys basically look like kanji or Chinese lettering. You can make it work, but there's better options for the price. just seems dishonest to me. Hope you guys improve. Thanks

Firstly, I was excited about the product but not only did it arrive late "Thanks UPS" but the mouse right and left click buttons didn't work. Wasn't until i did my own research to find a few others with the same issue. Would love to rate this 5 stars but the work it takes to repair something that should of been checked before shipment isn't worth the trouble.Not only that the mouse itself is flimsy made with some sort of plastic, its a beautiful mouse sure but all i care about is it working properly, wish the last guy posted the video about repairing it would definitely help some people out.

Kids want to steal my keyboard and mouse! They love changing the colors. I like that I can see the keys when's it's dark in the room. I've used the video functions, works nice, I'm still not used to having buttons there to use. I miss my control F11 to lock my computer but otherwise it's a cool keyboard that I dont have to change batteries in anymore and the littles cannot walk off with my mouse!

I can still not believe the quality of this keyboard and mouse for the price. I am a light/intermediate PC gamer and it's response time is so much better than the standard apple keyboard and mouse setup. Here's the breakdown:Pros:

I’m really impressed. I was expecting something kind of blah and it looks awesome. I’m really happy about it and highly recommend this keyboard. The mouse works really well to. I use it mostly for editing photos. I have nothing bad to say at all. Great price and great items.

decent mouse and keyboard for a small price of entry. I originally bought this for my xbox, to help enhance certain games, having access to keyboard/mouse over controller. It has now made its way as my budget keyboard for the PC setup, and i have had zero issues. The mouse allows for a diver to be installed on pc to finetune everything, but is not necessary. I had this running on my XBOX for 2 months before PC, zero issues. Keyboard has 6 RGB modes, can be accessed with FN and the insert/home etc keys. very handy

I just wanted a back lit keyboard with white lights to make the keyboard keys are easier to see, but this keyboard has 6 colors which flash on and off like a Christmas tree - which just plain stupid. There are 6 options to control the blinking lights - 5 options to make the lights blink in a more annoying or less annoying fashion, and 1 option to turn off all lights - which does not result in a back lit keyboard. If I were a pimp this might be fine, but since I am a CPA trying to concentrate on my work, the keyboard is completely ridiculous. As a side note, the keys press deeply which makes it more tiring and tedious to use.

This is the best possible bundle for beginners. The mouse is of good quality and does very good. I really like how you can change the dpi and how the mouse looks. Although i know red dragon did copy msi for this one, it's a really good clone for a sub 15 dollar mouse. The keyboard is really nice mainly because of the lighting but also the gaming and typing experiences. The bundle is amazing for new gamers who are looking for a budget bundle, or just a back up keyboard.

Gotta say, RGB is nice, and all but the clickiness is so satisfying. Good response time and well around the keyboard. The mouse is very good as well, 2 side buttons that work as well as an ergonomic wheel.

This keyboard and mouse could be a nice setup but there are no drivers to be found anywhere. They say download from their site but they don’t have them for this model. You can’t set functions for the mouse buttons without it. The mouse speed defaults to the slowest ever time you restart. The keyboard defaults to blinking lights every time you restart. Very annoying.

I of course loved this keyboard at first, as it was my very first gaming keyboard. The mouse is all right, a bit cheap, but the keyboard is the main specialty. When I first got this it was great, all the keys worked, the Lights were amazing looking, But after a few days with it, I noticed two major problems, it started to type random "+" signs and random "0"s, I tried using a screwdriver to remove the keys and then put them back on, and it still continued doing it.  It also makes it hard for me to type anything or even sign in because it randomly types "+" signs and "0"s all on it's own.

Since these items are bundled together, I'll rate them together. Both products are fully functional and are a step up from the basic $20 Logitech equipment I was using before. The red LEDs are also nice, since red doesn't make my room uncomfortably bright while sleeping.The mouse has good sensitivity and a nice texture in my hand (something I didn't notice advertised, but am pleased with). It'd be nice if I could make it a bit heavier, but the weight isn't bad. The mouse wheel is firm and only makes noise if I spin it very quickly. If I were rating just the mouse, I'd give it a 5.

I use this for work.  I'm older, so it gives me the feeling of being on an Old School Keyboard.  I like to feel the keys being pressed!  I have purchased 4 of these for myself, for each of my office locations and have gotten so many compliments that several people have asked me for the link, so they can purchase.  The mouse is comfortable and responsive.  I love the colors, puts a little fun into being behind a computer all day at my desk.  And you can't beat the price!

This is a excellent keyboard for gaming we got it to play on a PS4 . This key board is excellent you can change just about everything the way you want it to be. We used it on a laptop and it works very . The mouse is awesome also. One thing about the keyboard is that the movement on the pa4 is excellent it has changed the way he plays and had made him a better player

So I have used this keyboard for around 6 months now, and it seems to be working fine. I remember the keys being mushy on the first day, but they are fine as of now. Only problem is some of the bigger keys like  shift and space are really inconsistent with how they feel to type with. The rgb is great for working at night. However, one issue with the rgb is the keyboard software wouldn't detect the keyboard in my case, so customization was limited. The mouse software did work though, and all mouse buttons are able to be remapped. Another cool feature is drain holes on the bottom of the keyboard in case something spills on it. The mouse also has a nice braided cable. Speaking of the mouse, the clicks and two extra buttons are really clicky and satisfying. The dpi button in the center really helps with increasing the sensitivity on the fly. Generally, good value considering the price.

Cheap and lacks features, no software to control led or config. Product can't even be found on RedDragon's website for this model. volume control requires a function button to use, this isn't a "Quick" button action. Very disappointed.

Seems pretty nice so far, but the "thumb" buttons are an absolutely terrible nusiance for left handed use in gaming. I had to turn those buttons off in-game.The keyboard looks great. The cables are quite sturdy.

For the price this is actually pretty good.  The key board is by all means pretty with the lights and works well.  The mouse is comfy and fits my hand well.  The lights are bright and vibrant colors with many different colors and modes to choose from.  If you don't want to spend the money for a fancy mechanical keyboard I would definitely recommend this one.

Editing my original review- When I first ordered this product, the keyboard came to me with a small defect in the Ctrl key- it stuck randomly. After posting my original review, the seller was in contact with me almost immediately and offered a replacement keyboard, which after some discussion I accepted. To their complete credit, they were willing to work with me and ship the replacement before I returned the old one, since I didnt have a spare on hand to keep using. And the replacement keyboard works perfectly! The mouse has been great since I received it as well, very solid product.My only remaining small gripe is that the lighting defaults to scrolling rainbow color when you turn on your computer- which is somewhat distracting. It's fixable by a key press or two, but it'd be nice if the lighting of the mouse and keyboard defaulted to the same color (the mouse is a slowly pulsing red color).

The big thing I want to say, that for the price you get a pretty good looking RGB keyboard that seems to be in pretty decent quality and could be help up to par to any other decent RGB keyboard in the $50 price range. The keys feel smooth to touch, and although I don't how they will feel overtime they just feel great to type on. The little wrist holder feels nice to use I just wish the little designs on it weren't there but it's still good! For some reason the logo and the top of  the keyboard looks different than in the images shown on the page, but it's not a big change and it looks good! The mouse is a pretty basic mouse in the price range, has all of it's buttons and an amazing braided color. The coolest thing are the little weights in the back that make the mouse feel good and weighty to use, and not floaty like plastic mouses you'd expect to see in the $30 price range. You can take the weights out if you want and get the feel you want but I feel like all the weights are just nice! All and all, a perfect bang for your buck product and if you got the cash, I think this is a pretty safe buy. I have had no issues yet, but will update this review if I get any. (The mouse pad I shown on my mouse image is not included, it's my personal mouse pad)

I wanted to like this but mine came defective from factory.  J L and I keys wouldn't work. Checked drivers. Nope, they didn't even work in the BIOS when I tried which confirmed the hardware was defective. It looks gorgeous and maybe I just got unlucky with this one in particular. The box arrived in perfect condition and it was well packaged which makes me believe there was not too much effort in quality control. I ended up buying an Eagletec mechanical keyboard which worked just fine for me. I like Redragon, so I hope they do a bit more to make sure their peripherals leave the factory fully functional.

Keyboard does not feel good, very mushy and cheap feeling. The mouse feels just as bad as the keyboard does. These both look nice but I'll stick with my G110 and G402. They were inexpensive. Maybe this would be good for a child who doesn't know any better. Going from my current KB and mouse these felt like a huge downgrade. Would not recommend except perhaps as a starter mouse and kb for someone on a tight budget.
Purchased for my son as a Christmas present.  He started using it after Christmas 2019.  He does not use it all the time and now the mouse stopped working after just 2 months.  Keep on looking
Not sure of quality...but rcvd keyboard in original box with shipping label affixed to it. Not too pleased about that.

After tons of research I bought this keyboard because I work in the wee morning hours and needed to be able to see my keyboard without turning on lights and disturbing the house and I lost the USB connection for my previous mouse somewhere in my couch. The keys are quiet and the lights are perfect. You can change to any color in the rainbow or just leave the whole rainbow, which is what I settled on. You can have a pulsing light as well, but I don’t use that because I find it distracting. All in all I am very happy with my purchase.

I was a little worried at first about the "you get what you pay for".... at this price I was sure things would have gone bad by now...I have had this set for 4 months now, keys are nice and quite. Mouse is super responsive and is weighted so if it is too heavy for you at 1st, you can lighten it.

Specifically the "f" key. A couple of other keys don't work either, But that one annoys me the most. You know how much you use the "f" key when typing? Ugh. Has a Good glow to it, wish it was brighter. Very lightweight design and the keys are definitely comfortable. I get pressure hives and I barely notice it when it's sitting on my lap, it's that lightweight. Heavy duty wire cord for the plug, and the keyboard is very easy to learn and use. Just wish my buttons all worked, this was my Christmas present. In light of that, I do hope that my keyboard gets replaced by Christmas, I'll up the stars to five and update if it's done by next month. :)All in all, a good board. Hope they fix it, because I love Redragon!

I got this because it is not healthy for a kid to be hunched over a laptop screen with a small keyboard and no mouse for hours on end.  Since school may very well be at home the full year, this is totally worth the money.  To complete the ergo set up, we raised the screen to eye level.  It took some getting used to, but it is a much better setup.

This keyboard has great color with the backlit keys and functionality. Took a little while to realize there are not any downloadable programs for this keyboard and mouse like their other products but everything is built in to the keys. Worked right away after plugging it in without having to wait for drivers. The mouse has great weight to it with the option to customize it with the small weights and the braided cord on it is tough enough to last with the wear and tear that comes from travel and use. Keys are also very quiet and don't wake up my wife like a mechanical keyboard alternative would.I didn't give 5 stars just because I know there are better products out there but for the price, i don't think this combination can be beat. I'm very happy to use these for my first PC build as a way to save some money.

Pretty good for the price range. Weird to have a smaller mouse, my last one was about 1.5x bigger and had more buttons. But this gets the job done.I am horid at not reading instructions, so I have no idea if the lights turn on, off, or if they even change. It's smaller than I thought it would be, but still works well. Good product for the price range.

The keyboard combo I am reviewing is the Redragon S101 Gaming Keyboard Mouse Combo. First, I was disappointed with the delivery of the package, and why only 4 stars and not 5. It was meant to be a gift and it arrived in no package at all. It arrived in the actual keyboard box with the address label slapped on.
