I was so shocked to see it delievered like that, anyone could have walked away with it! One side of the box was crushed and we had to make sure the mouse was in there and still working. Alright, moving on...my nephew loves this keyboard and I do too! The keys are soft pressed and a joy to use, it is lightweight but robust enough where it doesn't look cheap. The backlight worked as soon as we plugged it in, hence the plug and play claim. The mouse is also smooth, responsive, and fast. I am not sure if anyone else encountered this, but we were unsure of how to change the backlight colors, we thought it did need a driver but found through sheer luck that to change the colors and variations use the "FN" key and press the insert, home, page up, delete, end or page down keys. As well as using the arrow keys and FN adjusts the color intensity and the frequency of the flashing. All in all, I do recommend the keyboard! I am even getting another one for my husband cause he loved it :)

This a pretty nice keyboard and mouse set. I have been using it for 6 months, I am a pretty avid gamer and have had no issues, the keyboard is solid, multi colored, progammable patterned keyboard is really nice for playing in the dark, and has a nice tactile feel when pressing keys very quite and smooth, the mouse is weighted for a customizable, solid feel, comes with assorted weights so you can remove them to get a balance that suits you, I personally really appreciate the  quick dpi selection button just behind mouse center wheel, each click runs through 4 preset dpi speeds depending on how quickly/far youd like the mouse to travel when you move the mouse,  for quick twitch games like shooters the higher speeds allow the cursor to travel across the entire screen with just a slight motion, where as the lower settings are great for rpg games or web browsing.
I like the keyboard and everything but some of the keys have stopped working and I need it to do school work but I cant do that when the S and N and some of the other keys do not work.

Bought this in April 2020 it is now Sept 2020 mouse died! tried several different machines but no luck. Also, there are no driver downloads for this product... the S101  maybe that would help, cant adjust colors on the keyboard or anything. If someone has some insight here feel free to let me know.All in all, when working it was just great

Granted I've only had this for a month or so but it has held up to my gamer habits pretty well. I found I couldn't give it a full 5 stars due to how awkward the shift button is to press due to where the key is centered making my fast typing a little slower at times. I don't really use the right shift so this might be a left-handed kind of thing.I have not used the mouse yet (it's a backup mouse) so I can't comment on it's functionality yet but I'm sure it's of good quality if the keyboard is good.

Honestly for the price this keyboard and mouse are unbelievable. Don’t expect a 100 dollar set but it’s really nice. It has a nice feel to the keys and mouse. And the plastic used is off good quality. At no point did any of it feel cheap. And the LEDs are great! Son loves that you can hangs the keyboard color at anytime by just pushing a button. If you are looking for a nice keyboard and mouse with LED lighting just buy it. For the price and features it’s no competition.

My son ordered this item for his desktop. He has been very pleased. He likes the mechanical action and the light are a bonus that can be customized. He uses both the mouse and keyboard after coming from a Logitech wireless combo. I’m actually a little surprised that we were able to make the replacement at such a good price. The wires were plenty long enough for his setup and the product functions flawlessly.

Ok so I bought this while quarantined, so I can work from home. It's plug and play, and there's an instruction manual that shows you how to adjust the lights on the keyboard. Haven't figured out if you can change the mouse, but it has a lot of buttons. The keyboard feels soft and is comfortable to type on. And the pulsing colors are dope! Totally worth the price, a nice upgrade for my home office.

While this set is really designed to be used for gaming, I actually use this as my primary work keyboard and mouse.  I was sick of everyone's plain old boring black equipment so I wanted something fun for the office.  The keyboard has a great feel and the color options brings some fun to otherwise boring work days.  I am very glad I purchased.

For 30 bucks, I am not going through the hassle of a return/replacement.  This keyboard is maybe a one off defect, but it randomly doubles up on the letteer "E".  no otheer letter, just "e", and that key feels a littlee bit softer than thee rest.Ordering another one, and trashing this one as soon as it gets heere.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with this keyboard.  It is 100% fine.  The key feel is fine, the functionality is fine.  If you are looking for a cheap gaming keyboard this would be a perfectly fine keyboard.  However, it is not a nice keyboard.  I found the feel a bit dead and it to be a bit uncomfortable.  My typing speed slowed down with this keyboard.

Keyboard does not last - keyboard sometimes functions and sometimes does not work. My 4/$ stopped working and i use this keyboard lightly for photo editing which uses the mouse more intensively. I will not recommend getting this keyboard spend a little more and you will save the headache.

So the box it came in was it’s actual box no extra one so I see why there would be doa ones I would suggest adding a rectangular box and some padding because damnBut the keyboard and mouse both work amazing the weights and a little tough to get out but feel amazing instead of light plastic

Absolutely love this keyboard. The mouse could be better but overall I bought this for the keyboard, I just resorted to my own mouse I already had. Btw if you're looking for a truly silent keyboard, this is it. I got this kuz I talk to clients over the phone and I don't want my keyboard to sound so loud and it's absolutely perfect for that.

The product claims there is software for programming the mouse, nothing comes with the kit and I've been all over the website. This kit doesn't come with nor does the manufacturer make any "software" for this Kit.The product works well as intended but, I gave it a low rating due to being mislead\liers

They keyboard is fine. It's what I expected for an affordable gaming keyboard. My biggest issue is that the title of the product AND the product description specifically states RGB Mouse. Not certain if this vendor understands but RGB stands for Red Blue Green - NOT just red!I thought I just didn't understand how to use it until I went to their website and downloaded their software for this model mouse in an attempt to change the color and low and behold - it's a red light mouse. That it. Can't be changed.

The Redragon keyboard would be a solid 3.5 star (perfectly average and nothing to write home about) keyboard if it was sold by itself for the 30 to 40 buck range. However, coupled with the fantastic mouse at this price point elevates this combo to five stars. The mouse is definitely the stronger of this pair.

I pride myself on being frugal. I hate spending money on things I really don't need. With that said, this is such a great quality product for the price.I have been playing various counter-strike games for over a decade now. I wouldn't call myself great, but I can regularly maintain a positive kill-to-death ratio (I usually end up about 35 kills and 25 deaths on csgo). All of these years I have been using generic manufacturer mice and keyboard combos.

Get what you pay for. Wanted a cheap keyboard fory extra computer that the kids occasionally play games on. Out of the box it just screams cheap. Everything worked as expected. Nothing has failed yet. But definitely would not buy this for any kind of real gaming. It's like a Yugo with Porsche badges on it...

Great choice, excellent key travel, somehow muffled but good. The RGB light are nice, not my first choice though, but the keyboard is pretty good if you can take advantage of all the features. Mouse is excellent as well, sturdy and reliable, the click sound is a little bit high for my like, but I don't regret at all. I totally recommend this kit.

This keyboard works well but there are a few things that I don't really like are: (1)The mouse can only be red and is not color changing like the keyboard (2)The keyboard is a little flimsy and seems to have a slight upward arch in the middle so it doesn't sit perfectly flat on a flat table. You can push on it near the edges of the plastic bezel and it will flex a considerable amount. I don't really notice this while typing though so it's not that big of deal (3)The Num Lock, Caps Lock and Win Lock LED indicators (top right corner) are always red no matter what color you change the keys to be. (4)The mouse LED "Breathes" or pulses on and off. I even downloaded the Reddragon Centrophorus Gaming Mouse configuration app but the only options are to turn the LED accent lighting off all together or adjust the speed of the "Breathing." I wish there was just an "On, Steady" option.

I've been using it over a month now. At first, It works great, the light on the keyboard help me to see at night easily. However, I played game recently and some of keypad doesn't work well. I have to press it harder than normal to make it work. Last night, I was playing League of Legend. In the combat, the E and F key didn't work, it made me lost that game.

The feel and usability of the keyboard/mouse is stellar! I wanted a breathing backlit color changing keyboard and this delivers; HOWEVER, I cannot utilize the backlight as the slowest breathing color changing option still feels like I am being bombarded by strobe lights.It really is sad as I would give the keyboard 5 stars if it could slow to a nice blended, serene, and calm 5-ish second color change with a similar holding pattern before changing again, but alas, I will be storing it away as a backup keyboard once I can find an acceptable replacement since a ~.372 second color change is the slowest option...

The keys have a LOT of horizontal movement. The key height is nice- not to high. The action is very sticky. I gave it to my friends  8 year old. Not a good gaming keyboard. 3 Stars is generous. Also, it didnt come in a box, just its regular packaging. The mouse button was dislodged but snapped into place.

Love my Red Dragon keyboard.  It is not mechanical but is by far the single nicest keyboard I have ever typed on!It is silky smooth, gaming keys are all accessible and the rgb is awesome.  Has several light options inc speed, brightness,  single colours, rainbow flash etc.

Very delightfully surprised by this set.  No software needed, all controls are integrated into each device. From what I can tell the mouse stays red, but the keyboard has a good selection of basic colors or rainbow / multicolor settings. Nothing advanced or crazy but keyboard feels good and mouse does have adjustable weights and extra buttons for gaming.
Awesome LED lights that are different colors.  The keys are super easy to press and feel nice.  The mouse works great and is very responsive.  Super great value for the money!

I received this package and was extremely excited about it, I started using it on games and general use, but just now I noticed after 2 days of use, one of the keys on it is not working at all, since the unpacking, but I didn't notice because I thought it was a malfunction on the computer and a lagged game, it wasn't! I now know that the letter "V" is not working on this keyboard.. I just now had to copy and paste the letter from another order in this page review..I love the mouse though, Its comfortable and Very useful, it's met all of my requirements!
This keyboard and mouse are so good and are great for gaming!Mouse pros:

I was looking forward to a new keyboard- this looked like a good one.  However, it arrived poorly packaged, no padding at all and was broken.  I did try it to get a feel for the keys and it seemed pretty good, but over all I was disappointed and just returned it without getting another one.  I decided it was not as nice as I expected and ended up getting a much better Razer keyboard.

This keyboard so far after testing it last couple of nights while playing Minecraft and browsing the web I was very impressed with he feel and smoothness of keyboard, lights are very nice too. Only drawback is if you are leaning back on your chair the F1, F10 keys at the top are hard to spot but not that much of a big deal, still a awesome keyboard and mouse still.

i really like the design and colors that come with this keyboard. the different colors are really nice and add something fun to the keyboard. the keys are easy to press and not super loud, which is great if you type a lot, like i do.

I bought this keyboard for my son end of last year and he loved it for playing games.  Since last couple of month, he complained that space-bar is getting stuck and he had to press other side of the space-bar to get it unstuck. I do see similar complains from other people as well and I wish I would have read prior to buying this.

Loved everything about this keyboard and mouse except for the keyboard dimensions, however I will say with a bit of time I can get use to it. The mouse is actually nice, I like the weight of it, the left and right mouse buttons respond quickly. The dpi button location is the only thing that I would change. Overall I would recommend this mouse and keyboard for gaming to my friends if they are looking for a inexpensive set with rgb.

The RedDragon Keyboard and Mouse combo is very suitable for gaming and or any other PC requirement you have,  I have altered the Keyboard lights.  I am not 15 so seeing flashing lights all the time isn't MY cup of tea but thankfully the keyboard lights have many alterations available.  Buy this product with confidence.  You won't be disappointed.

this keyboard was great. Used if for my pc then gave it to husband wheni built him a pc. The mouse is ok without using the software (and therefor only stock buttons being used).The issue is the software to do any keyboarding crashed the computer. Had to do full system restore. I did quite a bit of troubleshooting then tried it again and the same issue. Do NOT use the software in a pc with parts from United States companies.  Not compatible. This includes the "usa" versions from the redragonusa.com site

One of the top rated reviews for this keyboard states that this keyboard works "right out of the box" with PS4. It does not. I purchased this keyboard and mouse with the hopes of playing Sims 4 on console, only to be disappointed.The keyboard feels great and the lights are nice. It might be good for PC gaming. However upon plugging both the keyboard and mouse into the PS4, none of them turned on. I have searched numerous tutorial videos, contacted customer service and done research on Google. All of the methods I tried did not work. Out of the box, this product is useless for PS4. I assume you need an adapter to make it work, which is more money from your pocket.

Awesome keyboard & mouse! Just got mine today took it out the box plugged em both into my new gaming laptop and works perfect D key and F key was bit stiff but from using it all night they loosened up and are good now no other issues at all...Now the keyboard in the pic is not what you get....You dont get a full backlit like what is displayed in this ads picture only the sides and dragon logo that light up still looks pretty cool in the dark but i suggest you change the picture please and add the real picture so others know exactly what they are getting...Thank's

Purchased this set with the recent expansion to keyboard + mouse input on XBOX One, starting with Fortnite and other titles. As one who has never played video games without a controller, I wanted to get something that would have me eventually play competitively, but begin with something affordable.At this pricepoint, the mouse far exceeds expectations while the keyboard feels sturdy with the ability to strike keys with confidence and quick response times for critical gaming moments.

Didn't realize this keyboard is shorter than a standard keyboard, but you can't tell when using it which is great. The instructions could use some work. There are some functions presented without explanation as to which device it's for and what purpose they represent. Overall, still a good purchase. Love the lights!

Mouse wheel no longer works right, it slips when scrolling through things like like forum threads at places like Reddit and GoodReads. And this is after only one month, though one month of almost daily use. Other than that, a decent value for a decent price. Though once the mouse wheel stops working completely and I have to replace the mouse, I guess the value bit will be out the window. And I'm assuming since the mouse wheel runs on some sort of mechanical parts this slippage is only going to get worse. Oddly only does it when scrolling down, not up.Probably also not the keyboard to use if you're trying to write a novel or something, but that's not what this keyboard/mouse combo is designed for and that fact is NOT reflected in my rating. Just consider that a heads up. After typing 2000 words in one day in my (very much failed) NaNoWriMo effort this year my finger tips were actually irritated. Possibly due in part to the raised bumps on the "F" and "J" keys, but it was more than just my index fingers that felt irritated.

I got this because I am visually impaled, and having a light up keyboard with my new desktop would help. Over the years I got used to laptop keyboard, so going back to something like this took time to readjust to, but the shape of the keys fits your fingers well, travel is good, and the options of colors you can choose from is nice. The mouse has some weighted disks that are removable, there's a button to adjust the dpi on the fly. Overall a good product for the price.

I bought this with low expectations. I only wanted a USB wired keyboard and mouse with MAYBE a gaming option or two. While light-weight and no advanced options, this thing plugged-and-played on Windows 10 seamlessly. I would prefer the keyboard to have a wider palm-rest area, but for the price, I am thrilled with the set. The keys on the keyboard have a nice mechanical/springy feedback feel to them (although packed in to a smallish feeling area). The mouse has performed excellently both gaming and desktoping. The nifty red lights tie the two items together nicely for a good look. There are textures on the buttons for the mouse to give some touch feedback. The mouse is a little small for the button features if you ask me, but overall, it's a great buy at $30. If you want a really basic wired accessory setup, don't be afraid to buy this. If you want features, keep shopping.

I haven't been using the keyboard very much but I have been using the mouse constantly. Recently I built a computer and when I first plugged in the keyboard and mouse to the front USB ports, they just didn't work. I've always used the mouse for my laptop and I've had no problems until after this incident. There was no signs of life from the keyboard (no lighting), but the mouse showed signs, in the form of a constantly shining LED. It didn't do the thing where it dims and brightens. When I plugged in the mouse and keyboard back to my laptop, still no signs of life. Even on my PS4 it wasn't responsive. I assume I screwed up somewhere down the line so I'm just gonna buy another keyboard. It was good while it lasted.

Good luck searching for the option to have it in an Amazon box. My only issue is that it arrives without a box around it, so hopefully you're home because everyone that walks by can clearly see what you bought a keyboard. Other than that, it's nothing special. The space bar hits softer than the other keys and idk how I feel about that. Nothing sticks so far. The mouse is like the wire one you can get at 5 below, but with a stronger cable. Pretty colors, I guess. Cheapest keyboard that caught my eye.

This is a decent keyboard and mouse combo if you are on a budget. The keys are membranes and so there are inconsistencies in the force required. The lights are now as customizable as I would've liked (there is no option for a solid color always on) but still it looks really cool with my setup.

I actually like the keyboavrd, if it worked. they keys feel good, I like the mouse (havrpe 5603 combo bought) the problem as you can see is evrevrytime you hit the "V" or  "R" key it types vr. I can actually spell quite well ;-) Number pad is same way double types 56, 89, and 23 for either of the individual numbers in those groups. fvrustvrasting!!!!!!

I built my first pc and spent a premium on parts to future-proof my rig as much as possible. However, this left little in the budget for peripherals. Luckily for $30, this Redragon keyboard and mouse combo was a good deal.Pros:

CONS:  I'm taking off two stars mainly because of the strange Enter key.  I think all of us use the Enter key quite a bit, and you have to stretch your pinky quite far to reach it.  I knew this going in so it's hard to blame them.  I'm considering using some program to make right shift the Enter key instead, which will also require having me to retrain my mind to press right shift instead of Enter.  The WASD keys seem to be lower than the rest of the keyboard and is most noticeable with the D key being slightly lower than the F key; but this is a minor quibble and is hardly noticeable.PROS:  I love the feel and the quietness of the key presses.  The mouse is decent.  The mouse clicking noise is a little bit on the loud side, but it's not a dealbreaker.  My small gripe is that I'd like the mousewheel to have more tension when scrolling as I like to feel the discrete positions as you roll the mousewheel.

Uhh, each individual key is lit up but the light does not completely illuminate the key. The mouse ergonomics are weird in that they spread your fingers WAY out, I could never get into a comfortable clicking position. The wrist rest needed to be rubber or something so your and doesn't slide off, making it harder to type and the return policy I still don't understand because they took 6.99 out of my refund to pay for "The label printing" which the UPS store drop off, that's usually free with my Amazon prime, doesn't cover for some reason? I am now 7$ poorer and the only experience I have is with a keyboard and mouse that I didn't even like...I found a better one suited to my needs.

Very first thing I did with this keyboard once I got online is to go to amazon website and returned the item.Keyboard feel is meh. Not better than a stock keyboard that come with computers. Lettering on keyboard is not bright. I am returning more for the feel of key click. Did not hookup mouse. Assuming mousse is doing what it supposed to do

Tried to use it.  Just can't get used to the keys.  The keys are physically smaller that standard keyboards.  For me, not where I expect them to be.  Wife, who taught typing to HS students, can't type correctly on it due to key size.  Keys are too small, too close to together.  For me or my wife.Is back-lit, but just keeps flashing a never ending color pattern.  See no way to control that, again, software not included in the packaging.  Went to their website, neither the keyboard, the mouse nor the combo show on the page.

Update after weeks of use - still lovin' both mouse & keybrd.  Earlier: My primary use is typing. I wanted a better "feel" than my existing keyboards and plan to use mouse button macro to have gmail "delete current message and display the next." I judged $43 was a good price.  I've used it a week and I'm very please with mouse and keyboard.

This keyboard has a soft touch and has very smooth action. The mouse is heavy duty, which it took me a bit to get used to as I was used to a very light-weight mouse.  Now that I am used to it, I love it.The lighting is soothing and helps me manage in my dark office. Would purchase again.

OK, works fine I guess, but I did not realize that it is slightly smaller than standard size. Annoyingly so. I find myself missing keys frequently. Also, look closely at the picture at the placemen t of the |\ key. On most keyboards this is above the enter key but on this one it is next to the enter key, between the ' and enter. This is almost a deal-breaker forme by tistelf. Keys feel like cheap membrane. Keys are wiggly and does not enhance touch typing. I know it's a membrane keyboard but I kind of expected it to feel like a higher end membrane and it doesn't. The mouse seems OK, no real complaints. It's probably going back. Yea, it was cheap, what did I expect?Typos intentionally not correctsed.

Keyboard and mouse worked initially, but within the first day the mouse stopped being recognized by windows on multiple devices. I've reached out to Redragon via their website for support but as of now this is likely to be returned. Device Manager states Unknown USB Device (Port Reset Failed) on all machines I try the mouse with and no troubleshooting has helped so far so this is likely defective hardware.

Space bar started making squeaking sounds after about 10 months of daily use. I don't bash the thing and I didn't spill anything on it, so I'm not sure why the durability is lacking. I imagine there's maintenance that could go into it, but it's a $25 piece of tech . . . just buying a higher quality keyboard going forward.

This keyboard is pretty sweet. It came delivered without any packaging. Anyone at UPS could’ve made free with it but they didn’t. Which made me fear the quality of the keyboard bc nobody bothered to take it. However, it turned out to be a really nice keyboard. Just make sure to add gift wrapping or something so nobody will know what you ordered.

Many of the reviews stated that there were only three LED lights. This new improved version must be very different than the older one. I purchased this as a gift for my son. He was blown away by the lighting on both the keyboard and mouse. He also really likes the feel to the mouse. I give this 5 stars!I almost returned it due to the reviews. I'm glad I checked it out myself.

I used this combo every day for about a year and had absolutely no issues with it. Until one day I decided to splurge and get a "nice" keyboard and mouse. I went and bought a $60 Corsair mouse just to have the scroll wheel break in two months. Overall if you are just getting into gaming and are on a budget I highly recommend this combo.

I have only had this keyboard and mouse for a day now. I bought this after one of my toddlers dumped a cup of coffee in the my 100 dollar Logitech mouse and keyboard combo which I have had for about 5 years. This wasn't as upsetting as it sounds due to the mouse being on it last leg.I was skeptical at first for the price I wasn't expecting much in the way of quality but I'm actually quite impressed. The keyboard responds flawlessly and once you get the device driver downloaded for the mouse you can adjust the setting in it a lot to make it respond how you would like it too. If I have any issues I will up date this review but as of rate now for the price you can't beat it.

Need to hold down function key and press F2 or F3 to adjust volume.  Those should just be 1 button each.  And you need both hands to do it.  Very bad layout.  Also I went to red dragon website and there is no software to program any of this, just the mouse.  It is a cool keyboard, but the volume issue has me very annoyed.

Like the title says, the keyboard is fine, but I need to download a separate software to control the single color light on the mouse, which is automatically set to breathing. To get the software downloaded, I need to download a separate paid software.before you make changes with the keyboard, read the manual before you make a change you don’t like

If you are getting this for decoration, yes get this product. However, if you are planning to play some game I highly recommend NOT to buy this product.Keyboard does not work how it suppose to work it sometimes press random key by itself and leftshift does not work with other key just like how it shows on the video. This is not a good gaming keyboard.

I'm just a random colombian guy and I want to write my history to share my good experience with this seller. To put you in context. I was saving for buy my first pc gamer. Finally I was able to buy it. I'm happy. But... It was missing the keyboard and the mouse.  My first option was inquire in local pc gamer shops here in Colombia. The bad issues were the high prices or the poor variety of products. After, my second and final option was inquire in amazon.com.  Fortunately for me I see this seller and I choose it. I buy it on August 30th and it arrive on September 5th. The price is good. In conclusion, it is just very good. Buy this product.

Been using for over a year and still great performance. The lights are neat, the mouse reacts well even in FPSs such as CS:GO and various strategy games, and they still feel solid and look good. For their price, incredibly impressed. The wires have fabric and I use them for my labtop to give me a bit more control and range and I couldn't be happier. The alternative keys on top of the keyboard are also quite useful, just don't hold alt or ctrl with the arrow/WSAD keys or else it switches their functions in game.

My 10 year old son loves this keyboard and I do, too. The color selection choices are very nice, the quality is great for the price and it is efficient for someone who games a lot but is more casual about it. I am going to buy me the white and pastel one (for myself!) by this brand because I am happy with this one.
Very  neat little deal. For the amount you pay you get a working keyboard and a mouse too they both look super cool  too.  What are you waiting for buy  the set you have nothing to lose.

Easy to install, the instruction manual shows you how to change the lights and the mouse speed with just a couple button presses, easy to use and have been enjoying it so far, feels good for basic typing and the mouse has a good weight to it and the on the fly speed adjustments are a nice feature.

The keyboard works. The lighting is cool. For the price, I doubt there is anything better.  I don't like that every time I restart the computer I have to remember what the controls are to turn the lights to how I like them.  Gets old.  I swapped the mouse with a more understated mouse, but this mouse is a great backup.

For a wired keyboard this is great for the price. I bought it for my daughter, beginner gamer just to get started but it’s smooth brightly lit keys made it a flashy gift. I bought another for myself to replace the wireless that kept dying on me and I love it.

I can't complain because it was a real cheap set. But there really isn't anything special about this keyboard and mouse. Its just a regular made in china keyboard that they put a few glowing lights on to label it as a gaming keyboard. There is no macros or anything gaming related to it at all. Very cheaply made, because after only 3 months of use, the springs under the keys are already worn and rattle after every push making it really annoying sound. the Mouse has a really bad lag for some reason, tried playing with settings in windows and still lag. So has to be the mouse. I left my keyboard at my other house, so this was okay for temp, but would not buy for perm. use.

I will just go ahead and start with the one "con" side of this combo. You can't change the color display for the mouse. Yup, that's it, and that is nit picking. The keyboard itself has an array of colors and a couple sequenced RGB patterns. I am not a heavy PC gamer but the games I have played using this keyboard; I have found no reason to complain. There are obviously higher quality keyboards and accessories out on the market but for the $ you can't go wrong with this. Has about a standard key stroke noise and without a basic wrist rest, it can get annoying if you plan on typing for extended periods of time without a rest. On that note though, what keyboard without a wrist rest wouldn't be taxing after a period of time. Nice, simple product with some flashy notes. Worth the purchase.

This keyboard is pretty with all the lights, but the keystrokes don’t register well, and my typing is seriously affected.. I have to type really slowly for it to register on the computer.  I will be returning.

I won't knock any stars off because this is definitely a good keyboard and mouse for the price, even if not gaming. the keyboard was too small to use comfortably. Not a problem, my wife uses it comfortable for her work computer.

This keyboard and mouse combo is a fantastic deal. The mouse is the Redragon Centrophorus, which is pretty high quality. It has removable metal weights in its body and customizable DPI. However, I had already ordered a Redragon Mammoth gaming mouse prior to this purchase, so my main concern was the quality of the keyboard. I was not disappointed. Although the keyboard is a membrane keyboard, the keys feel somewhat like those of a mechanical keyboard, making this keyboard a good choice for those on a budget. The activation force is around 55 grams, and the matte finish of the keyboard feels fantastic. My favorite feature of this keyboard is the texturing of the F and J keys, which makes it extremely easy to find the home row, even if this keyboard does not have backlit keys. With the package comes a keycap puller, which works fine but is not as robust as metal keycap pullers.Mouse:

Typing feels great on this keyboard, lighting options are fine personally, I imagine someone who like more customization would want more out of it, but I don't care about that too much. The mouse works fine but I bought this set specifically for the keyboard so not going to review the mouse any further.

The keyboard is pretty nice. It’s a good value for the money as far as gaming keyboards go, so it’s basically just a keyboard that’s a little more responsive and feels nice to use. The mouse is a little bit of a different story, but it’s not too bad; even though it has a decent weight to it, it isn’t RGB, the wheel sometimes doesn’t work right, and the side buttons are accidentally pressed by my thumb all the time which undos pages on Chrome. I’d say this is pretty good for a beginner, but a better mechanical keyboard and mouse from the same brand would only set you back another $20 or so.

It works for what I need, and that is solid performance with no lag or disconnects. I am coming from using wireless and lately I have been having nothing but problems with wireless technology.While I don't like a mess of wires, I do like how the mouse uses a cloth shielded wire. The keyboard has keys that are comfortable to use, as they are indented and feel like an old mechanical keyboard. The keyboard's keys are relatively quiet.... So while not perfect, this set-up gets 4 out of 5 stars.

Overall, both mouse and keyboard are excellent. Mouse is responsive and fits well in the hand, as well as having textured plastic that makes it easy to grip. The keyboard is excellent as well, and functions perfectly.My only complaint, (which is purely aesthetic) is that the RGB back lighting on the keyboard will always be rainbows moving from right to left, and while you can adjust the brightness and the speed, there's no way that I've found to just have it be one uniform color without turning the back lighting off altogether (which makes the keys difficult to see, especially in dim light), but for a price this low, I really have no right to nitpick.

I've had both of these items for nearly 5 months, and I haven't regretted them at all. The keyboard is easy to get used too, and the mouse fits perfect in my hand. I don't like lighted keyboards, so this works perfectly for me. The mouse is very dim, so that's a plus. I'm very hard on my keyboards, and mice. The fact they've held up this long surprises me, and goes to show that even inexpensive items can be diamonds in the rough. All in all, I'd recommend this package to ANYONE, whether an inexperienced gamer, or veteran.The Mouse:

I initially really liked the feel of the keyboard, as the keys weren't too loud when pressing on them (I did not want a loud keyboard) and it felt pretty smooth, but as I keep using it, I am noticing that the some of the buttons stick a lot, especially the tab button. I have to really put pressure on my 4th finger to press the tab button and it's getting really uncomfortable. It's unfortunate but I will have to return this because of it.

Really like this; the keys are a little lower and quieter than normal keyboards and looks super cool with all the lighting options, which are very simple to set up thanks to the very clear manual.  The breathing effect in particular is very cool and the level of brightness is perfect in a dark room.

The keyboard and mice both seem decent. Color controls are on the keyboard itself via Fn+[key] combo's, which is perhaps an advantage over having custom installed software that higher-end backlit keyboards provide.My kids love 'em. We'll see how they hold up over time.

So I just got the keyboard. Shipping was very fast. The keyboard was in a box and well protected with bubblewrap. Once I got it hooked up, It looked very cool all lit up. I like the fact that the movement keys and Arrow keys are red. It did come with a key remover. Seems to be very well built. Keys are easy to strike, however the space bar is the only key that seems a bit harder to press(it works great, just needs a tad bit more pressure). The mouse is very comfortable and has adjustable weights inside which is a great feature. Both the keyboard and mouse have long braided cables which is absolutely great. Over all 4.5 out of 5.

this keyboard and mouse set is amazing for a cheap first set, i have used it for about 3 months as a placeholder before i upgraded to a $60 Razer mouse and a real fancy mechanical keyboard. you will not get better mouse and keyboard without spending at least triple the price, and when you do upgrade the mouse, you dont need to upgrade the keyboard if you dont want to, unless you plan to go all in on learning about mechanical keyboards, this works fine.

This keyboard was fantastic for my boy. Got it for him for Christmas. Turned on the PC today and the mouse still functions, but the keyboard will not do anything. Sad face.I will say this was a fantastic keyboard for Smite and LoL as well as Warcraft. No complaints until it died.

Excellent for gaming and looking cool on the desk.  Love the color backlit keys.  Good for seeing where the W key is in dimly lighted rooms after 12 solid hours of destiny or division.  The mouse can go to 3200 dpi making for fast turn and kills in battlefield.If I had to do more than occasional email sorts of typing I would definitely get a mechanical keyboard for that purpose.  I am not sure I would want to do any heavy coding or thesis typing on this.

I bought this mouse and keyboard set to use for my PC that I built. I didn't want to spend a crazy amount, so this set was a great price. They both work great. The light feature on the keyboard, come on, its cool, can't deny that. The mouse has a button to click that adjusts its sensitivity which is nice. The black and red color scheme just so happen to match the case on my PC. The keyboard types very quietly which I do like. Overall, would recommend!

My last keyboard I bought for back lighting failed horribly.  This keyboard is far different.  There are several options for how you would like the back lighting to perform and the colors are great.  The mouse lighting is annoying though and that is the only drawback I have found other than each time I turn my pc back on, I have to reset the back light settings.

The keyboard so far has worked 10/10, I liked it a lot, unfortunately I can not say the same about the mouse I came with, because it did not last a full week and I already had damage in the scroll wheel, it did not roll well and I had to I uncovered the mouse several times in order to fix it, but after a week I would go back and decompose the wheel, so I had to force myself to buy another mouse. that's why it receives three stars, because the keyboard worked very well, it hurts that the mouse has not been equal.-

The very best thing about this gaming keyboard is that the volume, view mic controls are NOT on the sides.  They're on the top.  Every time I move the keyboard I don't have to worry that I've hit one of those buttons cos they're not in the way.  The keyboard isn't so bright that it's blinding but the keys are well lit and easy to find.  The space between the keys is very comfortable for typing by touch.  I'm really excited to use this new keyboard of mine.

It is a nice keyboard I love the way it types the lights, the only problem I have is that the legs dont give it much if any tilt, which even with the lights at its brightest makes it difficult to see the letters.I have to place a little book underneath to create a more comfortable angle.

This is a very quiet keyboard, with linear type key presses. The backlight is nice with tons of modes and adjustments, but it doesn't save between reboots. The mouse only has red lights, but aside from that is pretty good. It is weighted, has a quick adjust dpi adjustment right behind the wheel and very light, but audible clicks. For the price, very tough to beat.
This keyboard and mouse are super cool looking you can change colors - there is no delay - works awesome - looks awesome - highly recommend!

Got this product to use with a Xim Apex on PS4, it worked perfect!  However there was one weird thing, when it arrived the space bar is stuck in the down position.  And unfortunately that key is the hardest to takeoff/put back together.  I eventually got it and everything worked perfect.  Because I'm not using it on a computer I cannot control the normal functions of the keyboard like the lights, so its permanently rainbow, which I dont have a problem with.Overall its a great product, doesnt feel like cheap like I was expecting.

I wish the settings would stay set.  You have to set up the keyboard color/theme every time you restart the computer.It does have a nice feel to the keys, and once set up the way you like it (every time you turn on your computer) it is easy to read.  I like the red or blue settings the best.

The keyboard itself works fine. These aren't high end mechanical switches, but I wanted something like this to begin with, as they aren't as loud. The RGB works fine, although it is a bit dim at times.  My only issue comes from the durability of the keys.  I have had 2 issues with them:1: My space bar started "sticking": Since the space key is one of the most used keys in FPS, it was naturally the first key to start sticking. I managed to fix it by straightening out the metal rod inside of it, but this shouldn't be necessary for a 6 month old keyboard.

I have never played many games on a p.c before, at least not since maybe 15 plus years ago. This I would consider my introduction to playing competitive multiplayer games on a keyboard. Had it for about a month now; The product works great but I struggled at first to find the right key binds to fit me well, however I think that was due to me never playing on a keyboard prior. The mouse was good at first, but I've switched to a more advanced expensive one to improve my performance. The light up features were cool and all but there's a software you need to download if you want to customize it and I found the directions to getting, installing, and troubleshooting the software to be rather poor. I was personally having issues getting the software to work once I downloaded it, and couldn't find any definitive answer to why I was having the issues I was which is why this isn't a full 5 star. Overall solid product, software is iffy .

I bought this keyboard and mouse a little over a year ago, and since then it has held up nicely. For the keyboard (at first) the keys were a bit hard to push down (even after time had passed), but eventually I wore them down (I guess they were stiff due to lack of use). The keys have a nice feel, and not cheap like something else you'd buy at this price. As for the mouse, it's actually pretty comfortable when using. I game quite a lot (and as it is currently Summer, all the more), and I was looking for a nice keyboard and mouse where I could feel comfortable, type fast and easy, and swiftly and cleanly move my hand two and fro. What I really enjoy about the mouse is the fact that there are adjustable weights in the bottom. You can easily screw and unscrew the bottom cap, and take out as much weight as you want from the mouse, to give it a more light feel. Now, don't get me wrong, the mouse isn't heavy at all when it's at it's default weight, it's about as heavy as any average mouse you have or will use in your life. SIDE BUTTONS - I (as a PC gamer) always enjoy a couple of side buttons to bind to certain commands or chat messages, and this mouse came with 2 extra side buttons, which is awesome, especially for the price.I'd say this keyboard and mouse combo is good for the price. The reason I did not put an entire 5 stars for my review is due to the angle the keyboard is. It may be just me, but, say, with the Razer keyboards, a few of them have a flat-ish, hardly-angled front to them, where you can easily rest your wrists, and with this keyboard I can't comfortably wrest my wrists down on the keyboard's edge, but that's just me being OCD. Other than that, good keyboard (and mouse).

I send this to a friend that had been talking about getting this style keyboard with the back lights.  She likes it a great deal. She says its different than other style she had that was quite worn, so its taking her a while to adjust to the keys. She likes the back lit keys.  She also likes the mouse. She has small hands and says the mouse is a good size.  Overall she is happy.

Bought it be used on the xbox and it did work well but I liked it better than the keyboard I had on the computer and switched it to the computer. Has a better feel and response than the keyboard that came with the computer.The mouse is also nice and works good with the xbox.

UPDATE: My left mouse clicker is now kinda stuck. When i single click it registers as a double click.Keyboard keys are very stiff, completely different than my first purchase. Frequent password mistakes due to stiff keys not registering key presses. The mouse on the other hand is excellent. Its very unfortunate that my second purchase is such a bummer. If they could get the quality control of the keyboard to match my first keyboard purchase then this set would be a five star.

I am a long time gamer,& I have purchased several gaming keyboards & Gaming Mouse`s (Mice) over the years. And for the $$ this one cant be beat. They keyboard is very comfortable & nicely designed (I love the pr-programmed hot keys). The mouse is very comfortable,& very precise movement. The only real complaint is the driver for the side buttons on the mouse.It isn't worth a crap from a gaming standpoint,because of the 33 hot key options. Most of them are all windows related,Not game related. But if you download ANTNSOFT key mapper. You can utilize ALL the mouse buttons with that software. The wighted mouse & adjustable on the fly dpi are great. My only complaint is the mouse driver. Other then that this combo mouse & keyboard are Rock Solid gaming material & more then worth the $$. :)

The mouse is okay. The keyboard, however, I dislike. The keys don’t register quickly enough and get stuck while gaming. Often times I have to press them multiple times to register/or release the keys I am pressing at the moment with them. Should’ve known since it says it’s not 100% anti-ghosting. But at the time I wasn’t too sure how much of an effect it would have. Going to try and order another keyboard that has that capability and is mechanical red switch instead.

Good little keyboard mouse combo. My only two complaints are that 1. The keyboard changes color but the mouse is only red and doesn't change to match the keyboard, and 2. The keyboard colors need to be reset every time you turn the computer back on. Other than that, the keyboard mouse combo is great.

My windows key and directional keys no longer work after 3 months. It appears it may be a driver issue, but I can't find this model on the download site. What a waste. Also, I seriously hate the mouse and never use it. Not only is it ugly, it is super sluggish.

The keyboard is good quality and typing with the keys is nice. Good size keyboard. The colors light up very nicely and I like the sleep mode button a lot. I just wish that the color I set it at would stay that way when I turn off the computer, but all I have to do is hit the FN key along with the Home key to set the color I want when I turn on the PC, not that big a deal. I like to switch around the colors anyway. The mouse stays the same color all the time....red.

For a starter keyboard and mouse this combo is going to be hard to beat for the price. After 2 weeks of continued use they are both holding up just like new. The LED lights look and work good if that’s what you’re into. My only problem is the fact it is wired and sometimes the wires get tied and tugged on things when you are trying to work the mouse, but I suppose if you are buying a wired setup that comes with the territory and I can’t really complain. All in all I would recommend for someone looking for a cheap, good quality combo that will get you started and last until you feel like upgrading

This keyboard and mouse combo is pretty great. The keyboard has quite a bit of noise to it and is pretty quick. One note to make is the keyboard, although stated is backlit, is really not. It does have 5 lights throughout the keyboard though. The keyboard, although responsive, has the keys feeling a bit too hard to press for my taste. Nonetheless, it's still really good. The mouse is good too. At max settings, the mouse is pretty fast and the lighting is good too. I can't really say much about the mouse as i have far less experience in mice than i do keyboards, but it seems pretty good to me.TL;DR

Bought because I just needed a keyboard, I play online gaming, mostly at night, so the lighting feature was pretty important. This comes with a variety of different lighting options which I think is pretty cool, I change it every so often just for fun, it's really easy to do. It's also not super loud which I really like. And it came with the corded mouse (been wanting to get rid of my battery powered mouse anyways) for a really good price. Overall really happy with it.

Mouse left click went out and T key on keyboard also stopped. Filed a warranty claim as they have an 18 months warranty. Apparently they will replace it but it's at my expense. I have to cover all shipping costs. How dare you. It's your product that was fault. I understand things happen and I'm more than happy to send the defective products back but this is the first time a company has ever expected me, the consumer, to cover the cost of shipping for their faulty manufacturing. Never buying again.

Keyboard feels very cheap and started to make noises after a weak. The mouse that came with it cuts already out. Overall very bad quality and a big waste of money. Better invest a bit more and have something working and lasting.

The keyboard is great. Keys are soft. You can change colors and it's awesome. The mouse is large, too wide. Using it for a while the hand and fingers are having pain. The main picture of this produce shows the mouse pad, however mouse pad didn't come. It causes confusing because not everybody have time to check it. There are many other products with same price including mouse pad and headset.
The good:Mouse feels very nice with many programmable options (need to install driver from website).

Functionality is great. Improved gameplay immensely. Only 4 stars for two reasons. First, every time I turn in my computer I have to manually set the color since I’m not a fan of the pulsing rainbow. Second, the mouse sensitivity is poor. I prefer a very fast mouse, and after adjusting all the settings on my computer to the max level, it still takes a very long stroke to get from one side of the screen to the other.

This has 3 keys that aren't working that I use a lot and I cannot type with the keyboard because of this, i would like to get a new product back and return this one that I have! I cannot believe what they did, I was gone today at the doctors and when I got back the keyboard was laying out in the sun bulged out and it looks like it was already torn open and used!

I am very very satisfied with this setup. The only thing I would have done differently is get a mouse with more customizable buttons. Quality wise though, couldn't be happier and like the color options and lights used for the keyboard. I wish I could turn the mouse lights off, but eh.

The keyboard is excellent. Quiet, responsive, and easy to use. I love it.The mouse? It can go die a horrible death. I plugged it in, went and installed new drivers, re-installed them, rebooted a thousand times, and then....I went back to my plain old Microsoft mouse. It's absolutely horrible. It lags. It jumps. It skips. It is pretty much worthless. And since I wanted a mouse I could use all day (I am working in and on software all day, every day) I wanted something better. This thing is the worst mouse I have ever had. I was really excited about it too.

**UPDATE**The company quickly processed a return for just the keyboard which is exactly what I wanted. They couldn't replace the exact keyboard but the one they sent seems exactly the same, and for the price overall of this bundle I can't complain. Overall this is a nice keyboard for the price, you can change the lights and the keys are pleasant to the touch and not loud like some other keyboards. I'm glad the company was very responsive and quick in getting me an exchange for the keyboard, thanks! Oh, and the mouse is good too. If you don't want to drop a bunch of $$ to play some PC games then this is your keyboard + mouse bundle.

Been hearing alot about these keyboard and mouse combos and alot about Redragon products. I got the keyboard and mouse a day eailer then it was post to be here and wow. First RGB mouse and keyboard combo. So far great. will find out more when i play my games.

When I got the product, the box that it was in was in a bad shape. I was hoping that the products inside were ok, but I was wrong. The keyboard works just fine. However, the mouse is a different story. Both left and right click are not working. I will edit my review once I get a replacement for it.Edit: 5/5/20

Ever since i got mine its had problems. for some reason while in game, it wants to just keep pushing enter to type in chat. its very frustrating especially during competitive matches. it light up decently too. not the brightest, but does offer multiple colors. im going to invest on another brand.

The only thing that I don't like about it - is that there is a cord that has to be plugged in, although I understand that this is intended to be a gaming keyboard and mouse. The precision is great, the keys flow and the mouse isn't overly sensitive with its movements.

So I bought the bundle to replace my old mouse and keyboard. They keyboard is alright, does the job however it's annoying to readjust the lights every time you boot, you have to reselect color mode. I grabbed an app to lock down my color because i hated changing it every time i booted my computer. The mouse isn't that great for gaming, it also suffers from the same thing the keyboard, it doesn't save your sensitivity and you have to find it every time. I replaced the mouse it came with because it was junk. However for the price i guess it's decent. Just wish they would have solved those problems mentioned.
If you are looking for a cheap keyboard for a few games here and there? Great! This is worth it!However, if you want to play seriously with this keyboard, you might want to consider elsewhere.

An awesome upgrade to a standard, comes with computer, keyboard from Dell. The lights are adjustable. The mouse is super comfortable for college online and gaming. The speed of the mouse is adjustable which is great for different computer users. All in all, a great bargin

If you need something flashy that works, but don't want to spend the cash this may be for you. I've had them for about six months now and I can't stand them anymore so I just broke down and ordered better quality products. The duo just feel cheap. The plastic feels cheap, the weight and size of the mouse is garbage, and the keyboards incline feels awkward. The only real quality feature is the braided mouse cord, as my desk likes to eat them (nomnomnom.) If your using this for actual gaming and not office work please do yourself a favor and spend the extra money!

I haven't personally used this since I bought it for my nephew.  However, I'm guessing he loves it.  He disappears for hours in his room and we don't see him.  So, if you are tired of dealing with your kid, buy this keyboard.  Good value for the price.  Free babysitting!

I've had this combo for about a week now and I see why it's been consistently highly rated.  The keyboard and mouse are, for lack of a better word, tight.  Gamers know what I mean.  There's no need to put $200 into a combo when this does the trick at $40.  Considering buying another set for 2nd setup.

You really can't go wrong with this combo and price. I did have a few times one day where a key would just continue going on like it was stuck but it was just one day and only a few times so I will chock it up to the Windows OS. I am not a gamer so I have no idea how this would work in that environment.

I love this keyboard and mouse. It is super easy to install, NO SOFTWARE! Just plug it in and go. The light is bright without being too much. The mouse is a little small, if you have big hands. I had a Corsair expensive keyboard and it didn't work right and kept typing all 7's. Don't waste your money on the expensive stuff. This is all you need. Love the product and price. You have a customer for life!!!!!

I am very pleased with this combo for the price.  I was originally just going to buy the Redragon mouse, but then I saw the combo so I decided to try it out.  So far so good.  The mouse is great for both gaming and office work.  The keyboard works well but it's nothing special.

I love this keyboard but it does not work well with apple products, the Mac that I'm using right now as an in-between work computer as my gaming and work setup is coming together does not like the keyboard, it can't identify it but other than that it works how it's supposed to!

My son loves this gaming keyboard and mouse very much. The keys and mouse have a grip feeling which helps a lot playing games. The back lighting is changeable. Only complaint I have is it arrived in the original box with a shipping label on it. He saw it when he came home from school. My fault for not looking to see if there was discreet shipping. I would highly recommend this to anyone!

The keyboard is pretty cool, I do wish the light were a bit brighter. The keys are visible but parts of them aren't fully lit such at the top half of the words Insert / Home / Page (in Page Up). The mouse is red only which was a disappointment but for the price this product isn't bad. The mouse is 5 click with a 4 setting speed click in the center. It resets after ever restart which is super annoying.

I used this keyboard and mouse because I have difficulty seeing and I needed a back lit keyboard. The keyboard is not as bright as I would like and most of the lights are not useful to me. However the mouse was very good. I would strongly recommend  it.

Not sure why I do this, but after two years of buying those two pieces still work great! Now I have two computers that I need to constantly switch between, I'm looking to buy a wireless keyboard that allows me switch between my devices seamlessly. So, just want to say thank you to this product that it served very well to me in the past two years! And don't hesitate to buy if you are looking for a keyboard-mouse set that's relatively cheap and that's of good quality!

I love this keyboard and mouse setup. Great build quality. The cables themselves are made of a very nice red and black fabric sleeving. The lights on it are subtle and just look good in general. One thing to keep in mind is that this is NOT a back lit keyboard. Which is fine for me. I wasn't looking for back lighting when I bought this.I use this for gaming at least 95% of the time. I'm in fact typing out this review on it right now. Very responsive. Never had any issues while gaming on it. The mouse and the removable weights is nice. I haven't really messed around with them much but I do know that if you removed all of them the mouse itself is as light as a feather.

Stunningly great for the price. I bought this set for my office computer and I really like it. For reference, my home computer has a Razor Black Widow Ultimate and a Logitech Proteus Core, and while I wouldn't say these compare favorably with those two, I would say that the dropoff is significantly less than the horrendous stock keyboard I was provided with. The mouse in particular is great! The keyboard keys are a little mushy, and the construction is pretty flimsy. You can actually see through the keyboard at one spot! For the price though, I would find it difficult to find anything much better or more stylish!

My 11-year old son wanted a gaming keyboard for his Xbox One and this works well and looks really cool. The different light settings are fun and the mouse is comfortable. He wishes the mouse changed colors as well (lol) but for the price this was a great buy. The cords are long and sturdy as well.

I had been using the same old OEM keyboard and mouse for years. When I had to finally deep six my keyboard I decided to spring for a "slightly nicer" keyboard and mouse. And this thing FAR exceeded my expectations. It's beautifully designed, and feels amazing to use. The mouse is comfortable and is VENTED! I love it. The beautiful glow of the light (which is customizeable), just brings a pleasant feeling to the soul. I rarely review anything but I'm so happy with this buy!

The backlight is bright enough BUT only illuminates the bottom half upper legends of the dual-legend (numeric and Function) keys. Those upper key legends are illegible without getting within 10" of the keys. The keyboard has no memory function so backlight settings has to be reset every time it is powered on.

Very light weight and cheap feeling. Mouse stopped working after 2 months. Since it was past the 30 days for return, I have to pay to mail it back to get a replacement. Talk about not standing by your product. Last time buying this brand.

Like the feel and the back lights. Switching off PC resets the back light. Have to re-choose my settings again. Overall good product. An inconvenience to get back to the desired back light setting again.Switch off PC button puts the PC into sleep mode and not switch off completely. Pressing the button brings up the computer and the back light settings are retained.

I like the bright lit keys. If you play with the lights down low, you can still see these. The sound of the keys it too loud for me. I don't what the lady in the other room complaining about the constant click click click.The corded mouse is too small for my hand but the lighting design is great.

The mouse that comes with the keyboard works just fine.  However, the keyboard just stopped working out of the blue.  I was able to get it to turn back on and the next day it went completely dead.  It lasted a total of 3 months of light use.  I'd shop elsewhere for a keyboard.  Spending an extra $50 you can get a keyboard that will last a decade.

The keyboard and mouse look and work very nice.  I am just disappointed that while the mouse has support so you can set up macros and control the lighting, the keyboard itself does NOT.  you can manually use the function key to set it how you like, but every time you log out or reboot it resets to rapidly blinking lights.  so it isnt much, but having to hit FN-End to stop the blinking every time I log on gets old very quickly, and I wish I had known this before buying.
Great keyboard and the mouse is really good i think i like the mouse the best. but for the money I say if you don'
What a GREAT product for the price!!The keyboard (at least the new version) is RGB with basic customization. The mouse feels great and is very responsive.

The Keyboard feels good to type on and is High Quality.  The Mouse is also awesome.  I like how it is easy to change the lighting on the keyboard to many  variations and even to no back lighting.  I Highly recommend Red Dragon Products.

Had to get a replacement for my old back-lit gaming keyboard, finally decided on this one. I really like that you can change the color (rainbow, green, blue, and red). Took a while to figure out how to change the color from pulsating to constant color, but after figuring that out its a really cool keyboard. Mouse was an added bonus, love the high quality of the cord, as well as the lightweight feel. Overall love this new addition to my gaming PC!

The colors are cool and the design is ergonomic but the keyboard has a serious sticky key issue to the point that it is almost unusable for extended periods. My mornings as a result are spent repeatedly unplugging and plugging back in the keyboard, tapping the keys (enter and shift are the worst) until after an indeterminate amount of time, it resolves itself. And I am a programmer, so you can imagine the frustration.I've never had this issue with a keyboard before. Is there some way to fix this? I'm considering returning this item. Can you help me Redragon?

Mouse is great, Keyboard is great(Not mechanical, but responsive enough for me), everything's still working 2+ years later and I use the computer a lot.... Would recommend if you're looking for a budget keyboard and mouse combo... They sell them separate too I think if you look for it.Pros: Long-lasting, Can disable lights on the keyboard.
super cute and well made keyboard! absolutely no problems with it, quiet keys, nice lighting, the mouse is responsive. couldn't ask for more for the price!

Amazing keyboard for the price! I had tried 3 others prior that were in this price range, but this one is the best and if absolutely recommend!Keys are soft and not too loud, mouse has different dpi settings!  Keyboard can change colors easily and mouse is red.

Useless. In the FAQ it was said that it was 1 USB connection. Both the keyboard and mouse require a USB. I would have to choose between my headset or external storage to use this. Get your FAQ's straightened out

This is just a normal keyboard. Other than RGB, the feelings when you press the keys, how they respond to your touches are pretty much the same as to normal computer keyboards. Keys are plastic. Brightness of RGB is just decent. I'd rather give K552 a try.

For the money you can't beat it. While mine had a very minor superficial defect (which they offered to go above and beyond on a RMA over something so simple and silly, that I couldn't see myself costing them money for the price I paid and the overall quality of the product!) Absolutely love the feel and the changeable weights of the mouse! As for the keyboard as I said a stupidly minor defect, but overall, It feels great, key strokes are smooth and fast, it looks very good. Spill resistant too, c'mon can't beat it! Would purchess again. Customer service was TOP NOTCH. Look no further!

So far, so good! I couldn't find a better deal for the money, and I've been impressed since the moment it arrived. What a gorgeous looking keyboard, multiple settings for the colors that you can fit to your liking, and the mouse works exceptionally well! I've not had it all too long, but maybe in 6 months or a year, I'll update... As for now, it is a beautiful, comfortable, sexy and sleek keyboard that would fit any customer's taste! Hope you enjoy much as I have.

Bought this for a recent computer build. Actually I am using it right now to write this review. I like the keyboard and the mouse is great. Good feel to both of them. The reason for the three stars is that the LEDs on my keyboard have already gone out. It still works but come on.... lights on the mouse are still a go but can't believe that the keyboard lights are out already. Great feel to both and a solid buy for the money but can't justify more than 3 at the moment.UPDATE: Magically my lights on my keyboard decided to start working again... interesting. I upgraded to a 4 star pending the lights stay on this time. We will see...

Used it for a while now and have absolutely no issues. Its surprisingly of good quality and its affordability makes a much better alternative to the Razer series and other comparitive well known brands. I chose to seperately buy the M901 Perdition mouse since it came with 12 programmable keys and love it. The UI to program the mouse is user friendly and does not have a steep learning curve. The program itself is clean and does not interfere with other programs or games. I do have 16 gb of RAM so I cannot say how this will act with someone using less that 8 gb of RAM as I dont anticipate any issues with anyone using over 4gb of memory. The key board easily responds to your touch and I'd say you can get pretty good use out of it apart from the fact that it looks real nice

I’m no expert by no means when it comes to gaming but this keyboard and mouse are actually really nice. Seems high quality to me but like I said, I’m not a gamer. My son is 7 and is getting into gaming so I got this for him. Highly recommend!

This is the second keyboard and mouse combo I’ve purchased. I bought one several months ago for my son and had to buy another for my daughter! They use them for gaming and my son who is very picky about his gaming accessories was adamant that I buy the same one for his sister (in a different color of course). The quality is great and so is the price. Would definitely purchase again in the future!

Purchased for personal use, but placed in kids room.  The quality of unit didn't impress me.  I would not use as a gaming keyboard or mouse - just seems stiff to my preference.  I'm okay with purchase for the price paid, but again I didn't keep it I gave it to my son to use.  If you need a cheap keyboard and mouse that is usb powered I'd buy it.  If you have the resources I'd look elsewhere.

I've only been using my new keyboard for a day, but so far, I like it. The colors aren't too bright but I haven't had time yet to truly play with the lights. I do like that I can change from flashing to full color. The keys are comfortable and quiet. It was easy to hook up, just plug it in and there you have it.

I got this to play on Xbox one and it works like a charm. You can use the keyboard to navigate the Xbox but the mouse does not. The colors on the keyboard light up really nicely and you can adjust them to your own taste. The mouse also glows a cool red and works as expected. I don’t use it a lot but when I do it works perfectly. A well spent $20 Black Friday purchase.

When a product arrives and refuses to function properly, when the software support fails miserably, and when the product is incompatible with the rest of the systems it's easy to write a review.THIS PRODUCT SUCKS!

I was questioning the quality of what I would get for this price, but I am very happy with this. My home-made desktop has color settings and I can make all three red and match. Works great if you type or play with the lights off. I mainly do writing and video editing so I cannot offer much on the gaming side as far as response times. The mouse is fantastic and keyboard is ergonomic. Very pleased with quality of products and ease of use on drivers and software of each and cannot imagine spending $130 for same concept with other brands. Customer for life!

While I get complimented on the look of this keyboard-mouse duo quite often, I've only had the devices for 3 months when the mouse ceased performing well. It skips around my screen and 'gets lost,' which is a problem when editing (copied material ends up where it shouldn't) and when working with elaborate documents, like excel, in which one might accidentally drag a cell's content where it shouldn't be and by the time one realizes it, it's too late to figure out what used to be where. It's a mess. Don't recommend this set-up for long-term use; only short-term when you want something fancy.

I cannot believe there is not a simple button on the side or bottom of the mouse for you to turn the lights off. This is absurd. If a mouse can light up, it is absolutely essential that the lights be easily turned off. I should not have to download software or break the item down just to get inside and disable the lighting. I am amazed any company could be stupid enough to make a product without this capability. I love the keyboard which is why I did not give this one star, but threw out the mouse the first night and bought a different one from a company with some sense.

i bought this for a recent 2020 build. good quality, keys arent loud, keyboard displays moving rbg. not too dim not too bright. mouse is quiet also and also flashes(just a red light) however im not a gamer so i have no opinion on this product when it comes to gaming but it was a very affordable buy for me and does the job!

The mouse is pretty well made. I have been using this for about 3 months now and no problems so far. The keyboard is decent but it seemed a bit bulky with a plastic feel when pressed. Doesn't feel like a gaming keyboard at all. A regular hp keyboard have a better typing and gaming sensation than this. Overall this was a decent purchase.

When I was shopping around for a keyboard and mouse, I came across red dragon. I read the reviews, and with the great price attached to it, I swooped in and bought it. I didn't know exactly what to expect at first but, I am highly satisfied.The grip and feel of the mouse makes gaming that much better. The keyboard keys don't stick and are smooth to the touch. The beautiful design of both keyboard and mouse top off the review and make this a fantastic buy. The lights make the product sleek and perfect for the night time gaming.

I bought this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend and he loves it. It’s everything he wanted. It was hard to find a keyboard that you can choose to color. So happy I found this one. It’s simple and easy. Great price and great product.

Since it arrived broken, I can’t testify to how it works.  What I can say is that the packaging is horrible as it has no padding in it at all.  The back of the keyboard is completely cracked open and won’t turn on.  This was a gift from Santa and hard to explain why Santa brought a broken keyboard.  :(

I had been gaming on a mac low profile keyboard for a while and was having trouble with my fingers running over on other keys while gaming.  found this keyboard and the price seemed fair and had alot of good reviews.  The keyboard has worked very nicely with the mouse.  The keys have a little mechanical click to them but i would not say it is loud at all.  You know you hit the key but it does not come through your mic.  The mouse is has also worked out very well, it is solid and has a light rubberized feel to it..

I purchased this because I needed a new keyboard and mouse for work. Our current set was older and losing connection. I know it is a gaming set, but I still purchased because it was a good price and colorful. Needless to say, I am a huge kid and super distracted lol. But it was easy to set up, literally plug and play. Super quiet to type on. Just bright enough with the option to change it.

I had some reservations about how much effort it would take to get everything working under Linux (Mint 19.1), but I went ahead and bought anyway.  Turns out all I had to do was plug-and-play, no extra effort required.  Love the look and feel of both the keyboard and mouse.  My little ones love watching me switch through the different color modes on the keyboard and calling them out along the way.

Alright so this just arrived today. It's alright.The mouse - The mouse is absolutely amazing. It's everything I wanted, it feels nice in your hand, it connects great, weighs perfectly (if it doesn't to you, there's even little weights). The lights look pretty nice and the scrolling is great. Clicks nicely and is great for fighting in different games.

Typed 6 psychology papers and easily sixty hours of gaming so far, highly recommend the keyboard. The mouse isn't bad but admittedly I quickly switched back to my Corsair M56? (I think) the mouse gets less use with my laptop at school. Quality is very good regardless of price! Plan on buying Red Dragon from here on out!

Got this set a couple of months ago and it is still working as smooth as when I first got it. Really like the overall design of the keyboard, but there are not many LEDs so the RGB is not really smooth (Not that matters). The mouse is really responsive and smooth, and I strongly recommend this product for any FPS game

I needed a keyboard for an under-desk tray and this keyboard worked out nicely.  The lighted keyboard was a necessity as I work late into the evening and I struggled to see the keyboard before.  The keys are a bit tight so it does require good keyboarding posture or the keys may feel sticky but when used properly it is an excellent product.

I used this to replace an older keyboard and it works very well. As for the mouse, it's quite nice as well, it doesn't have the thin rubber coating that just soaks up oil from your hands. The LEDs on the keyboard could be brighter but even with optic nerve damage, I can at least see the keyboard without a problem. With 7 color settings on the keyboard, it's worth the price.

My main criterion for choosing this keyboard and mouse were quiet for the keyboard and adjustable pixel count for the mouse.  The adjustable LED feature of the keyboard was an unexpected plus.  The mouse has a good feel.  The textured top has good tactile feedback and the design nicely fits my hand.

I love the lights, honestly, I was transfixed by them once I first bought this. And honestly they are not very distracting when you're typing. At least for me. Not the most ergonomic in design but all the fashion. There are keyboards that you can type faster with.

Pretty good keyboard overall, packaging is a little on the HUGE side with minimal impact protection but everything arrived okay. The backspace key is a little mushy, making it delete words a little on the slow side. Massive RGB control with easy to use instructions, everything from speed brightness and color selection. One thing I do not like is not being able to change the breathing mouse lights, wish I could turn it off but it's fine.

I am loving this combo! The mouse has a few too many buttons that I have no idea what they do, but I bought this for the keyboard anyway. The back lite feature is exactly what I wanted. Love the ability to change it.
