The keyboard works and is colrful..... not much to say about it as i just left it in the box after seeing if it works... Will hold it as a spare until my old keyboard dies.

I absolutely love this combo. I got it for about $36 and it's 100% worth it for a budget build. Honestly it doesn't even feel like a budget mouse and keyboard, it just feels great. Plus with all the customization on the keyboard you can adapt it to any color scheme you choose. The only "problem" is that you can't customize the mouse but that doesn't matter all that much once you start using it.
So far it's great. No issues. You can adjust or turn off the lighting but I haven't messed with the settings.
Now I can see to type in the dark, I love the key travel on the keyboard and the mouse works excellent as well. Thank You
It performs like any other keyboard and mouse but looks great! I love the RGB lighting. Great for the price!

Bought this set for a dead computer I was fixing up in speculation to be a gaming machine. It's properly screaming now and I couldn't be happier with the value of these peripherals. Great buy on a budget.

I dislike this keyboard, the pressing the keys doesn't feel fluid and the Enter key is in a weird place so I always miss it.  I am experiencing a lot of typos using the keyboard.  The keyboard gets one star for looks and another because the mouse is decent.  Another thing I don't particularly like is that it lights up for show only, thats it, the keys don't illuminate so you cant type in the dark.  Why bother with the lights if they are just to look cool?
My son says it doesn’t work for enough games so he gave it to me. I like it. It makes smooth sounds. The mouse is a little skippy.
Love this keyboard. Glad there are single light setting on this and you can change the brightness. I bought this to type in low lighted room and it can be destracting for those with autism.
For the price, this set cannot be beat! I'm not a huge gamer so I cannot comment on its gaming functions but the keyboard types well and I do recommend it.
Not meant for gaming. Certain buttons are spread far apart. Esc. Tab. Are essential. This keyboard doesn't take it into consideration.Mouse is lightweight cheap plastic.
I love it.  I'm no gamer.  I'm more of a writer.I wish that I could buy another for the same price I paid for the original.

Mouse does not fit well in hand, cannot get it to move across screen quickly despite having settings at maximum speed. Multiple keys do not work.  Some keys send multiple characters when depressed.  Was out of the box and back in for return within an hour. No software included, no software to download that I could find to help "fix." Will never buy this manufacturer again. More gimmicky than anything.
Good keyboards are important. For defending the realm, sinking battleships, destroying aliens and as every keyboard warrior knows, crushing hate and fascism. This machine destroys fascism.
My son wanted a keyboard and mouse to use on his PS4. He talks highly of this set up for beginners. His only complaint is the lights on the keyboard recently stopped working.

the keyboard is great, i like the crisp feel of the keys. i found it comfortable to type , and game with the illumination is bright and shines through the lettering in a clear and even way. the multiple colors are kinda fun too. what i didn't like was that the mouse has only one color illumination, red. the mouse is fairly comfortable to hold for hours at a time.
Great keyboard but the mouse needs to be better. Decided to use the old wireless mouse instead of the one provided from Redragon. Overll great product.
Kiddo LOVES it works just as well as the high end ones. He loves the lights so much he won’t eat or drink near it lol.. win win!!
Purchased on sale for $20.  For the price it works fine.  Non mechanical keyboard, but it feel quality and so does the mouse.
Comes with no software. Keys feel very awkward to type on. Kept closing myweb browser when typing in search bar.  Could not find any model number on the manufacturers website

I was happy to see that this keyboard is actually powered by dragon blood and not electricity. I don't have to worry about those expensive power bills like I did with my generator operated keyboard from before. This puppy really gets the job done and even goes "clickity clack" when you type, just like in the hacker movies!

The mouse feels really nice, theres this texture that helps grip the mouse. The keyboard is okay, i wish the lights would glow brighter when lights are turned on in the room. Keyboard feels good no problems with ut
Bought this for my Fiance. She says she loves it! She uses it on her channel Mommabear79 gaming on youtube.
No complaints. Solid keyboard and mouse for the price. Time will tell how long they last, but I'm not a super heavy user. I expect they will last me a while.
This keyboard has FLASHING lighting that cannot be turned off or made to stop flashing.  It's also a pretty noisy key stroke.  It works.
The mouse no longer powers up. We tried it in multiple computers. It worked for exactly 30 days. The keyboard works fine. The system as a whole was great... for 30 days.
I absolutely LOVE this Keyboard/Mouse set. The ONLY thing *Not so great*; that it's not wireless.Other than that, it is Superb!
Great product and a great price. Quality Product, Looks Great and Functions Perfectly! I recommend this product and seller definitely.

This is a great combo for anyone I love the keyboard for my first pc build the shape and design keep me from sliding it all around my desk during games. It’s a stay in place keyboard with a great gaming design. I like the mouse but the red on it makes me think twice about buying the combo and not just getting the keyboard I do plan on buying a new gaming mouse to go with this perfect keyboard

These products are generally good.My favorite part of this bundle was the mouse. The mouse is built excellently and is quite smooth on all surfaces. Although I did have a little difficulty taking of the cover for the weights. The keyboard is a different story. When I first opened the box and saw the quite well built keyboard I had good expectations. What truly killed the keyboard for me was the keys themselves. They were EXTREMELY mushy( only a couple of them).  Some of these keys were so mushy, that it was very difficult to tell if I even pressed the key at all.  This might of been a defect but I don't know. I'm giving this 4 stars because I believe that other people might have better luck other than me.
I bought this for my son he is into gaming and he wanted to use it for his ps4 and he is really enjoying it! It lights up so nice he is so happy so I am one happy mama!
went through a lot of keyboards.  my son loved mine and ordered one for himself.  nice to see keys in dark
Bought this Mouse keyboard set for my sons first gaming computer and i was surprised by the good quality and response of the keys and mouse. I will buy it again.
Excellent so far. Prefer if lights stayed on versus blinking like xmas lights. Not sure if that can be changed but not a negative thing to take a star away.

This keyboard does everything I was hoping to do. Though the only complaint I have is better instructions on how to do the various color settings that come with it. I had to look those up online instead of using the book that came with it. Other than that, its a great keyboard and can take the punishment that 2 children (4-year-old and 2 years old) can give it as well.

Bought this for my son for Christmas.  Very disappointed in the quality of the keyboard.  Two of the keys stick together ( letters I and O) when either is pressed.  Thankfully, he doesn't type much.  But it's not a good product at all.  I would avoid.
Easy to install no driver's needed with Windows 10. Mouse is comfortable and the keyboard is easy on the eyes.

Everything works great, keyboard has several options for lighting, and makes it easier to type in the dark, plus its very quiet. I did notice the mouse isn't so quiet, its louder than my old one. Not enough of an issue to detract any starts from a review. Extra clicker buttons worked automatically after devices detected, including a button to toggle increase in sensitivity, perfect for that sniper shot in games, or adjusting knobs to exact frequencies in Audio Editing Programs, without having to change computer settings.

Awesome budget keyboard and mouse. I simply love the mouse (braided cable, big and ergonomic for my large hands). The keyboard is great too, the feeling of the keys, it’s very quiet and responsive with braided cable... the only downside is I wish the lights were a bit brighter but hey, it looks awesome.
The keys are twice as tall than they need to be for gaming.  Works fine as everyday  keyboard though.

I have this mouse and keyboard for a little under a year now, they are both fantastic quality for the price. The only negative is the cord that comes out on the mouse is now starting to show the wires and be pulled further and further out (with just normal desktop use,) meaning it will need replacing eventually.

Very nice keyboard. Keys are quiet and responsive. The lights are cool with the different colors  or just solid color. You can cycle  through the different color background lights and keep the color you're in the mood for.
Bought for my son and his new gaming pc. Replaced the one it came with. He loves the keypad strokes and use of his mouse.

Nice feel/finish. Snappy response and cool colors. Bought as a slight upgrade from the cheap one that came with desktop. It’s perfect for typing, don’t know about gaming. Mouse speed adjust switch is handy. Lights all time out after a while, you can turn the keyboard lights off manually also but not the mouse.

Really want to give 5 stars, however there is no driver available for the S101 mouse in the kit.Perfect for PS4, just know its VERY involved to get any side buttons to work on PS4. PS4 only has 3 mouse speeds and this S101 has an onboard button for DPS that solves sensitivity issues with no driver software!

Really comfortable for gaming, especially for MMORPG games and battle games. Really bright and letters can be easily seen in the dark so you can play easily in the night. So I would recommend this keyboard for gaming and additionally for just work.

I'm just getting into PC gaming and (I'm going to get hate for this) using it on on the Xbox or Playstation and Switch. Bought an adapter so I'm able to use it on the xbox (Xbox has limited support for mouse and keyboard) But so far I love It!! Its feels great, feels like it has anti-sweat material and looks beautiful when all set up together. It is a must buy for computer gamers who enjoy the colors on the keyboard and I'm in love with it.
4 months of use and still in great condition, only disadvantaged is theres a button that powers the whole PC off so I had to remove it.. definitely recommend to take that off.

Keyboard: It's decent, you get what you pay for obviously. It's not the best keyboard but not the worse either. I will upgrade my keyboard later but right now, this will suffice.Mouse: Again, you get what you pay for. Its good that this was a combo set so it was less expensive than other mice and keyboards. However, The side buttons are unprogrammable. No drivers that come with this to program adjust the function of those 2 side buttons. I've found softwares for it but they weren't all compatiable or decent for this kind of device. If you're looking for a programmable mice, look elsewhere.

The reason that I gave this keyboard a 4 star rating is because, for the price, this keyboard is very good. There are some things that I don't like about it, the keys are a little hard to get out, I kind of feel like I'm going to break them, and some of the keys have a soft unresponsive feel to them, mostly the backspace and the enter button. As for the mouse, I think it's great, the buttons on the side of the mouse get a little annoying sometimes, because I find myself accidentally hitting the back button. But overall, if you are looking for a budget gaming mouse and keyboard, this would be a great buy
Great wired keyboard and mouse. Wireless just doesn't have the same reaction time. Perfect for squad.

The keyboard is great, works well and the Multimedia keys are fantastic for changing music in the background of your gaming. However, it doesn't last the way something that costs $40 should. I bought this in Feb 2020, and beginning of September 2020 it has stopped working out of the blue. This keyboard should have worked for longer than 8 months.

The keyboard itself is really good, altho I'm used to a larger keyboard, but this is still a very good purchase. Love the pattern of the lights, like a rainbow! The keys are very smooth, love the sound it makes too. The mouse is better than the one I had before, fits my palm perfectly! The price was really good for what I got and the shipping speed was top notch.
This mouse and keyboard are absolutely great for people just getting into computer games. It lights up and every key is very visible.
I've never owned a RGB mouse and keyboard.  The colors are great and the keyboard feels sturdy. Would buy again.
I say this cause every time I turn on my computer I have to fix the lights and adjust the mouse.

Great price for this keyboard and mouse. It was delivered quickly w/o any damage. My 16 year old son has used it extensively this past week and thinks it is awsome and a great deal.  He had worn out his laptop keyboard and recently had to have it replaced. I bought him this Redragon keyboard to prevent any future repairs. Buy this with the steelcase gaming mousepad and you will make your computer gamer very happy.
Worked great and fit every need I had for a mouse and keyboard and looked great at the same time. Now two months after making the purchase, various keys stopped working. Rather upsetting.
Wife wanted a backlight keyboard and frankly I'm impressed... very useful in low-light conditions
great mouse and keyboard combo for the $$. Super happy with it so far. The mouse fits my hand perfect and is super comfy. the keyboard is the perfect size for me, and the keys feel great.
But what features are helpful for gaming beyond those of any keyboard just is not clear at all.

I bought this product from Amazon through a seller and what I got was a keyboard that wasn't fully functional. A number of the keys simply do not work.It was frustrating. And my fault probably for not notifying Amazon within the 30 day period.

It’s cool but does not come with the necessary devices needed for gaming with your console. My husband found these fairly disappointing due to that fact because they were not really different from a regular mouse & key board if he couldn’t play with them.
Aside from the cool lights this should be marketed as an office keyboard and mouse not gaming.

This keyboard worked fine and then it just stopped. No power goes to the board. This product was never moved the chords were never roughed-up.  I purchased this  product hoping it would last, I got less than a year of work out it.

First day using it and so far I'm pretty happy with it. It's very comfortable to type on. The RGB lights look good, the texture of the keys are a soft rubber-like texture.The mouse is good as well, although a third programmable button below the "Back/forward" buttons would've made the mouse perfect.
My son absolutely loves this keyboard and mouse. Made everything work smoothly. I definitely recommend this product
Liked the: power-on, sleep button and wake buttons all at the top; then the way keyboard lights up. But not keys sticking after a few years of use. Overall just wish I kept the manuals.

For the price this is great smooth beat keyboard I own light transition can be smoother but if you are looking outlet rock one color this is ur go to! I'm using it for my ps4 I can only imagine what can be done with it if used with a computer that can modify it

Great key action on the keyboard and the mouse has excellent feel and functions without being burdened with superfluous buttons.  Great for a software developer.  I don't get into much gaming, so I can't evaluate them from that point of view.  If you are a professional and drive your computer by feel, then I highly recommend this set.

daymmm this .. this is my baby! lol these work like a beauty ! its perfectt for gamingg ! gotta order another one after 2 years the arrow keys started messing up because im a pc gamer league of legends.. gotta use these arrowss
Awesome for price feels great and lasts very long. Fast response time and is simmilar to a razor keyboardSo this product is defently worth it. The mouse feels good too.

Im kind of upset first off there was no tracking to my package which left me with Anxiety then it never arrived when it said it was it arrived 4 days late. On top of that my keyboard had two w?? Which is very confusing when your gaming cuz you need the E key. And i cant send it back because i need to work smh

I just opened this and plugged it in and absolutely love this keyboard and mouse. The keyboard is smooth to type on and the texture is ahh-mazing! pretty cool that it lights up too. I also love the feel of the mouse and the different buttons and functions. I will edit my review if there is anything that comes up negative about this keyboard and mouse, but so far I am so glad I purchased this product!
Easy to use.  Love the backlit colors.  Quiet.  I type faster on this keyboard.  Just love it.
This is great. Lots of different modes, the keys are not the best quality honestly though. And RGB = more FPS.

It clicks really softly, which is nice since i use it to game and program.  The light design is also great.  The mouse has a form of grip material that i soon fell in love with since my hands tend to get sweaty over time of use.  Overall good buy!
I love it..... excellent.Good price for a super product...plays games well.  No issues.

I'm giving this a 4 star because of one flaw regarding the mouse, it doesn't have a finger rest like some gaming mouses do and my fingers tend to get tired from dragging on to the mouse pad, other than that the keyboard and mouse are very responsive, comfortable and affordable! worth the money if you have smaller hands, i have giant hands so it's not the products fault, i'd return it but i don't want to pay shipping. very cool design, smooth wheel and very nice adjustable weights. i like the DPI mode change so you don't have to go into game settings to change it. saves you time and allows you to get straight to gaming better, the keyboard is very smooth and very well lit, the lights compliment the mouse and mouse pad. very good product over all, if anything it's under priced!

I bought this keyboard and mouse when I was on a budget a few years ago. They worked perfectly until I upgraded about 2 months ago but that's just because I wanted more for my gaming habits. Solid keyboard and mouse. They still work and they're now my back up setup in case something goes wrong.

I ended up returning this product for a few reasons: One of the side buttons on the mouse did not work and most importantly, I had compatibility issues with the mouse on windows 10. I was impressed with the keyboard, although it tended to make a plastic rubbing sound when I was typing an essay and constantly using the space bar. Overall I would recommend this to anyone who needs a cheap keyboard and mouse combo.
Comes with an adjustable weighted mouse.  Overall a great value for the money.I recommend.
Works great so far. Couldnt find the drivers for this set or individual model numbers

you get what you pay for no lie, cheap $$ keyboard is light but it flexes a lot. Stoped working after having it for not that long. Changes color which I think was decent. The mouse is light as heck, but honestly isn’t too bad, it actually still works, it’s got weird gripping on it but for the price can’t really complain. It lights up red as well just red though.
After a month of hard core gaming this thing is working like a charm. Couldnt be happier.
Very nice but does the mice is not working for me on Xbox. I have been continuously trying to figure out why but still no reasoning
Love the keyboard and mouse, both are great and well made. Only wish I could change the color on the mouse to match the keyboard and stop the mouse from fade in and out.

Very happy with keyboard and mouse!.Both plugged in and worked perfectly. I use them on a computer that I mainly use to game. I'm thrilled with their performance and the lighting is a plus if in lower lighting. A great bargain for the price.
My sons loves this keyboard. The keys are soft and quiet. The different light settings are great.
He got this for his gaming laptop and he has had no complaints. Works as expected.

I've been through many keyboards and mice. This combo was inexpensive and of high quality plus they look awesome! I am a Redragon fan for sure. I hope they stick around. With prices like this for quality like this...its a wonder how they are in business! They are probably trying to get their name out there for now...either way, this is a great deal guys. Using this setup with a XIM4 adapter for the PS4. Mousr does require a pad which is typical with sensitive mice.
If the keys were a bit larger and a bit more responsive this would be the perfect keyboard.
1. Design : Splendid enough.2. Performance : Diverse useful functions are built in. No issue during the past several months.

Received my keyboard yesterday, on time of course. I can't believe how much I was missing out on! This keyboard is a dream to use, it's got a fine texture to it that just feels good. It's got rubber slip stops on the bottom so REALLY helps on glass table tops. The RGB is RGB, not much else to say bout that, it works? Lol.I would buy again.
So great! I love the colors and the keyboard and mouse setup!

Works Fine So Far. I like the color changing abilities... Update Few Months In And Mouse Starts Freezing After Start Up..Had To Change Out With Another Brand.. Emailed Manufacturer..No Response From Manufacturer On Correcting Mouse Issues.
Decent set up combo with mouse for the price. Only had it a few days but it works well.
I like the ability to change the back-light to what I want to see for the app or game I am playing.  I also like that it is simple and straight forward to setup and use.

For the cost, this is a great combo. I feel some lack on the keyboard but it's more than good for my gaming purposes. On the other hand, I feel the mouse is already worth the cost of the combo.Note that the keyboard does not have a back light which is not a problem for me because I don't have to look at it when using it. the "F" and "J" have a finger shaped plastic that allows you to keep track of the position, much better than other marks in my opinion.

There were keys that didn’t work when the keyboard was received. They were the S key (which is important for gaming), N, 8, -, [, 0, and the comma keys. Mouse worked great though. Build quality, well you get what you pay for. Returned and will get a higher end keyboard and mouse.

Dont buy if u want to use it to type essays or other things of that sort. I was an idiot and didn't realize the difference between this and a normal keyboard. The letters on the keyboard are more to the left than a office keyboard.
We kept getting keystroke delays and stopping.  We finally tracked this down to the keyboard itself but now it's too late to return it.  DON'T BUY THIS KEYBOARD.
Eye catching innovation. Visually appealing and ergonomically correct. Great price. Let’s test it’s longevity.
The gifted said they liked it and use it everyday. It's been a year and a half since.

I love this keyboard. Admittedly I use it for work and not for gaming but the lights help my workspace feel less like work. The mouse is pretty responsive, too. I just wish it wasn’t red and kept the rainbow up of the keyboard.

Great keyboard for regular use or gaming. Lighting is a nice feature and the keyboard is built well. Price is definitely worth it. From someone who does video editing and some gaming, I definitely recommend it!

I loved this keyboard and mouse at first, but it ultimately stopped working right. After only a few months of enjoying this product, both the keyboard and mouse are dysfunctional. Half of the keys on the keyboard won't work now and the mouse courser jumps around the page or is unresponsive. It is not just mine either, my boyfriend ordered the same set and is running into similar troubles.

I needed a new mouse and keyboard for my gaming PC and I didn't want to spend a lot of money. I saw this mouse and keyboard combo and decided to give it a try. The cords seem sturdy and nice, they even have a Velcro strip on the cords for storage and such. Both devices are extremely responsive and fast. The mouse moves the cursor slowly, but turning the cursor speed up in Control Panel fixed that issue entirely. I'm very pleased and next time I need a mouse and/or keyboard, I'm getting a Redragon.

Great colors and easy setup! I like the functionality to change color and the breathing mode.Keystroke feels great no too noisy.

The keys themselves are not backlit but there are some lights on the bottom and top. The buttons are not cherry switches but I'm not complaining for 27 dollars. I upgraded to overpriced name brand accessories a few months ago but I used this set for well over a year. What a tremendous value. I'm a very competitive gamer and not once did I question whether or not my keyboard and mouse were sub-optimal. Sure the mouse has a limited DPI and the keyboard is of the soft membrane type but they're very accurate and very responsive. You don't want to run a higher DPI than this mouse offers, period. It would be preferable if you could go lower even. The keyboard is very satisfying to type on, while I very much like my mechanical keyboard it's not quite as "soothing" as typing on the Vajra even though I've had it for months.  The mouse is a little small for my tastes even though my hands are perhaps only marginally larger than average. The mouse feels a little cheap but it does the trick very well. In all I would definitely recommend this set if you're interested in maximizing value.

Everything about this keyboard and mouse is cheap. They are both made of hard, rough, cheap-feeling plastic. You can see LED bulbs through the clear red plastic bits. The mouse I received squeaked (not joking) every time I clicked the left button, too. The buttons themselves are spaced too far apart - so it stretches your two fingers to hold the mouse properly.The keyboard feels like the cheapest hard plastic keyboard out there. I originally purchased this for my husband, but his setup keeps him from using this product. I am now using it and I really like it. The keyboard is much quieter than the one I was using. It has some good weight to it and the buttons are easy to press. I really like the backlit RGB. It as quite a few settings to help anyone customize it to his or her liking. The keys have a matte feel to them which I really like. I hope in time the coating doesn't rub off. The mouse is a little to big for my fingers, but luckily my fingers don't have to be at the tip of the buttons for it to recognize the click. This is a personal problem. I have small hands and short fingers. I usually use compact mice because I use a claw grip. I cannot do that with this mouse because of the size. This would be perfect for someone with a larger size hand. I do love the dpi button and the weight customization. The mouse registers lighter pressure than other mice I use and I really like that. The top of the mouse is textured. That might be a problem for some, but I don't mind it. All in all I really like this combo and I think the quality is great for the price. I highly recommend this for casual gamers like myself.

I have owned this keyboard and mouse set for about a month.  I bought it for my son to play Star Wars: Battlefront on our PC.  The feel of the key board is pretty good.  The keys have a balanced feel that is not overly clicky or like soft mush.  The braided cables are first rate and the weight of the mouse is spot on for smooth movement.  The texture of the mouse and keys is also great for control without being grippy.  My son loves the LEDs (my wife thinks they are gaudy, meh).  If you prefer blue LEDs, you can check out the Cooler Master keyboard set at a similar price.One thing to note is that the return button and back slash key are positioned differently than most keyboards I have seen.

I use linux and thats where this thing REALLY SUCKS! it uses a non standard keyboard interface a microdia controller and if you like using shortcuts - ctrl alt and shift are all reported as the same key stroke under any kernel or distro and boy it sucks. The solution is #1 dont buy it because they hate linux or #2 use this driver https://bitbucket.org/Swoogan/aziokbd which can be installed manually this way:sudo apt-get install mercurial build-essential linux-headers-generic

I have no complaints about this keyboard and mouse. I was happy that it included a mouse. It's a decent keyboard for the price. It looks very stylish. It does have some drawbacks, the keys can sound a bit cheap and they'll make a springy sound when pressed sometimes, but that's a very minor problem. I like being able to control media functions right from the keyboard. I did not look very closely when I bought this keyboard. The enter key is more like the old fashioned keyboards instead of the newer ones that I prefer, but this is not a deal breaker because I don't even notice the difference in use. They both have a red and black rope type material cord which is great for someone like me because I'm always unplugging the wrong thing from my computer. The mouse works on any surface, I use it on my mattress and have no need for a mousepad. It also has weights in it so that you can determine how heavy or how light that you want the mouse to be.

This is a review on the product. Not the seller. Product came well packaged and on time.\You get what you pay for. Many of the keyboards with the highlighted W A S D and ARROW keys usually are rubberized for enhanced sensitivity but your keyboard is no different from the rest of the keys. The description says you can exchange them but the package does not have any instruction manual or CD that lets me program the mouse or keyboard or show me how to swap them out. The number ZERO 0 on the number needs to be stabbed hard for output. Regular finger press does not yield any output especially when typing in passwords with it.That's why I say it's not excellent or good. The quality here is a hit or miss. The pros are that it is a relatively cheap keyboard and if it breaks; get another one.

I personally recommend paying the $50 more for a true mechanical keyboard as the typing experience1 is a night-and-day difference.  The keyboard does look nice, though I found the red lighting was very frustrating especially since I couldn't find a way to turn it off.Overall, if your budget is $25 for your mouse and keyboard, this will do you just fine. This is my first gaming keyboard. I mainly got it for the colored wasd keys, windows key lock, and other features. Also although it isn't a mechanical keyboard it's hybrid membrane switches are actually very nice and pretty close to mechanical switches. I enjoy typing with it and it works well for gaming. I wish the multimedia controls didn't require simultaneously pressing of the F key but at least they're there. I was so mesmerized by the led illumination that I don't know when but one of the led lights in one of the lower panels went out. The panel still lights up because there are two in each panel so I don't really care. The seller offered to replace it but I don't really care enough because for the price I'm still very pleased with the keyboard the way it works now.They mouse is actually the best part of the combo. I was only wanting to replace my keyboard but having a mouse that matches is cool. The mouse is very light even with all the removable weights in it. It's very accurate and has enough features. And looks amazing in my opinion.

I absolutely love the design and feel of the mouse and keyboard. I'm a very aggressive typer - or so I'm told - and the keys on this keyboard are smooth and help reduce the amount of noise I make while typing. That said, they're not too soft, and they have a satisfying amount of resistance. The enter key is slightly smaller than most, and it took some getting used to. The mouse is very comfortable and the DPI can be adjusted on the fly.My only complaint is that the red lights which make the keyboard and mouse look awesome *cannot* be turned off. Even shutting down, or putting  my computer to sleep doesn't turn the lights off, and since these are in my bedroom and they are quite bright, I toss a towel over them at night to block the light.

The Alienware keyboards looked so beautiful with the ability to customize the colors. But I guess I decided..Why do I need that? I've been typing ever since I was a child. I bought this set as I really liked the mouse and now needed a new keyboard/mouse for my computer. I was disappointed with the quality of the keyboard, especially in comparison to the mouse.The mouse is amazing, sensitive, and customizable. The keyboard is functional. Both of these items look well-made and awesome and the braided wires look and feel durable.The keyboard is more mushy than other membrane keyboards, and the keys are very sticky. It feels like each key requires a different amount of pressure to register a key. When pressed, the keys come back up slowly, making typing slow and making gaming nearly impossible. The keyboard makes it not worth the purchase.Pros: looks good, functional, awesome mouse, feels durable, nice lights

Because I'm reviewing the product and not the price I gave it 3 stars. The keyboard is okay, far from great. It is a nice temporary keyboard until you want to buy a much better and more expensive one. You have to press down quite a bit for a response, may be better for people that don't game. The mouse on the other hand is pretty dang good for the price. Nice look and pretty responsive, has a good amount of buttons on it as well. Overall, the mouse makes the buy much more worth it.

I got this thing about two months ago and at first it worked fine. It was my first gaming keyboard and from what I knew it worked pretty good - responded quickly and felt right in my hands. Then about four days later it started spamming the letter "L", so when I went to log into my computer all I got was hundreds of little dots in the password bar. I tried unplugging it, but the "L's" kept coming. I had to restart my computer two times before it stopped. This has never happened before with any of my "non-gaming" keyboards, and ever since the "L" incident I've stored in it's box. The mouse works fine, and I use it more often than not with most of my games. However it still stands that the key element of this package is the keyboard, so I'm taking off three stars for it's unusable behavior.

The products work great and I'm a fan of all of the redragon products I love the breathing effect on the mouse and for the price I would say worth every cent .
Easy to install, of course.....would rather have the keys illuminated than the trade icon and side lights. Also, the keys/kb are very small, so wrong keys and and commands are often hit accidentally.

Would be one star but the mouse is decent. Keyboard is useless as is just slides around everywhere. no rubber feet to help hold it in place. DO NOT BUY. If you're interested in the mouse buy it separately by itself.

I bought this item for my 10year old son, we've had it about 6 wks. since a friend was putting the gaming system together. Well he's not very happy cause the mouse doesn't work very often when he clicks on it. Sent an email to the seller 3 days ago and still haven't heard back from them.

Mouse works,  but the keyboard doesnt because some keys doesnt register..  well i guess thats what happens when i buy it used.  Sometimes buy new is the best option.. one of the mistake i will never make again
Junk it broke

Mainly got this mouse and keyboard for two reasons: low price combo and wanted to stick with my dragon theme.Keyboard: The texture feels kind cheap, but it isn't necessarily bad. I want to compare it to a truck's bed liner for texture. The shortcut function keys work surprisingly well. It was a little smaller than expected but that worked out for the better. The lights also are not too bright, it's just in the sweet spot for me. The spacebar kinda squeeks sometimes, but you only hear it if you're listening for it.
Would have liked back-lit keys, guess I should have read the description better.
Excelente Prodcto
so bad a mouse just use 1 day and it doesn't work anymore  and reture fee 10$ oh s***
Feels amazing, looks cool. But the enter button is a little weird.
Very satisfied
Found better options shortly thereafter
Grandson Loves
Its very good, and was shipped 4 days before
Excellent key board. Only reason for 4 stars is there is no quick volume knob to turn down sound quickly. You have to hold down the FN key with the F3 button.

I purchased this for my desk job that I recently got, and when everything came in I was more than excited to have it finally here. I opened the brown amazon box to be greeted by beautiful packaging that seemed more than inviting to a quality mouse and keyboard on the cheap. I looked over the box and with my amazement it looked intact! No dings, no scratches, nothing harmful ever to occur to this box! I proceeded to grab a razor and slip over the few pieces of circular tape that kept this baby shut. After the tape was off, I pulled the cardboard tabs out and lifted upwards. The keyboard was beautiful, it was just as perfect as I had imagined it would be. The keyboard was sleek and black with a beautiful tactile feeling of a slight spring underneath, with no plastic feeling in site I felt the world was mine!  I turned to the mouse and felt it over, the same glorious rough feeling like it was a mouse to be reckoned with called from within it. I thought to myself, "Wow this combo deal is astounding!". I waited until the next day when I got into the office to actually try them out, that's when it all became a big mistake. The keyboard wouldn't hook up properly at first but I finally got it connected. Next came the mouse, I was excited about this piece the most, and perhaps why this rating has achieved a 1 star outlook. I uncoil the mouses beautifully braided cord, and hook it behind the computer, and to my vast time spent waiting for it to ship here, nothing happened. Absolutely nothing, it was a completely defective mouse right out of the box. What a damn shame too. I really felt like it would have been a solid 5 stars if the equipment they sent me would have worked in the beginning but here we are now. A defective mouse, and another distributor I can't trust. Great job.
Works just as I expected.
Great product. Fast shipping.
Love the keyboard and mouse, especially for the price, and the shipping time was very short. The company selling it seems very willing to work with you. Perfect for the price.
Came in with a broken keyboard, but with a working mouse.

This keyboard is all show, it has the clunkiest letter keys and both shift keys are prone to sticking and hard pressing to the point my pinky struggles. Numerous times it feels like even my num-pad is hard pressing and the function button arrangement is boggling. These are unacceptable problems with a keyboard that touts it's self as a gaming keyboard. I could have sworn I bought a more expensive version of the red dragons keyboard and didn't have these issues. The keys we're even a smooth finish not this cheap plastic feel. This whole thing feels like a knock-off to be quite honest. If you have intentions of using this for gaming you should try to find another keyboard, I didn't use the mouse yet but at this point I am not personally inclined to as I own better. If it sounds too good to be true it probably is.
It would've been better if the keys lit up since I'm always in the dark. Its hard to see anything when I need to find a key on the keyboard. Other than that its really nice.

The keys are nearly unreadable in dark light, even with a supplemental light. The mouse is obnoxiously bright so I need to hide it while watching movies in a darkened room, and it has so many sharp buttons that using it for casual work feels awkward.
Awesome!
AAA+++
I just opened the box and the logo with the dragon on it was off and the clip was broke now it wont go back on.
My son loves it, exactly what he wanted.
Not bad actually. There are way better out there but if you are just starting with PC gaming, this is a good starter.
I like but not wht I expected for 120 dollars it feels cheap breaks easy and doesn’t work half the time and the app gave me problems to much I recommend not buying this
Good product!!!
Nice mouse and keyboard
The keyboard is very small. The keys are small, the width is shorter than average keyboard. The mouse is very light too. Overall, it doesn't fit what we are looking for. Returning them.

Just like a cheaper logitech keyboard, as for gaming not really in that category.  Mouse works better than most imitation/knockoff China ones I have used.  Lower end name brand mouse/keyboard are 100% better and will last.  Bought quite a few products of redragon and they all are cheap and build quality are horrible.  Will not recommended and will never buy again.  Would give negative but can't
The mouse left button is broken out of the box! Quite disappointing....
Someone has this.  Not sure who.
Loved the details!

Keyboard is really uncomfortable and awkward. True, it's not a Macintosh "Chiclets" keyboard, but I've never mistyped this much just from changing a keyboard (and not because of the inexplicable placement of the backslash, that's my bad for not noticing that in the photos). And I get having the WASD keys have arrows and being a different color, but what's with the inverted-T directional keys (below the Insert,Delete,Home,End,etc keys) also having "W" "A" "S" "D" on them? I mean .. why?The mouse is ok, nothing special, but there was no way to reassign the browser back/forth buttons, which is a real pain if you're not conditioned to them. Fortunately the Device Manager seemed to think it was a ELECOM mouse, and their "Mouse Assistant" app did the trick. Just how flimsy would this mouse be without the little weights inside?

The listed customer reviews on this product are in terrible order and misleading, furthermore they could cause the return of many items which are in perfect working order. Customer are listing features that do NOT exist in the Redragon S101 Keyboard/mouse combo.- there is not keys backlight, there is no switch to turn the decorative lights off -they stay on even after your computer shuts down, there is no way to change the colors on the decorative red LEDs, there is no circular red button to change ?/ anywhere on the keyboard. ETC, ETC. Either the customer are listing their reviews incorrectly or Amazon is sorting them wrong.With that out of the way... my assessment for the Redragon S101 VAJRA gaming keyboard CENTROPHORUS USB Gaming Mouse, Keyboard Set
UPDATE 8/18/2018:Okay, so three things have changed my mind here, in regards to the mouse.  I'm bumping this set up to 4 stars instead of 3.
Do not buy this product. This thing brought viruses to my computer and I demand my money back

Awkward and clunky , this keyboard feels more like a child’s toy to me. It’s also very loud . Yes the lights are pretty , once you get over than , using the keyboard becomes more of a chore than anything else . Also , if don’t gave the keyboard directly under you , the lit letters are extremely difficult to read .. even with the bottom prop-up legs I have mine on a few pieces of wood . As far as the mouse goes , eh it’s ok . I find it slightly large and cumbersome .. way too many buttons and kind of heavy . I overall give this keyboard and mouse a thumbs down — glad it came free with the cyber power Pc I just got ; I’m ordereinv a better keyboard - just wanted to let anyone who is used to nice feeling or flat style keys as in Mac keyboards , this keyboard is such a far jump it’s literallly annoying and almost impossible to get used to . The loud typing is driving me up the wall too. Ooo such pretty lights though !! Who cares ...

So I decided to purchase this keyboard simply because my old one had broken. (It was a very basic keyboard.) And I just gotta say, I am VERY pleased with the product with only two gripes!It looks cool, with the various different color patterns available and the overall design of the keyboard itself, it feels right, being VERY comfortable to use, it is relatively small and compact as all keyboards should be (it'd fit PERFECTLY in any desk with a keyboard slot, no matter how tight!), and it is also really quiet when typing.

I received this as a Christmas gift and I'm very content with it. It has different RGB settings that you can use by pressing the 'FN' key plus any of the button combinations listed in the user manual (there is a PDF version on their website @ redragonusa.com/downloads). Most of the buttons type well and are not too loud compared to the gaming keyboard that came with my computer. However, there is a slight problem with both the 'Backspace' button and the '0' button on the number pad. They both stick and sometimes won't actually type their given functions. Just a tad bit important that they function correctly, no big deal.All in all, it's not a bad keyboard/mouse combo and I actually enjoy the mouse. You can download the driver from their website and change the DPI settings as well as how often the light fades in and out. The only downside is that it's just one color so it doesn't have the cool RGB lights like the keyboard does.

I have tried numerous keyboards.  Every one seems to 'wear out' the key letters.  Especially the sdf area due to gaming.This product just works.  I LOVE how the back light works.  It glows THROUGH the keys, so, there are no letters to wear off.  Now, granted my gaming is much less these days.......

The mouse works fine, but the keyboard is cheap. Both of the Shift keys don't work, and the "lights" for the caps lock, number lock, and scroll lock are not actually lights. They are just painted on. Overall not worth the money.

If I could give zero stars, I would. First off, I bought my keyboard back in October. (I have had keyboards last me years before needing to replace them. I am someone who takes great care of their electronics. I still have the same mouse from 2010. It works amazingly still.)Anyway, the keyboard and headset from this bundle stopped working. The keyboard lights weren't working as well and the buttons weren't registering when clicked. So I would have to press hard on certain buttons, namely the space key, to get it to work. The headset was never used. The headset I had prior finally gave out, (after four years), and I decided to use the headset that came with this bundle. Well.. I could hear nothing out of it at all. I tried hooking the headset up to my PC, my phone, my laptop, and it still wouldn't register any sound.

They keyboard is very nice and I have no trouble using it. The mouse, however, was the peak of my happiness. The mouse was faster and more responsive then my last mouse. Plus, it has two side buttons and I can now play Counter-Strike: Global Offensive without blaming my mouse for the deaths I accumulate. The lights are permanent, which means you cannot turn them off. However, they are not too dim nor too bright. So, having them on all of the time isn't a bother. Also, I love the dragon designs on both the mouse and the keyboard. Plus, the WASD and arrow keys both say WASD and are both painted red. I believe there was a review that complained about painted on lights? Well, I don't know what that person was talking about, because I fully enjoy using both the keyboard and mouse. To add on, the box it came in is fabulous. The design looks fantastic and it looks like a legit gaming keyboard. Now, at first, it does feel a bit cheap. Like the ones you would use in high school and even in college. However, after a week or two of using this keyboard and mouse, I see no problems nor feel them.I loved this purchase and would buy from this company again!
Works perfectly fine but one of the LED lights don't work.

My old keyboard was just a regular dell keyboard or whatever that got a lot of gunk and junk from years of use. The keys started not working so I thought it was time to buy a new one. I looked around and saw this one among all the others and settled with this one that has good reviews at a decent price.Here is the breakdown:

This keyboard and mouse combo is a great deal for $35, and if you need a good keyboard and mouse combo that doesn't cost a lot of money, then this is one of the top options for you if you want something a step aboveKeyboard: It isn't perfect, but it's got a ton of features like true RGB backlighting that's highly customizable.  It does flex a bit like most modern keyboards, but for a rubber-dome keyboard, the keys feel great and make a satisfying sound.  And with N-key rollover, it makes for a fantastic gaming keyboard for those on a tight budget or who don't want a higher-end keyboard.

so being new to the PC master race, i decided i needed to get a RGB af mouse and keyboard. on this point i was not disappointed. both the mouse and keyboard light up really well and the keys are even backlit.the mouse has 2 side buttons which are programmable if you can get the redragon software to actually work. i could not. however the buttons are not mapped to the keyboard so all of the games i tested had the ability to map them to the function i needed them for.

On first use of this keyboard and mouse combo, I instantly fell in love with it.The buttons are smooth and firm- they don't stick or slip and they have a great feel to them. The mouse was set at a fast mode at first and it made me panic a bit since I'm not too adept at tweaking DPI settings yet. However, this mouse made it insanely easy. The middle arrow button is the DPI button and it cycles through 4 different speeds:

When I bought my custom gaming pc, I was given this set for free as part of the deal going on at the time. I immediately just threw it in my closet because as a hardcore gamer, I was set in my ways with a couple other keyboards already. However, I had an old gaming laptop I broke out and began to use on my travels, however the built in keyboard is dead so it requires me to use another one instead. Finally, I broke this keyboard out to give it a quick run so here is a fresh review as I am still trying to get a feel for this. Right away I feel the board is overall too flat for my liking. I like a bit more of a raised key row but its not bad.The keyboard itself is very lightweight. It makes it great to take on trips because it doesn't add much to the bag of bricks that is my laptop. The mouse itself is decent as well. It fits nicely in my hand and has a few extra buttons compared to a standard mouse but for hardcore gaming and mmos, I would stick with my razer mouse instead (you can find it in my reviews). Its very lightweight even when I add weights to it, it just feels too light for my liking. Some people do like the feel of it so if its your thing, good news.

I bought this for my hubby as an early birthday gift. I am not one to go on and on in leaving a review but man I love this!  He had a chat pad for his Xbox One that he loved but it just didn't seem to last long enough. I read the reviews on here and thought "  Wow this looks pretty cool and most reviews were great so I wanted to give it a shot. I can tell you, I am ecstatic that I bought this! He absolutely loves it. Hooked it up to his Xbox One, works great! We love that it lights up. Gorgeous! LolWe had to move the table and couch a little closer because the cord isn't really long but that's okay. And hey now my living room looks better!  😁

The keyboard is indeed quite quiet and feels somewhat satisfying to type on, though the quality of the plastic may be lacking a little. However, though the mouse's build quality is much higher than that of the keyboard, the mouse's wire is far too stiff and is not that comfortable to hold. However, given its price at ~$30, this combo is not bad if you're looking for a mouse and keyboard on a budget, though I would recommend getting a Logitech G602, which I got on sale for $30, which I think is muuuch more comfortable. BTW: The mouse includes mouse weights which are really nice.

30 bucks for both the keyboard and mouse??? Now I know it sounds like a lie seeing as how now days most gaming keyeboards start off in the $80’s and up but this is honestly a steal. The keyboard is great, the material doesn’t feel like crap cheap plastic from the dollar store and the RGB lights are easy to switch on and off and they look great when on, it’s pretty solid and the cables are good too. The mouse is pretty good too, the quality of it doesn’t feel as good as the keyboard but it’s still solid. Overall you can’t really beat the price of this deal and if it sucks ir you hate it, it only cost $30 bucks and you can always return it.

For the price (got it during a flash deal) can't complain, the mouse comes with extra weights and can control dpi. The keyboard is comfy and feels solid, does not click like the mechanical ones but I don't really miss nor want the mechanical ones anymore after having this one. The mechanical ones get kinda noisy especially at night if your the only one awake and everybody else is sleeping.Only cons might be the mouse only glows in and out red, mouse setting changes back to the slow one once computer restarts.
The only complaint I have is the mouse wheel sticks causing jerky scrolling. Unacceptable even for a standard mouse.
Mouse stopped working after 3 months after only light use. Bummer.
It works fine, considering the price range. Good buy
Super cheap, works great.
Only downside is I cannot figure out how to shut off the LEDs once the computer is off
Mouse backlight suddenly stopped only the buttons is working. It only lasts 3 months.
The keyboard doesn't work
Keyboard sucks.  But the mouse is good

I've read many books in my life, not many being fantasy(Robert Howard being the exception) But of all the books I've read this is by far the most detailed story of the lot, and that includes Hemingway and even Homer. Hemingway's battle and retreat at Caporetto leaves nothing on the battlefield of Minas Tirith. And while one may say that I am comparing fiction and fact, that isn't the point. The story blurs the line between fact and fiction and almost seems like it did happen and you are reading a first hand account of history.Also, every major character in the story and even most of the secondaries are given a detailed background and full depth. Very rare for most novels. The character Aragorn is as complex a person you will find in literature. He has known happiness and grief, hard toil and loss. You get a true sense of the life he has led. All of the players are given such treatment and while it's been said that the women are given less importance than the men many point out that three of the strongest characters in the book, Eowyn, Arwen, and Galadriel are women.

Great keyboard and mouse.Fits a aesthetically very well with my set up and is gorgeous. The cords have never given me trouble and are long enough to reach from my actual Tower to my desk with enough room to swing my mouse around. It feels great to type and game on. I actually found that I use the music shortcuts on it a lot when I game and have music in the background. Just a detail you never know you need but appreciate when you have it.

I wouldn't consider myself a gaming keyboard connoisseur but I'm not very impressed with this keyboard. The colors are too dim in my opinion, and the keys seem to be a bit sticky. For the price tag, this is probably fine for someone who is just starting to game or who has never had a backlit keyboard before, but as a previous Razer Cynosa owner, this just doesn't do it for me.My biggest pet peeve with this keyboard is that some of the keys are only "half lit" whereas the top half is quite a bit darker in comparison to the rest of the key. This shows more prominently on some keys over others. And yes....I have increased the brightness as much as I can.

The keyboard is good enough, just not great.  The mouse left and right buttons are too close to the center wheel button.  While gaming, I use the center wheel for aim switching and weapon selection.  I find it hard to press the wheel without also pressing a left or right button during competition.  I also get the impression sometimes that when I am pressing a button the mouse stops tracking position.  Not sure if this is true.  Just me impression.

This keyboard and mouse looks nice and the colors work well, though I could do without the blinking and cycling of colors in some modes as I am a writer and not a gamer. The light in the keyboard could be brighter as my last keyboard was much brighter but wasn't available any longer. Of all the lighted keyboards I have purchased, this is among the best because of the reliable working of the keys--no extra letters appearing with one stroke.

The keyboard has some awesome lighting combos. It's comfortable and the keys aren't loud. However the space bar is extremely difficult to actually push down compared to how it's supposed to be. The lights aren't as bright as they could be with them turned all the way up. There is no instructions that come with it so you have to look it up. The cords for the mouse and keyboard are braided so they will last quite a while. All in all, it was worth the price.

I love the look of this keyboard. It looks like an expensive gaming mechanical keyboard, but it actually costs under 30 dollars. It is NOT mechanical, but honestly, what under 30 dollar keyboard is? The keyboard is plenty comfortable to type on, and I like it how the WASD and arrow keys are colored, so that way I can quickly know where they are. The mouse, although it looks uncomfortable, is actually extremely comfortable to use. I love it how there are back and forth arrows on the left side of the mouse, to easily go back and forth between web pages. The keyboard and mouse are extremely responsive in games, and the keyboard is designed well enough to where I rarely miss the correct keys when gaming and typing. A lot of newer keyboards ditch putting the caps lock, num lock, and scroll lock lights, but this keyboard has then, which is another thing I like.I was under the impression, however, that this keyboard would come back-lit, due to the product description, saying this keyboard has LED lighting. My mistake. Only their logo, and red dashes at the bottom of the keyboard are lit. Just a fair warning.

The keyboard is good, the mouse is great for everyday use, I had no problems what so ever since day one but, you can’t save the LED setting It resets after shutdown the computer. I would give it 5 stars if the company make an app for it to save settings which is so simple. But, if you don’t care about LED thing then it’s good enough for the price.

I've had a couple of gaming keyboards at this point. Most of them were named brand keyboards and they all preformed great. I will say for this keyboard that it is not a mechanical keyboard. If that is what you are looking for, then this is not the board for you. However, this is a great budget buy and the keyboard feels very comfortable. My fiance bought me this bundle as a gift and I love it. I have not used the mouse yet, so I cannot speak on the mouse but in my hand, it feels like the older Razer Deathadder mouses. If you are looking for a budget buy, this is a great price for a pretty quality keyboard. I've been running it pretty hard for almost a year now and there hasn't been any key failures or whatnot. Nothing seems to be giving out either.

I lived in China for nearly 6 years, so the 红龙 (Red Dragon) name and from what I found in shops in China, basically let me know why this item is cheaper than many gaming keyboards, however, the quality is still great. I love the feel of the keys, they press smoothly and quietly but still have that crisp feel I like. Having the red directional keys has already saved me several times. The mouse combo is wonderful, so I didn't have to go looking somewhere else for a matching mouse and I love the texture feel on it, and the scroll wheel feels nice and smooth. The braided cords are a nice touch, no more annoyingly loud scraping of wire on the desk (I prefer wire connection so this is a plus). It's lit on some parts but not the whole keyboard, which I actually prefer.All-in-all, very affordable, great quality, nice looks, nice feel, super satisfied.

I love this keyboard. It has many extra commands that any other keyboard doesn't have. You can access everything you need to with the instrustion manuel that it comes with. It is good for gaming and typing. You can also change the lighting! I love using this to play my game and comfort my fingers while I type. I really reccoment this product.

The keyboard has several functions that I didn't notice until after looking over the page. It has a button to disable the windows key, and for someone who's constantly hitting it with the bottom of their hand while gaming, it's a GODSEND!Its spill resistance also lived up to its name, in a series of unfortunate events, I spilled coffee and iced tea on the keyboard (both occurring separately), and although it was sticky at first, within a day or so it was like new again, I can barely even tell I spilled anything on it.

The bottom line: You're better off buying the stand-alone mouse (linked below) and a better keyboard.I bought this product about a month ago based on positive reviews.  The mouse is great - it has a good weight, the buttons are in logical positions, it's easy to adjust the speed.  About my only issue with it is that the lights stay on when the computer is off.  Note that I switched from using a basic mouse with two buttons to this, and it's my first gaming mouse.

Bad out of the box. Several base keys, such as "a" and "o" do not respond at all.  The box discusses features that don't seem to actually exist (like controlling the constant color flashing) and the warranty demands a "Dealer Stamp" to be valid.It looks good, unplugged.

There are so many options for the keyboard. You can change the speeds and the brightness to various settings. You can use breathing mode or you can disable it. You can also have multiple colors flashing at the same time or have different colors at a time. You can have just one color- there are too many options. The different options are shown in the manual. It feels nice on your fingers and it looks professional. The colors do not hurt your eyes at all. However, the corners of the keyboard has little knobs to keep grip. My desk is white, so sometimes, it scrapes across my desk and turns it black. However, I can just clean it out. This shouldn't be a giant problem because you shouldn't be moving your keyboard really hard. It is not a giant deal. The mouse feels great and you can even adjust the weight on the mouse to whatever you want. The DPI comes in four settings. This product is great.

This isnt a bad setup for the price.  If youre new to computer gaming or on a budget,  I would highly recommend this for you.  The RGB on the keyboard has about 7 different modes that you can choose from.  Sadly the mouse only stays red but i still like the way it looks.  I currently only use the keyboard from this but only because i was given a nicer mouse.

This keyboard and mouse are both high quality and feel way more expensive than the low price they cost. They both have a braided fabric cords that add more sophistication to the set. The keyboard and mouse are quick responsive and work well for gaming. The enter key on the keyboard itself was offset a bit to the side compared to most of the keyboards I've used, which took a while to get used to, but this was a quick adjustment. This bundle is a great deal for the price you're paying. Definitely worth it for a multifunctional keyboard and mouse set if you're not looking for all the bells and whistles. The rate of this would be a 4.5 but since half stars are not available I am putting a 4.

Needed a replacement mouse, and said, hey, why not a keyboard too. Well that was a mistake. The keyboard would have keys that would press constantly. Like the "Enter" key was rapidly being pressed. Pressing the Fn key would sometimes fix it, sometimes not; super annoying because it keeps waking up my computer and pushing "enter" for the password. Then the mouse, it was working out, for about a week. Then, all of the sudden, left click is constantly pressed or constantly being pressed at a rapid rate. And I don't mean physically. It does still click and everything. However, on screen it behaves as if the mouse is down, or being pressed super fast as if by some unseen clickmaster force.

When you purchase a Xim apex it shows this and a mouse pad but on the Xim website it says on the compatibility list this bundle does NOT work but for the price it's a decent bundleEdit: just tried and it infact does work with Xim Apex idk why it says not compatible on the website but it does work

I got this as a gift. Didnt buy it myself but it is a really nice and durable keyboard abd mouse. Also its very nice but its not a mechanical keyboard. So if your looking for one of them this is not for you, but i had a mechanical razer keyboard and it did not work great at all, same with the mouse. This keyboard and mouse has zero problems. It is backlit and has everything youll need in a keyboard. Now same as the keyboard the mouse is amazing. Its red lighting, has a really cool feeling but rough texture on some sides and the lmb and rmb. Its very responsive and is a great mouse overall. I had a razer mouse before this one and it was terrible. It would drift on the screen. But this one doesnt. Overall i recommend this keyboard and mouse. Its very inexpensive and really good quality.

Do not buy this product, it did not work, I plugged it in and all the lights came on, but none of the keys worked on the keyboard or the mouse. I tried different usb ports, tried it on different computers, nothing. The lights come on but the keyboard and mouse do not work. So buy something else.

To be fair I only brought this set for the aesthetics lol. But it does what it needs to do, I like that you can change the backlight keyboard colors to the "breathing" feature, because it's default flashy lights are annoying when typing. You can tell right away that the cords are very durable, they should last me a good while. There's also two side buttons on the mouse that allows you to go to the next and previous page when on the internet.The last pic is my set up, this is my set up so far for digital art. IIonly bought this keyboard for the backlit capabilities. 😅

The lighting is nice.  The keyboard is already starting to fail, as though you have to hit the keys twice (harder the second time). I have one at work that is perfect so it might just be a QA issue or 1-off problem.  I'm not returning it but wouldn't recommend it.  (I got the whole kit.)

By far the biggest issue is the cursor freezing in place. Intermittently, the cursor will freeze in place and no inputs will be recorded, despite moving the mouse or clicking. Then 1-2 seconds later, the cursor will jump to where you moved it. This presents a HUGE issue for gaming, where reaction speed is important and 1-2 seconds can get you killed and decide the game. This cursor-freezing issue occurs extremely often: usually once a minute and often 2-3 times in a minute. I'm buying a different mouse as a result, never buying from Redragon again.
Originally had first version of s101 combo.Pros: Keyboard is definitely improved, Backlight on keyboard is great. Mouse is pretty much the same except for led binking.

NOTE: White Keyboard is not Backlit, it does have RGB but the letters do not illuminate. In the old pictures it shows the letters lit up for some reason but on the new ones they changed it to how it should be.

Keyboard looks and works great. I noticed a crack in the top left corner by the ESC button. the amazon box and the MFG box was undamaged. This definitely tells me it left the store or factory like this. The keyboard works. Just don't know if I want to go through the hassle of the return. Hopefully Red Dragon will see this and get better. Maybe the next customer will make out.

This review is for the Redragon S101 Vajra *and* Redragon Centrophorus Gaming Mouse.When the product first arrived after only a day of waiting, I found the keyboard and the mouse to be in an amazing condition, it felt pretty good to type on and the keys gave a nice tactile feedback (though it isn't a mechanical keyboard, so rather nice touch). The build quality is kinda good, but I've noticed that the keyboard makes a sort of breaky sound if you press down on it as a wrist rest or if you lift it up, though that isn't anything to be afraid of!

It’s a defective keyboard, none of the keys work, only the the lights do. And it’s frustrating because I waited so long for it and it’s junk that was made by some lazy worker that didn’t want to fix it, so don’t buy this. It’s cheap and some keys won’t work, also tried using it for gaming. WSAD and space bar and all the keys on the left and right side won’t work, so Redragon is a company that makes cheap products and I recommend it’s a waste. Sending it back, and never buying from them again, also mouse came defective to. It was broken, so I recommend it as a “Don’t Buy”.

I believe the weights are removable, but so far I like the weight.

Perfect for the price, LED's are neat, especially all the options you get on the keyboard. Keys are a little loud but nothing major. Slight issue with left CTRL; since this is designed to be a gaming keyboard, many shortcuts involving left CTRL are unusable, since CTRL is disabled for them. Right CTRL however still works just fine for commands like Task Manager and such. Overall, a great buy I would highly recommend.

Couple of issues with this keyboard but nothing that can't be overcome.  One:  The H-key can stick.  This is because the key can be pressed deep enough that it gets trapped under the keyboard plastic.  The other, and more problematic issue is the layout of the keyboard.  In a normal keyboard the |/\ is above the <Enter> key and to the right of the ]/} key.  Normally this key is to the right of the ]/} key.  End result, rather than pressing <ENTER> you are actually hitting the "\".  Debating on returning at this point.
