I initially got this for a Xmas gift for my sister and she was ecstatic when she opened her gift. I was impressed with it when she had it all setup on her computer. The keystroke was nice and smooth and no loud clicking sounds like a mechanical keyboard, mind you it still makes a little keyboard stroke sound. The backlit light adds a special touch, especially if you're playing games with minimal lighting. You can set the light to either one tone ie. blue, yellow, red etc.. or a rainbow pattern that flashes across the keyboard. You can also set the speed of the flow of the light as well.The only problem is the wrist rest, it's small so it doesn't cover your entire wrist. It comes up to your palm and that's it. I used a wireless Logitech keyboard which provided a generous amount of space with its wrist rest. However this is a gaming keyboard so you might want to see if the ergonomics fits your style of playing. So far I don't have any problems with it. The mouse ergonomically fitted my hand perfectly not to mention the material provided a nice touch and grip. The braided wire added a special touch and rugged feeling. The mouse offers a 3000 DPI as well 4 level of DPI adjustment.  Having said my piece... I was taken by how it performed, look and feel that I ordered another one for myself. I got this keyboard for half the price, so if you're in the market for a decent yet affordable keyboard, I recommend getting this while it last/ on sale.

Great thing with this is that you get lots of customization with the RGB lighting for the keyboard and mouse. It's pretty cheap and the mouse has individual weights you can add or take away to customize the weight. You can also customize the dpi. But that's about the extent of the good stuff, including the cheap price for this set.For the bad, the build quality blows. Made from cheap plastic, with cheap packaging (which I don't mind as much). The keys for the mouse and keyboard does not give good response, they feel mushy. The mouse doesn't have RGB, only red colour. The mouse also doesn't feel comfortable at all in the hand,  and the mouse aethetics doesn't match the keyboard at all. It looks mismatched.

This is a very good looking combo set, especially because of the LED lights coming out of both keyboard and mouse. Both wires are long & sturdyThe typing sound is not very loud. Very comfortable to type. I faced no issue when playing FIFA. Enter, Backspace, Shift keys are long. Everything I wanted in a keyboard.
Played Csgo with it for 400+ hrs.Mouse is excellent. No issues bout that.

I can't really complain about anything with this combo. The only things that I would have liked to have would be RGB leds in the mouse, so that you could match it with the keyboard. As it stands you kind of have to have the keyboard running a red or white colour, otherwise the glowing red mouse looks kind of odd beside the keyboard. If you download the drivers from the Redragon website you can disable the red mouse lights if you want, but the mouse, mouse cord, and keyboard logo all still use a red colour, which don't really match with any other keyboard led colours.The only other thing I wish this keyboard had was dedicated volume keys; instead it has dedicated sleep and power-off keys, and others. I really don't understand why anyone would need a keyboard shortcut to turn off their PC, so it's annoying this was a priority over much more common shortcuts.

Ok. First off. I'm picky. I've got that mouse in my hand all day. I didn't like it. You might. It looks really cool. But for me it sat too low to the ground if you know what I mean. I like to pick it up, use it on my leg, put it back down and use it right away. When it skips or misses I loose track of my thoughts....  I'll buy a better quality mouse - my fault. But again, everyone else seems to think it's ok. Keyboard? ...um , no. No thank you. But again. I'm picky. I love the lights. It's easy to see in the dark which is what I wanted but the keys make me think of touching something squishy that shouldn't BE squishy... I like a difinitive click or at least a reasonable facsimile. This is not that. That being said I have a couple Microsoft keyboards  that feel exactly the same . But that's why I bought another one... Good price, but not for me. Within the first five minutes I was pressing the keys beside each and typing like a klutz. The odd key press yeilds a squishy nothing at all and that to me on a new keyboard is unacceptable. You might love it but I think if you sit at it for more than twenty minutes a day you should aim a bit higher. 2.5 out of five. For me. 2 cause the mouse sucks too. For me.  It came fast... Oh, and. 6 programmable buttons? Really? Really? How? There's no software that I could find and when I tried to get the Microsoft m&k center software to work with it I swear I heard hushed laughter from inside my computer.... I tried to find something to program the mouse buttons but no. Nothing. So if you want to do something besides go back forward or launch your pointer into God knows where with that center button... Look for something that SAYS it includes software. NOT  something that says it " works with anything" .  The company itself? I'm thinking about buying a kb from them that's a little higher up, so they seem to me to have good quality in their better items.  Again. I am very picky. If your not, Amazon is the place to try it out. They will take it back if you don't like it.

I bought this primarily for the keyboard. The mouse works fine. Keyboard has great settings and I like the feel of the keys as I type. I chose this keyboard over two other similar backlit ones because of the way it feels when I type and the ease of use for the back light settings. I'm taking a star away because I think the shape of the keyboard is a bit bulky. I think they could have packed this thing down to a slimmer more minimalist design. Overall, I'm pretty happy with this purchase and I would buy it again.

Ok, so it's not a first-rate, highest-quality keyboard, but then it doesn't cost like one, either. It's worked out very well for my 14-yr-old son who games about an hour a day. He's not a rabid gamer, so this is perfect. And he really likes the cool light-up effect. We are using it on a Mac and, two months in, he has only had to work around the @ key which is mapped somewhere else, in non-mac position. Other than that, for his purposes, at least (quite a few games, and typing reports)  the keyboard works great.

Mouse works well, although I wish there were 2 dpi adjustment buttons instead of just one that cycles. Mouse feels solid and has a nice grip and customizable weights. Although to me it still feels a bit too light with all the weights.Keyboard has a good layout but I wish the volume controls were at the top rather than as FN keys. The buttons feel mushy though. Not a super fan, but I can work with it.
Considering the price it's good enough the thing I don't like:-Mouse side button, does not feel like they will last has long has top one.

Key board and mouse are great. Smiles from ear to ear. Even uses it on his computer, not just his PS4 game. (6/27/2020) PROBLEM WITH MOUSE 3 WEEKS AGO. SENT AN E-MAIL, BUT NO RESPONSE. KEYBOARD IS FINE, MOUSE WILL NOT WORK. I'D LOVE AN EXCHANGE ON THAT, BUT WENT TO BEST BUY AND PURCHASED ANOTHER. NOT MY HAPPY FACE!!!

Worst product ever, not even sure why there’s so much good review??? The first keyboard I got stop working after 5 days of use, keeping dying out after idle of 2 mins. Then they sent me a replacement and the backspace bar and the = bar are like glue together. Every time I hit the backspace, equal sign filled in the blank. This keyboard it’s too cheaply made. Save yourself the trouble and get something else.

Bought this thing ages ago and had a ton of issues but never bothered to review it. But then I bought another product from these people and had even MORE issues that they ignored me about until I left them a bad review and they promised me a replacement that they never sent. So i decided to go back and review this one too. Its super cheap, the LED's in the keyboard NEVER worked, the mouse scroll wheel stopped working almost immediately and the left click is sporadic at best and clearly as mentioned above the customer service is AWFUL.

I had seen some reviews about the bad quality of the keyboard. And the a lot of good reviews were particularly complimenting more the mouse than the keyboard, which made me skeptical about buying it, but I did. Now, there are 2 major issues and one minor issue.The keyboard turns off for 2 seconds whenever I'm writing at a faster pace, which is very bad when we're talking about a keyboard made for gaming. It also turns off for 2 seconds when i try to write the @ character (shift + '2' key pressed), and when it's back on it considers the Shift key always pressed, and only by pressing the shift key again does this stop.

This keyboard feels good to type on like a mechanical keyboard. It doesn't produce any clicks and makes little noise, and the keys have a nice feeling to them texture wise. It isn't heavy at all but the rubber grips keeps it mostly from moving.I've seen some confusion on the the LEDs of the keyboard and how to use them in the comments. To use the LEDs press FN along with page down to turn the LEDs on and off. Home will cycle though the colors green, pink, yellow, teal, white, blue and red. Page up will make the rainbow pattern appear, which repeatedly pressing will change where each color is. End will make whatever color or the rainbow that is active pulse on and off. Insert will make the colors cycle between each other. Delete will make the rainbow move along the keyboard.

Being a console gamer all my life I wanted to try keyboard and mouse on fortnite on my ps4 (so keep in mind I was new to this / it was my first keyboard, but)I'm shocked at the incredible value this keyboard and mouse combo has, the backlit led looks great and has so many effects to choose, the buttons click easily and fast, and the quality feels like it should be a more expensive product
The keyboard and mouse work as intended and light up nicelyPros:
Only problem- cannot get my son away from it!

Visually this keyboard offers a lot, you can change the colours, if they strobe or not, i went with solid purple and while its not as bright as my last keyboard still I am happy.However that is where my happiness ends. My last keyboard felt like I was typing on clouds. Light and smooth with very little pressure needed. This keyboard feels like I'm hammering rocks with each keystroke. I have to push down so much harder and its a deal breaker. I'm going to get my old keyboard repaired and pawn this one off on my husband.

love it , it s exactly what i want , i cant explain it u have to have one of this things , i know there is thousand of mouse and keyboard out there but this one is one of the best that most of people can afford it i spend like 4 hours online to find a match for my msi cause msi mouse and keyboard asking unfair price then i find red dragon , i m happy my desktop is happy too.

This item has problems with the keyboard buttons being stuck down when click and only 8/20 hotkey's working; the most annoying that you can't control the sound, play, next, stop and pause for your media player. The dam company website don't have a update driver to fix this issue. i am a new shopper for amazon, i don't know why they even let this item on the sell list. i want to return it but i m to lazy to go through all the shipping bs process. i may try to return it when i m not lazy to do so. don't buy this item, it a pain in the ass to have to return it.
Bought for my son who loves it!!

Listen up guys hope this will help you in making a decision to buy this or not, style i cant complain its actually very nice, i like the fact that your able to the change the color on the keyboard to many different colors and that it is very simple to do so (FN plus home button). The keys arent really silent so if your looking for quiet well this might not make ya happy (little click sounds) but as far as pressing two buttons at the same time for gaming ,it works! Mouse not much to say about it besides saying its awesome and stylish. Durability... well listen its to early for me to say anything about that but all i can say is if you keep care of your stuff i dont see any reason why this shouldnt last for a good amount of time. Overall i give it a 4 on 5 stars and would I re buy it again if i;d be able to go back in time after testing product.........Yes. Great buy for the price guys. Hope it helps.

I'm not a great PC gamer, so this combo servers my purposes quite well.  A mechanical keyboard in my incapable hands would be overkill, and this one feels good to me.  I love the mouse.  Actually went and bought the wireless version for my laptop just because I liked the weight, ergonomics and feel so well.  The software for the mouse is simple but good.  Not a huge fan of RGB on everything so I turn it off, if there's a way to keep it off so it doesn't turn on with the computer everytime, I couldn't find it.

I've been using this keyboard since the COVID-19 lockdown started and it's great. Very responsive. The keys make noise, but aren't obnoxious nor distracting. I love that there are different modes for the backlighting. My only complaint (which is so petty I'm not taking a star off) is that every time I restart my computer, I have to change the backlighting setting manually -- it doesn't remember your preferences between computer usage. Again, that's so minor, I'm not worried about it. It's just a matter of clicking a couple keys until I get it to my preferred setting. Not a big deal.  I've played World of Warcraft using this keyboard and have no issues, no complaints about responsiveness or anything. It's decent. :)

I don't understand what all the negative reviews are about, it's a $40 keyboard you get what you pay for. Overall the mouse works fine for multiple purposes and the keyboard is working great and all the buttons Seem to work fine they could have used a bit better material. I would have gladly spend an extra $20 on this keyboard and mouse just for a little bit more stronger material but overall everything is working fine I've only had it for a few days now so I can't tell you about the long-term outcome one thing I do like to mention is that their website is cool and all but it's difficult getting the right software you need from their website? Their website needs some work, finding the right software was not easy. You get what you pay for and you get your money's worth with this keyboard and mouse for 40 bucks.I will post another review in the upcoming weeks to let you know the long-term outcome so go ahead and try it, keyboard and mouse you have a 30-day return on it if you're not happy, so far everything's good?

Usually I find it very difficult to find nice keyboard mouse combos for a good price. At the time of purchase these were on sale for 33.99$ CAD (Canadian Dollars). The regular price for this set is about $70 CAD, now the real question is would I buy for $70? To be honest I probably would. It's a great keyboard that fells smooth and the mouse is very responsive. I use both for home office work and gaming and am yet to run into a problem. 34 buck is a big steal for a product of this caliber.

Very good quality, I love the mouse in particular. Feels very strong and it looks and performs very nicely. Adjustable weight of the mouse, and toggle between 3 set dpi's easily. Nice feel in the hands. The keyboard is nice too, keys are NOT backlit (was unsure in description) but it isn't necessary anyway. Keyboard is just like a regular keyboard but looks cool. Can't go wrong for the price, would definetly reccomend. Free shipping was very fast (only a few days) and arrived many days before it was expected.

It’s a great keyboard for the price. I love the lights, and I much prefer the feel of the keys and overall experience of it over the tiny cramped keyboard I had prior. Much better for gaming especially, but I would even recommend it for non-gamers if u want a pretty, fairly good quality keyboard for a good price lol.Upon unboxing, I did notice maybe a third of the keys have what seems like... some sort of discolouration or something around the sides? Nothing comes off when I wipe at it, but it does have a somewhat more slippery texture I guess??? It’s not a dealbreaker or a big issue, honestly, I don’t really care or notice it (especially bc it’s on the sides of the keys anyway). But I thought it might be worth mentioning.

This seems like a great price for a gaming keyboard and mouse. However the keys, especially the left Shift key is hard to push. Almost like it sticks. If you don’t push it in the middle it takes a lot of effort. Most games require this ease too. Because of this of this alone I’d say stay away.The colours are nice. You can change from always on to off or multi coloured or one solid.

Le clavier respecte les informations fournies. Il est performant et très lumineux ! Ses modes de couleurs sont riches et adapté pour plaire à tout le monde. Les touches sont confortable. La souris est elle aussi comme décrite. Le seul point faible serait les instruction. J’ai du trouver moi même comment faire les réglages du clavier et même si il y a un petit carnet venant avec les produit, rien n’a l’air d’être expliqué mais j’adore !

I got this because I wanted a keyboard that would change colours. I like the fact that it has the flattened/angled side at the bottom as it provides the hands some support for typing.  Different modes on the color changes; solid colors as well as different colour changing patterns. The mouse it came with is light and easy to use. The mouse has only the colour red.

This arrived today and is much better quality than I anticipated for the price. Both the keyboard and mouse have a good weight and feel. The flexible nylon cord on the mouse is so much nicer than those stiff plastic ones. The keyboard colours are customizable and very attractive. Very happy with this purchase and would highly recommend it.

I have virtually no complaints about this purchase. It was fairly cheap and I took a shot in the dark on purchase, thinking that if it was crap - well it was only $40 or so.BUT it works great. The USB wires are threaded and braided for durability and have a Velcro tie back on them.

The product is really nice, the backlighting is pretty trip.  Quality and feel are definitely decent, but you can tell its not premium.  Don't get me wrong for what you pay and what you get this is a no brainer.  I am sure it will perform just fine.  The mouse has a braided cable which is nice.  As well it is weighted and has removable weights to customize to your preferences.  Watch for my update it might just end up switching to 5 stars as long as it performs as expected.-update:  5 stars.  It works amazing and there are so many different lighting options
Probably one of the best deals for a very cheap, but decent keyboard + mouse combo.Pros:
Clavier avec diodes multicolores.  Toucher agréable, peu bruyant.  Bon rapport qualité-prix. / Keyboard with multicolored diodes.  Nice touch, little noise.  Good value for the price.

The keyboard is pretty great, so far. It feels light and kind of... plastic out of the box, but once set on a desk it's got a solid and rather immobile sort of feel. The keys are quiet but firm, which I like. The mouse has a good, solid feel to it as well - the braided cord is a nice feature, and the texture of the buttons and overall feel of the mouse in my palm is perfect for something at this price-point. As a low-key gamer, having the extra buttons on the side is perfect. Any more than two and they would irritate me, but having the extra keys is great for binding them to the more important commands for various games. So far there are only 2 things that I would change or remove:1) The keyboard loses it's previous lighting setting when the computer is shut down. Sleep doesn't seem to revert it to default, but full shut-down puts it back to a sort of scrolling rainbow across the length of the surface. Not too bad of an issue though; there are preprogrammed quick keys to choose/cycle through the different options.
Received keyboard and tested it out to make sure everything works.For the S101 Redragon RGB LED backlit keyboard:

Good:Great feeling keyboard and mouse. I have been using the keyboard for a year now with no problems and still don't want to replace this thing. The color changing button is very handy for adjusting color on the fly while in a game or something. Mouse had a really great mouse button finish on it that I want on all of my mouses. The buttons on the mouse also work very well and give off a very satisfying click. Mouse wheel feels controlled and not loose which is a big pet peeve of mine. Both of the items look bad ass and over all the keyboard works well.

Better then I expected, the RGB backlighting was very easy to figure out, changing colors, pulsing colors, solid color, or simply turning it off, mainly bought for the keyboard but I've found the mouse is pretty good aswell. Material quality is good but not High-end, but for the low price you cant go wrongOverall satisfied with this purchase and would recommend

Product:Great products all around and a great upgrade to any regular mouse and keyboard for gaming. The keyboard is nothing exceptional, but looks and feels great, not to mention that it does its job very well. The mouse is where this combo shines. Not only does it look and feel great like its partner, but it is very well laid out and offers great responsiveness. You can also customize its weight to your preference, which is a great feature for a budget mouse. Everything works wonderfully and looks awesome.
-a good keyboard for the price.-made of plastic so it has a bit of deck flex.
In the pic you can see RGB lightning, hence purchased it, when I got the product there is just red light and only in the bottom corners of the keyboard. Please use the legit images, don't mislead

Thought it was a good deal as everything worked perfect when new. Doesn't feel too cheap either given the price. However, the scroll wheel on the mouse started malfunctioning after about 5 months of regular use - I didn't even press on it that often, just scrolling up and down doing normal average browsing - and now it doesn't register the scrolling properly. Sometimes it scrolls up when it's supposed to scroll down and vice versa, and sometimes it doesn't scroll at all. Very frustrating.The keyboard is still working as intended though.

Great keyboard and mouse combo. The first issue I have with the keyboard is how it feels like the keys are closer together which brings the overall length of the board down and causes some awkward typos and having to get used to the space bar.I would not recommend this combo for folks with big hands as the mouse is also quite small unless you claw-grip.

The mouse works great, the keyboard feels nice but has some problems; e.g. The LED cycles through 2 (sort of 3) colors on colorfade/solid color mode, and the volume is controlled by an FN command as opposed to dedicated buttons while there's buttons for things like calculator and refresh page. I'd say that it is worth what I paid for it, but it's not perfect.

This is good value for the money as it is an entry level gaming setup. You get what you pay for so if you are looking for a high end mechanical gaming keyboard this is not the one for you but if you are looking for a good entry level setup this is the one for you and you can't beat the price.

I just made the switch from console to PC and I've been using this keyboard for about 2 weeks now. I have no problems with it. The custom LED lights are super fun too! Great for late-night gaming! The Mouse has a great feel to it! The only problem I have with the mouse is that with the LED lights, it can get hot so I usually turn it off!  It's a mechanical keyboard but it's very loud! You want a keyboard that click clacks? This baby is the one for you.

The volume keys are not convenient at all as you have to hold down the function key to use then and the function key is on the opposite side of the keyboard. I have large hands and I can hardly reach both keys with one hand to quickly adjust volume.

I play online shooters and almost all games use WASD to control movement. After only 1 week of use, the keys are quite squishy and the D key doesn't seem to respond unless I hit it all by itself (i.e. not in combination with other keys), which is a non-starter if you are playing a game because you never press just 1 movement key.I actually like the mouse, but since it's a set, I am returning both.

Like the feel and look of the keyboard and mouse. Can not seem to get the keyboard to lose settings when shutting and rebooting, but could be as this only designed for Windows as no Linux drivers or software provided, which is a shame.Wish could have the mouse change color as well.

Product arrived 2 days before estimated date which was awesome. The product itself is awesome after reading the reviews I thought it would have felt light and cheap but that is not the case at all. Feels tough and keypress is great. The option to turn the mouse lights on or off is a great option too. Ihave always bought a different name brand for mouse and keyboard but after playing around and using these i can definitely say I found my new go to for PC accessories. And I recommend this to everyone and not just gamers.

i love this keyboard and mouse. the lights are awesome and it feels great. the only thing is when it got shipped to me the courier left it on my step in the pouring rain. i have a front porch and he couldn't event open the screen door and put it by my mailbox. i wonder what would of happened if it got stolen or damaged from the rain. i also had a processor delivered which was also left in the rain the same time the keyboard. it makes me think that maybe spending the extra 20 bucks and buying it at best buy would be better.

Nice product, just have to figure out how to turn off the flashing keyboard.  Keyboard keys a little stiff however after some use will feel better.  Mouse nice and worked perfectly.  Good buy mouse and a keyboard

Keyboard is pretty good, a couple of buttons seem to stick a slight bit, dont return as fast as they should. Mouse is enough to pass. It is alright, but it has weird material that looks even weirder over time. Really cheap mouse. Weights are cool. Broke already.

4 stars instead of 5 because I had to open up the mouse and tighten some screws so that the mouse would stop making rattling noises. Other than that, very solid, durable product. Mouse feels responsive, keyboard is impactful, only complaint besides having to open up the mouse is that the keyboard does not memorize your RGB configuration after a shutdown.

Not exactly what I expected but it does the job. I use this keyboard with a laptop. The most annoying part is the keyboard and mouse doesn't remember the last programmed setting, so you have to manually set it each time you plug in the USB cable.

I needed a mouse/keyboard combo to update my workstation at home. This set is great as the mouse is very light, fits a bigger sized hand and the cording seems heavy duty. I love the ability to change the colour display on the keyboard. Keys on keyboard are easy to push (less resistance). Cords come with velcro zip ties for easy cord storage during use.

I got these for 35 canadian at the time, and for that price it has been amazing. I have since upgraded the mouse for my main computer, but still use it for my laptop. Haven't stopped using the keyboard though. Only issues are that some of my keys are fading, which is probably due to heavy use, and the 'O' key was very slightly less responsive, though that issue just seemed to disappear overtime.
Quality made and feel. I needed a keyboard that had lights in the keys so I bought this combo... very nice to use and comfortable. A good deal. Mouse is comfy in the hand and very responsive.
I like this combo, and for the price it can't be beat.I would  prefer if the keyboard was a little larger, and possibly have a rest for your wrists.

I enjoyed the keyboard at first because of its look but the space bar suddenly began to let out a spring noise after every hit after two weeks of use.  Also the most annoying part is that some keys do not go down when you hit them because they somehow drag along their track. The biggest culprit is the backspace button, which is really annoying. If you dont hit the keys dead center straight down it will  not register half the time.Looks cool, doesnt work well. Maybe I got a lemon? Mouse works great, I love it.

Love the backlighting options and the sturdiness of the keyboard. Fairly quiet keys and very responsive. Mouse is nice however would not suggest as a gaming mouse for WOW or LofL etc as there are not enough programmable buttons. Otherwise a nice mouse for casual gamers.

It arrived and perfect condition, and works great, I love that I can change the colours of the keyboard and helps if I want to play a game or type in the dark. I will definitely be ordering again when I need a new keyboard and mouse.

The keyboard feels great, satisfying button push and not loud at all. RGB looks great, has several patterns to choose form and colour/brightness controls. The mouse is fantastic, has a texure to it that feels great in the hand. My only gripe.... I found a bunch of key conflicts while playing GTA 5/Online. Im sure I'll find more as I try more games. Overall this is a great choice if you're on a budget, the mouse alone feels like a $40 mouse, but having key conflicts prevents this from being a proper "Gaming" keyboard.

I didnt know what to expect for 50$cad as I saw a bunch of cheap looking and feeling keyboards and mouse combo for that price point in different stores but this one is nothing like it. It feels like quality and I would buy again 100%. Is it a 150$ gaming keyboard? Of course no. But for that price you will not find anything better

Bonne souris , simple et robuste pour le prix. Ça fait un an que je l'ai et je joue tous les soir à overwatch ou warzone , la molette commence à aller mal vers l'avant mais à part ça tout va bien. Ça vaut l'investissement. Mes amis ont tous de souris et claivier 3-4 fois plus dispendieuse et on est pas mal tous du même calibre.

Awesome mouse and keyboard! I've had no problems so far. The mouse is super comfortable to use. I did have to get used to the keyboard as I had a little one with much smaller keys before this. Love that I finally have a backlit keyboard. Keyboard and mouse config are separate, keyboard has the controls right on it and mouse has software. Thought I'd bring that up since I saw someone ask about syncing.
Very nice, I love the variety of lights it has plus the pulse option. It feels nice on the fingers and hand (no straining). Great price, money well spent.  Fast delivery is a definite plus also...

Tis is an awesome keyboard and mouse combo. The keyboard's keys are really comfortable to use, they have a ghard sensation when you press them and I find it perfect for gaming. I game regularly, not to often and this is a perfect keyboard fro gamers like me. It is also good for working and writing long texts. The mouse is pretty comfortable and it is really good for gaming! I'm doing this review 2 years after buying it and everything is wworking like on the first day. It is made from good material and it is really durable. Overall it is worth buying and I give it a 5 star review. Small mention: The lights on the keyboard are amazing, they are really colorful, and it is good looking! There is also a DPI on the mouse and you can arrage it like you like it.
PROS:+Great materials quality

We purchased this keyboard and mouse set for my son for Christmas. He enjoys gaming online with his friends daily and wanted something that could keep up with the types of games he plays. He likes the back-lit keyboard and how much grip the mouse provides. This keyboard is hooked up to our main family desktop, so I have has occasion to use it as well. Typing on it is a breeze! I would recommend this product as an affordable option for those who want an introduction to gaming hardware.

I got what I expected to get. I got this keyboard over other ones because I can see the keyboard keys in the dark. Other keyboards I saw lit up but only around the keys. They keys feel nice to type with and I have enough options for the type of lighting I would want. I like the mouse as well. Over all I'm happy with my purchase. The only issue I was having was with the drivers and software but they have already contacted me and have resolved the issue. Good customer service :)

This is MUCH nicer than I expected.  The keys have just a bit of softness to them, and it isn't overly loud when you press a key.  Both the key and the letters are backlit (on these cheap keyboards the letters don't usually light up, only the back of the key).  The only thing I didn't like was that the mouse only has red LEDs.  I thought I could change the color on both, but the mouse does not change.  Other than that one thing, this was perfect.

the keyboard is exactly as shown.  I have Windows 10 and it was plug and play  no downloading of drivers.  but you will want to download the manual as the one that comes with is such tiny print it is hard to read.  The mouse felt light out of the box but after using it for a bit  it feels natural and is very responsive ...  excellent quality  and exceptional price

Although the price is great for a mouse and a keyboard, but you get what you paid for. The buttons are hard to push, I am a fast typist, sometimes I have to press them three times. Also can't turn the lights off, at every restart they come back on. The mouse although is great and I love the extra buttons on the mouse for gaming.

I had this keyboard for a month now and here is what i think so far. If you need a keyboard for casual use, browsing, and basic work stuff then this keyboard will be a great option for you. Its easy to use, not heavy, looks nice, and its a good value for its price. If you are a heavy gamer (like me) or if you type a lot then i wouldn't recommend this one, pay few extra bucks and get a good mechanical keyboard. With a lot of use, this keyboard doesn't last long. I noticed that the keys on my keyboard started becoming less and less responsive, and need to press harder to recognise the input, at the end i had to get a new mechanical one.

The keyboard is pretty great! I recently bought my own computer separate from my brother and the keyboard works great, there’s clicks but they’re quiet (which is what I prefer anyway) and it looks nice. I cant seem to figure out how to change the colours, however. Also, if you’re on rainbow, the colours don’t shift as smoothly, it’s almost laggy-looking. As for the mouse, it’s nice as well. The sensitivity changes and I think it’s cause of the way i play I accidently mis click a button. but overall it’s good, espicially since it has side buttons which is ideal for me.The overall design of it is really nice but the font on the individual key pieces look so basic, as well as this, the buttons feel small so I always end up making typos.

I thought that this keyboard would be useful outside of it's minimal usage of gaming...You'll be frustrated at how tired you'll get when using it.  It's clumpy, loud and I've never made so many typing errors using such a keyboard...I'm thinking of placing it out for garbage collection next week.

Bought for my daughter and she loves this keyboard. For the price the response time is good and the selection of colours and combinations is awesome. The intented letters makes it easy for late night typing.

This combo is great. the reason I am giving it a 4-star and not a 5-star is because it is missing a couple of short cuts that I would like on the keyboard. I'd really like to see the calculator shortcut and an email shortcut. Other than that this combo is fantastic

I absolutely love this keyboard and mouse combo - I've purchased dozens of them in my life and this is by far my favourite. The mouse in particular feels fantastic. I also bought the large red Redragon mouse pad and I immediately bought a second one after I received it because it's also fantastic. I'll probably buy a second keyboard/mouse combo soon as well just to make sure I have a backup in case something happens to this one. (Note: I've used it for months now and it's still as good as new).

Bought this keyboard about 6 months ago and it is still holding up today everything works on it still even after the abuse it went through. The keyboard did well but it is pretty cheap, the mouse on the other hand is the cheapest sounding and feeling plastic available if you shake it, it sounds like everything is falling apart inside, not to mention the smell, it smells like cheap plastic still.

The adjustable DPI settings are just perfect and suit my use comfortably, the feel of the mouse is awesome and the buttons are in a good spot. The keyboard is nice although I wish it was a little brighter in the daytime, but it's great at night. Its not too loud but sounds nice. My one complaint is that the space key on my keyboard squeaks when i press it in a certain spot (right in the middle) which is annoying but I mostly wear headphones where I can't hear it. Overall, I would recommend, the price suits it perfectly, almost a steal.
This gaming keyboard & mouse is very comfortable to use and the DPI is nicely adjustable on the mouse.  The vibrant colours of the keyboard, along with it's other functions are a nice addition.

Keyboard is decent for the price. The mouse in the combo makes it all worth it though. Mouse is very very good. The keyboard is decent but not great. Several keys are very mushy and the numpad 0 feels like it had a rubber mat instead of a spring or other material. Super super mushy and quite hard sometimes to tell if it's actually registered other then to look at the screen or press it again to be sure. Some of the other keys are a bit mushy but the numpad 0 is by far the worst i've ever felt.

Been using this for a couple of months now. Works well and was a good price. Someone mentioned that the mouse and keyboard stay lit when the computer is off. tl;dr: Great option for a starter keyboard and mouse, especially for gaming, despite a few reservations.Overall good keyboard and mouse combo, especially for the price. I got this bundle for $40 CAD + tax, but any more than that and I would say that it borders on not really worth it. I find the keyboard a little too spongy and inexact for my personal taste, but I think I may be a little spoiled as the wireless one this replaced was a wonderful chiclet model. One major note is that both my wife and I found that the backspace key was jamming near-constantly when typing. I popped the key-cap off to discover that the wire portion of the supports was left off of four keys (backspace, and zero, enter, and plus on the numpad); I bent pieces of paper-clip to fit there and that significantly improved the feel and usability of those keys.
the lights novelty does wear off quick...but i like the stealth red at night great to type by for the eyes

Update: It's a good laptop mouse, lightweight easy to carry around with a durable cord. Works on every surface I've placed it on so far +I always get compliments pertaining to how cool it looks. I keep hitting the back-slash key instead of enter when I type, but I'm getting used to moving my finger further over.

The gaming keyboard and mouse for red dragon was an amazing deal. When the keyboard came in I was excited to try it out , the keyboards appeal with the lighting is semi aggressive but who cares it's a keyboard ? The keys are easily readable and placed in easy to reach and press keys , great layout . The keyboards size is rather small so it made playing with small hands much easier and also more fun. I like that it came back with a keyboard key switcher aswell don't see that often . The mouse was the best part the shape of the mouse was comfortable and the two front buttons (left and Right click) are a different material that offers grip so it was amazing to have that introduced to me . The two side buttons allowed for macroing in game which made the experience better and more fun for myself. One of the unique things about this set is the price it's an amazing deal for anyone who needs a decent wired computer keyboard and mouse . Incredible deal and best bang for your buck, but the cool thing is about the set is the actual cording it's not your standard cord material. Great work red dragon!

We are really enjoying it right now (boy 9)... (Mom 30-ish... OK OK 40).Pros:

Good keyboard and mouse combo, Solid keys that let you know when they are depressed. Feels rugged enough, I don't test my stuff by purposely throwing it on the floor but it sure feels solid even though it's light weight. There is a little twist when held at both ends and then purposely twisted. The feet pop out and allow it to sit stable.The keys are mechanical and I happen to prefer this to the soft keys that are so often used these days. They do have that mechanical sound when depressed letting you know you've hit a key. The action is good and there is no need to slam the keys all the way to the bottom to use them.
incredible the computer run more fast with this kit!!! perfect for gamer... The wires tired me, but the answer the strike and the acelleration make completely forget the wires !!!!!!

My 11 year old grandson came to me one day 6 weeks ago and asked if I had odd jobs for him...he earned enough money to buy this keyboard and mouse. He absolutely loves it!!!! Synchronized lights and a sleek design! He hooked it to his game station and now he has has more flexibility within certain games.I thought it was ironic that he wanted this keyboard and mouse although they are not wireless. Two thumbs up!

product arrived in great time, looked great. after installing it two of the keyboard keys did not work. I called red dragon support and e-mailed them with no response POOR SERVICE. I will be return it and never buy again from them.

I bought this mouse/keyboard combo with the intention of using it for gaming, but had an accident with my primary keyboard and am using this for daily productivity as well.The good: The quality of the construction of both mouse and kb is good for the price. I don't find the keyboard lights offensive because I use them in a wet lit room. Aesthetically, your average 12-14 year old boy will probably love it. Having WASD keys in a different colour helps when gaming if you lose your place. Typing action is very quiet, if that's important to you. The mouse is actually quite good. Smooth tracking, positive clicking action and predictable scrolling. The materials are lower in quality than more expensive mice, but it's good nonetheless and I've never found myself wishing I had a fancier mouse.

I'm not impressed by this keyboard (though I do like the mouse), and had I had the chance to try it before buying it, I probably wouldn't have. It's fairly inexpensive, and the keys definitely let you know when they've been hit. Which is good. The LED can't be toggled on and off, however, which is annoying. I've taken to flipping my power bar off at night just to cut the supply to the keyboard and mouse. I loathe the placement of the ENTER key on this device. Mostly because I'm not used to it. It's an upgrade from the set I had before, but I wouldn't buy it again, if yanno what I mean. Too much hassle to return it though. So I'll keep it. I don't hate it enough to go through all that trouble. :P

Keyboard and mouse work well. The windows key lock functionality is great. Only issue is that the F5 and Print Screen keys had streaks through the labels. It's a fairly minor cosmetic issue so it's not worth a return for us, but something to be aware of.
His gaming keyboard was pretty much finished after a few years, he's liking the setup of this one. One quirk is that it remains lit (one star off)

Keyboard keys are a little tough at first, but that's to be expected they just have to be worked in a little. I like that you can change the colors, individual keys lit up different colors would be nice but for the price it's understandable why that is not an option. The mouse is nice, easy to adjust speed which is good since my 4 year old needs a slower mouse while I like it to move faster for gaming. I do not like the texture of the mouse however and the left click button squeaks, if not for these two things in particular I would have given 5 stars :( but for the $35 I paid it's a pretty good combo.

For $35 this keyboard and mouse combo is definitely worth it. Its not a mechanical keyboard, but I wasn't expecting it to be for this price. The lights all work and there are a lot of different light options which is nice. I just keep it on red to match the mouse.If you're looking to spend under $40 then this is worth it for sure.
